title: DevOps Engineer
description:
About Capgemini 
  Capgemini is a diverse collective of more than 350,000 strategic and technological experts based across more than 50 countries, partnering with world-renowned clients to transform and manage their businesses. We are dedicated to leveraging cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering, and platforms to address the entire breadth of their business needs. This passion drives a powerful commitment - to unlock the true value of technology. 
  Over the last 18 months, we have tripled our business in Australia and New Zealand, with over 3,500 team members devoted to helping clients get the future they want. Now is the time to join our rapidly growing team who are at the forefront of finding new ways technology can help us reimagine what's possible, collecting unique career experiences with global brands and game-changing tech projects. 
  Let's talk about the role and responsibilities: 
  
  Execute Docker CMDS from Jenkins and create a CI/CD Pipeline with Jenkins 
  Execute Shell CMDS from Jenkins on remote server 
  Analyse business requirements, business processes, and technical architectures and designs 
  Define Testing methods and advise on best fit solutions and technique 
  Verify system performance and ensure formal sign off and documentation of successful integration 
  Assist in the construction and implementation aspects of delivery 
  
  Let's talk about your capability and experience: 
  
  Experience in Devops CICD with Jenkins & Python 
  Knowledge of Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery 
  Demonstrated understanding of underlying client or business problem and the ability to develop and support the solutions 
  Adjusts positively to situations that involve rapidly changing tasks, shifting priorities, simultaneous demands, or transitions into new assignments 
  Excellent communications skills to liaise with all levels of stakeholders 
  Be able to proactively work in a fast-paced environment and work both autonomoulsy and part of a team 
  
 Let's talk about what's in it for you! 
  We believe technology is about more than business transformation - it's also about building a more sustainable, inclusive future. This starts with our people, working with you to get the future you want. We invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and a safe place for our people to be themselves and truly belong. Through championing our staff-led community groups, we are committed to being active allies for everyone. We also aim to build an environment where you can thrive at work and at home. We champion remote working and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible' working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. In addition, we strive to ensure your growth and learning experience is unique with access to leading learning platforms, external certifications, and opportunities to grow and learn the way you want. Finally, we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution, and we're ruthlessly focused on sustainability for our clients and our business - committing to becoming a net zero business by 2030. 
  Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people from diverse minority backgrounds are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. At Capgemini, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply and tell us what you can bring to the role. 
  Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory, and regulatory requirements. 
  #GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.
  
  
  We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to responding to every applicant. 
  Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered. 
  #LI-SH2

title: DevOps Engineer for IDgital project
description:
Healthcare project 
 
 
  Australia, Southeast Asia 
  Middle, Senior 
 
 
  
   About the project 
    IDGITAL is Cloud Based SaaS application that manages orders for Radiologists and can resolve clients’ issues. Clients are hospitals and groups of hospitals that are situated in different countries around the world. 
    This product team develops a Node.js / Angular web application, the product is in the healthcare field. All deployments are containerized in a large distributed architecture. We have co-developed a Healthcare API with Google that is central to our solution. 
    The product has been developed from scratch and we already in the release phase, so the ready part is that something used by clients from different countries. We will increase in multiple times amount of clients soon, now we support around 200 facilities, soon this amount will be over 500. 
    Besides maintaining the product we are working on new custom and technical features, improving the performance of the platform, and a few new major milestones in progress, e.g. on-prem version for the current saas application, improving the mobile app (IOS, Android), integrating a few additional ways of receiving information from the hospitals. Also, we have a few subprojects based on IDGITAL architecture. 
    The Digital Assistant performs a variety of specific tasks on behalf of the physician, making it acceptable for the physician to focus solely on the current conditions of their patient. Along with the Digital Assistant ML platform offering end-to-end image and data processing, the radiologist gains quick access to more complete and accurate origin of information. 
    IDgital offers an end to end Radiology Solution that brings the power of modern computing technology to the field of Radiology in a meaningful way, while remembering that our goal is to always assist the radiologist, never to replace them. 
    Google Cloud Next ’19 | April 9-11 | San Francisco (presentation) — www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y-yvlt5mVXk 
    Team 
    55 people: 
    
    6 QA 
    3 AQA 
    30 Developers 
    8 DevOps 
    2 PM 
    3 BA 
    1 Designer 
    1 HR 
    1 PO 
    
   Team processes: 
    – As basic we are using standard git-flow but we added some minor changes to It. This change depends on our environments and our release process. The lifecycle of the developer’s tasks based on scrum (3 weeks sprints), ops team is working by kanban style 
    – We have a code review process by 8 BE and 3 FE experienced developers and a knowledge-sharing process for all team members weekly 
    – We have a bunch of various processes, some of them are main and some of them are added to make the life of the team and project better. Here is the list of basic ones: 
    
    Sprint Planning process 
    1 Daily stand up meeting per team 
    Sync meetings for QA team once per sprint 
    Sync meetings for FE and BE teams once per sprint 
    Retrospective process 
    Demo process 
    BA process for BA team 
    Hotfixes process for maintaining production 
    
   Technical details: 
    – For version control are used gitlab and CI/CD builds. Almost all deploys are automated 
    – Different kinds of testing: manual testing by the best QA team, UI testing by AQA (cypress), unit tests, API integration tests, functional tests, load tests using k6, microservice unit and integration tests 
    Now are improving coverage for all types of testing 
    – Google cloud and many google services (storage, pub/sub, healthcare, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes, firestore, logging, etc ) for infrastructure. Elastic as additional database 
    – Above 40 microservices 
    – Additional technologies details are: 
    
    Vision Machine Learning using TensorFlow 
    Loose coupling through PubSub Messaging 
    Auto-scaling microservices through Kubernetes 
    REST API and GRPC integrations 
    Cloud DataFlow for ETL 
    BigQuery for DW and analytics 
    Looker for reporting 
    Speech recognition development including model development 
    Google DialogFlow for IVR development 
    Distributed Cloud SQL Database 
    
   Technology stack 
    Google cloud platform, Node JS, Koa JS, Angular 7, PostgreSQL, Big Query, Dialog Flow, TensorFlow
    
    
    Role: 
    In the DevOps role you will be working under the direction of the Director of Technical Engineering using your experience to lead the design of the infrastructure and processes that enable our teams to exceed client requirements and scale to meet growing demand. 
    Additionally, you will drive the implementation of common services and tools to ensure system reliability and performance. The sharing of knowledge is important to us; so, as an experienced member of the team, you will share your expertise through mentoring and assisting fellow DevOps in their efforts to effectively contribute to a reliable, robust and flexible infrastructure. 
    Beyond the day-to-day, we are anticipating for you to take ownership of the DevOps infrastructure in supporting multiple product development teams and lead the team of 6 DevOps. Your experience with tools and approaches to simplifying things will help maximize the potential of our product development teams and reduce the time to market. Your passion for operational excellence and automation cannot go unnoticed and your obsession with data-driven decision making is contagious. 
    You will thrive in this position if you have a growth mindset, an eagerness to learn about new trends, tools, and technologies, and a willingness to give and receive feedback to elevate team performance. This position will resonate with those who have an interest in the healthcare industry, as well as novel technologies such as AI and advanced computing. 
   
 
 
  Minimum Qualifications: 
  
   5 years’ experience in the technical design and operations of DevOps practices on Public cloud 
   3 years’ experience leading Devops teams in provision of cloud infrastructure to software development and production operations. 
   The ability to isolate problems in complex systems and successfully resolve them 
   Proven knowledge of networking and security concepts 
  
 
 
  Preferred Qualifications: 
  
   Experience with the administration, provisioning, deployment, monitoring, and troubleshooting of cloud services 
   Excellent agile management skills 
   Strong communication and critical thinking skills 
   Excellent people and management skills in interacting with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams and third parties 
  
 
 
  Knowledge: 
  
   Knowledge of the emerging technologies surrounding DevOps in a cloud environment 
   Knowledge of how to set up user-friendly distributed batch processing systems 
   An interest and passion for IaaS and distributed computing patterns 
   Significant experience in the technical design and operations of DevOps practices 
   Experience with the administration, provisioning, deployment, monitoring, and troubleshooting of cloud services 
   Knowledge of the emerging technologies surrounding MLOps in a cloud environment 
  
 
 
  Tooling: 
  
   Experience with managing Kubernetes clusters 
   Experience with CI/CD and relevant tooling and automation (Jenkins, Github Actions, ArgoCD, Terraform etc.) 
   Expert fluency with at least one of the major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure), bonus if you have experience with more than one 
   Experience supporting production systems and networks 
   Experience deploying/managing monitoring solutions like ELK, Prometheus + Grafana 
   Strong knowledge and experience with containerization technologies like Docker, Containerd 
   Proficiency with Git or other source control tools 
  
 
 
  Your area of responsibility and growth: 
  
   Design, set up, and maintain scalable cloud infrastructure that can deliver healthcare products and services 
   Work with software development teams to build and maintain infrastructure to meet their needs and support their deliveries 
   Work with machine learning teams to build and maintain infrastructure for large-scale computing 
   Actively share knowledge of common tools and infrastructure by coaching your teammates 
   Participate in and inform the backend development of new healthcare products features 
   Assist IT with the improvement of company wide information security initiatives 
   Advise on resource requirements and provide technical leadership for DevOps efforts of developers and dedicated DevOps in the product team 
  
 
 
  Why join us:: 
  
   Work in a friendly high efficient team of professionals, interesting projects 
   Dynamic and challenging tasks 
   The ability to work remotely 
   Flexible working hours 
   Possibility of professional growth 
   Get a chance to work with the latest GCP services and technologies 
   Opportunity to join the IDGITAL product community of 300+ developers and DevOps worldwide 
   Opportunity to make a contribution to the medical area and help people around the world

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
09th March, 2023 
  We’re Cowry, the digital experiences team within Australian Payments Plus. Given we’re relatively new here, let’s start by introducing ourselves. AP+ is a family of cornerstone businesses you’d know; BPAY, eftpos, NPP, and while you haven't heard of ‘Cowry’ you probably have heard of a little digital wallet with over 1.5M customers called Beem which is just one of the products powered by us.  Our team love to explore new ground and challenge the status quo in the pursuit of fintech excellence. We live at the intersection of next-generation technology and traditional payments infrastructure, launching products from the ground up. Our mission is pretty simple; keep Australian payments open, keep businesses thriving and go beyond money.  Role @ Cowry We’re adding a Devops Engineer to our already thriving team where you will get to make meaningful contributions to the function and the team and work closely with other engineers, QA and solution Architects.  Key Responsibilities 
  
   Collaborate with developers to implement and maintain automated build, test, and deployment pipelines 
   Monitor and maintain infrastructure, including servers, storage, and networking, to ensure high availability, performance, and security. 
   Develop and maintain automation scripts for tasks such as configuration management, monitoring, and backups. 
   Troubleshoot issues with software applications and infrastructure and provide timely resolution. 
   Stay current with emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in DevOps and cloud computing. 
   
   
  Skills, Qualifications & Experience
   
  
   Knowledge of software development principles, such as agile methodologies and version control. 
   Knowledge of cloud computing platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud. 
   Knowledge of software development principles, such as agile methodologies and version control. 
   Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes. 
   Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. 
   Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  
   
   
   
  Life @ Cowry
   We strive to create an environment where every member of the team feels empowered to make a decision for the benefit of our customers.
   
   At Cowry, a growth mindset is fundamental to success. We are obsessed with data. It’s how we learn, ask better questions and improve. It allows us to take small bets, learn quickly (often by failing) and dust ourselves off. We believe that to fully embrace experimentation and failure as part of learning, it requires a culture where everyone feels safe enough to push beyond their own fears.
   
   You’ll thrive in Cowry if:
   
  
   You have an agile, entrepreneurial mindset & thrive in an environment where you can reimagine your contribution each and every day 
   The idea of working in a “start-up-esq” environment excites you (but you also sleep well at night knowing your job is secure) 
   You love to test the boundaries of your abilities and champion your colleagues to do the same 
   Your job title is just a point of reference for your LinkedIn profile, it doesn’t define who you really are 
   You’re curious at heart, always asking questions and looking for ways to improve 
  Cowry may not be the place for you if:
   
  
   You thrive when working in a hierarchical “clunky” environment 
   Your job title means the world to you and defines who you are 
   You love to work in pre-defined silo’s 
   To you, team & company culture is two dimensional
  
   
   
   
  What Next?
   For us, it’s more important that you are a genuinely decent human, as we believe people can pick up any skill with the right support & mindset.
   
   We consciously and intentionally hire from diverse professional and personal backgrounds. We work hard to build a wonderfully diverse team of individuals, measured not by numbers but by contribution and diversity of thinking.
   
  
   Submit your application for the role along with any other materials you’d want to share about yourself as a person or work you’re proud of 
   If we like your vibe, you’ll get a call from our Talent rep to make sure we’re on the same page about salary and role expectations 
   Once we get the admin out of the way, you’ll get a time booked in to meet the hiring manager so they can get to know you better 
   If you’ve made it this far (congrats!) you’ll have a final informal chat with the head of department or CEO 
   
   Either way, expect to get honest feedback from us along the way as we value it highly.
   
   
  The AP+ team values unique talents & we encourage applications from diverse community groups including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTIQ+, those with special needs and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
We're looking for someone who can join our engineering team to provide direction and setup DevOps capabilities in the function. 
   
   
  We're pretty remote-friendly, ideally looking for the candidate to be based within Australia or an APAC country that allows for a minimum of 5hr crossover collaboration time with the teams.
   
   Ideally you are someone with:
 
  
  Experience building and managing secure, highly available, cross-region, robust infrastructure in AWS. 
  Built knowledge of setting up, securing, managing, and monitoring containerised services using ECR/CES/EKS. 
  Experience using Terraform to automate the build and management of base infrastructure services. 
  Made extensive use of AWS (or equivalent cloud provider) technologies such as ALB, RDS, IAM, VPC, SNS, SQS. etc. 
  Experience in building and defining build and release pipelines using tools like Gitlab, Github Actions, Buildkit or equivalent. 
  Developed strong scripting skills with Python/go and bash Experience working with Linux environments. 
  Ideally, a background in software engineering would be a plus.
 
 
  Key Responsibilities
  
   Standardize SRE best practice. 
  Build and maintain reliable infrastructure pipelines, Working closely with software development to help optimize development workflow. 
  Identify relevant business metrics and implement real-time monitoring, alerting, trending and dashboarding. 
  Identify high ROI problems for remediation and cost savings/margin improvement. 
  Identify common issues and come up with solutions on how to reduce their impact or remove them altogether.
 
 
  Skills Knowledge and Expertise
  
   Expert level production AWS experience. 
  Strong understanding of SRE responsibilities. 
  Strong automation mindset. 
  A collaborator, who works for empowering other developers over control. 
  Strong understanding of monitoring and instrumentation. 
  Good awareness of security practices and relative industry compliance experience is a plus. 
  Good awareness of infrastructure cost (Cost reduction experience is a plus). 
  Software development experience, comfortable with multiple languages.
 
  
  What's in it for you?
  
   Opportunity to set up DevOps frameworks. 
  Work on a consumer facing app used by thousands of merchants and consumers. 
  As we grow, you grow - we will fast track your development with a career path that could lead to cross functional and international opportunities, if you're up for it! 
  Learning, learning, learning! 
  Ability to work on innovative tech and bring your ideas to life. 
  All the perks that come with being one of our early-stage employees! 
 
 
  If you are excited about working in a company at the forefront of innovation, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely high-performing team then we’d love to hear from you!

   Liven is the world's #1 engagement platform for restaurants, hospitality, venues & events. With end-to-end integrations across point-of-sale, ordering, payment and digital experiences, Liven is a growth engine that revolutionises how customers engage, pay and stay loyal through helping merchants take control of their customers, data and finance.
   
   A winner of Richard Branson's Extreme Tech Challenge for Blockchain and Digital Payments, Liven is an exceptionally unique, fast growing tech start-up rewriting the playbook for hospitality payments and loyalty. Join us on this mission and you won't look back.

title: Mobile DevOps Engineer
description:
What makes us, us
   
   
  Established in 1840, we’re Australia’s first member-owned wellbeing company, delivering health, wealth and care services to more than 700,000 Australians. Today, while we’ve grown to a company of nearly 7000 employees, our focus remains the same as it was 180 years ago — to deliver Real Wellbeing for our customers, members and the community.
   
   
  We support your Real Wellbeing so you can better support our members’ and customers’ wellbeing journey
   
   
  There are four key attributes that set us apart:
   
   
  
   Good people: We strive to set ourselves apart through the capability, warmth and expertise of our people. 
   Wellbeing experts: Our breadth of capability enables us to provide smart solutions and services across all domains of wellbeing. 
   Long-term commitment: As a member-owned company, we’ve been focusing on long-term outcomes and single-minded dedication to our members and customers since 1840. 
   Driving positive impact: Everything we do is focused on making a positive difference at a personal, community and societal level.
  
   
   
  These pillars are infused with our values of bold, warm and honest
   
   
  Our opportunity
   
   
  Work with staff across our business units to support existing mobile applications, both in house and vendor built.
   
   
  Support projects as they seek to deploy vendor provided mobile applications and look for opportunities to further expand the in house mobile application usage.
   
   
  Govern the use of mobile applications in Australian Unity and maintain our public app store presence.
   
  
  What you will do
   
  
  
   Participate in providing accurate estimations for work and take ownership to meet those estimations 
   Champion operational best practices by ensuring continuous improvement in our code bases, deployment pipelines and monitoring solutions. 
   Ensure relevant documentation is concise, fit for purpose and delivered timely to ensure business knowledge is captured appropriately 
   Take shared ownership in ensuring our mobile guidelines and best practices are up to date and fit for use 
   Mentor peers and juniors to assist in uplifting their capabilities and help ensure they deliver quality solutions 
   
  . 
  About you
   
   
  
   Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or related discipline 
   Understanding of Apple Human Interface Guidelines 
   Working knowledge of Android features, limitations and development methodologies 
   Experience in creating automated deployment pipelines, packaging and signing Android/iOS mobile applications 
   Working knowledge of documentation, coding, testing and deployment using multiple development languages and platforms 
   Demonstrable understanding of security best practices and track record of keeping up to date on latest threats and their mitigation 
   Strong problem-solving skills and ability to apply them in the role 
   Excellent interpersonal, communication and time management skills 
   Working knowledge of Agile software development
  
   
   
  Our Benefits  You will enjoy a range of great employee benefits and rewards including:
   
   
  
   Competitive Remuneration and variable bonus 
   A range of attractive product and service discounts from Australian Unity’s Retail and Wealth Management portfolio – including health insurance and banking products 
   Flexible Working Arrangements including Work-From-Home days with a real work-life balance 
   Available access to LinkedIn Learning courses through our great Learning platform 
   Additional paid Wellbeing and Volunteer leave days yearly
  
   
   
  Where to from here?
   
   
  Please contact Henry Reyes, Talent Acquisition Specialist, for a confidential discussion or more details – hreyes@australianunity.com.au. 
  Please note that all Australian Unity employees must be fully vaccinated for COVID 19. Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
About the job 
    
     Josef is a game-changing no-code automation platform. A wave of digital transformation is sweeping the legal industry, and we’re looking for a talented DevOps Engineer to join us for the ride. 
      We are a good bunch of people making great software. Our team is remote-first, globally diverse, smart, respectful and highly collaborative. Internal politics, resistance to change, long-winded approvals process, and endless meetings are all things that don’t describe how we don’t work. 
      We are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer to help us build functional systems that improve the customer experience. Someone who will be responsible for deploying product updates, helping identify production issues, building out CI/CD, delivery pipeline and implementing integrations that meet our customers’ needs. We are not looking for any Ninjas or Rockstars. You don’t need 3,000 years’ experience in Web 3.0 or a PHD in Rocket Surgery. 
      To learn more about life at Josef, check out this page. 
      What you’ll do 
     
      Building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure 
      Working on ways to automate and improve development and release processes 
      Testing and examining code written by others and analyzing results 
      Ensuring that systems are safe and secure 
      Identifying technical problems and developing software updates and ‘fixes’ 
      Working with the team to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended 
      Planning out projects and being involved in project management decisions 
     
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    Who is Josef? 
    
     The law doesn’t work. (Well, it doesn’t work for everyone.) Globally, more than 5 billion people don’t have access to legal services. 
      Why does this matter? 
      If people don’t get access to the legal help they need, they face worse outcomes in life, whether they’re negotiating with their landlord, disputing a public transport fine, or doing their tax. 
      At Josef, this is the problem we spend every day trying to fix. We do this through our beautifully designed no-code automation platform, empowering lawyers to transform the way they work. 
      Our customers include some of the biggest law firms in the world, small suburban firms, in-house lawyers at multinational corporations, and legal aid and community organisations. 
     
   
  
 
 
 
  
   
    Our ideal candidate 
    
     The following list is not exhaustive. Our aim is to hire people who can grow with us. 
      
      Problem-solving attitude 
      BSc in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant industry experience 
      Experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar software engineering role 
      Good knowledge of Terraform, Docker and Kubernetes 
      Python, Typescript/Javascript 
      Google Cloud Platform or AWS experience 
      Proficient with git and git workflows 
      Solid working knowledge of databases and SQL 
      Experience working at a startup or scaleup a nice to have 
      Experience with Playwright and Pulumi a nice to have 
     
    
   
   
    What we look for in future Josefites 
    
     We’re passionate about our culture, here’s a glimpse into what we strive for as a team: 
      
      Passion to make legal services more accessible and the world a better place 
      Adventurers! Josefites are ambitious, brave and hungry 
      Desire to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, rapidly changing start-up environment 
      Proud Nerds – a hunger for knowledge and a keen appetite to learn 
      People who don’t take themselves too seriously, but who care deeply about others 
      Open minds, a sense of fun, and desire to bring your authentic self to work every day 
     
    
   
   
    Our perks and benefits 
    
     To support you to do your best work our perks and benefits include a Josef day off once a month, an annual education budget, and so much more. 
     
   
  
 
 
  
   
    What to expect 
    
     
      Competitive market wages 
      A supportive and inclusive working environment 
      The chance to work with a clever, engaged and lovely team of people! 
      Learning and development policy and budget 
      Wellbeing policy and budget 
      A flexible workplace and the ability to work from anywhere 
      A work environment that is challenging, dynamic, creative and independent 
      The autonomy to help us determine the future direction of the company 
      Clear OKRs and goals 
      Regular check-ins with the executive team to discuss your progress 
     
    
   
  
 
 
 
  
   
    Submit your application 
    
     If you think you’d be a good fit then we’d love to have a chat! 
      Please have your CV ready to upload

title: Junior DevOps Engineer
description:
Job Title
       
      
     
    
   
  
  Junior DevOps Engineer
 
  Purpose of the role 
 
 The Junior DevOps Engineer will be responsible dealing with multiple urgent situations at a time and must be extremely flexible. Responsibilities will also include deploying product updates, identifying production issues and implementing integrations that meet customer needs. You will be expected to automate operational processes fast, accurately and securely and take great pride in your work. The DevOps Engineer will also be responsible to plan, setup and configure cloud infrastructure for new projects.
 
  Main Responsibilities 
 
 
  Project Planning
   
  
   Participate in the processes of strategic project-planning meetings
   Providing guidance and expertise on system options, risk, impact and costs vs. benefits
   Create and share operational requirements and development forecasts to allow for timely and accurate planning of projects
  
 
 
 
   Development
   
  
   Responsible for maintaining and supporting IT solutions
   Install and configure solutions, implement reusable components, translate technical requirements, assist with all stages of test data, develop interface stubs and simulators and perform script maintenance and updates
  
 
 
 
   Deployment
   
  
   Build automated deployment procedures through the use of configuration management technology
   Deploy new modules and upgrades and complete fixes within the production environment
   Create modules ready for production, which entails moving them according to specific procedures and documenting knowledge transfer
  
 
 
 
   Maintenance and Troubleshooting
   
  
   Routine application maintenance tasks are an ongoing responsibility
   Create requirements and procedures for implementing routine maintenance
   Troubleshooting existing information systems for errors and resolving those errors
  
 
 
 
   Infrastructure setup and Maintenance:
   
  
   Design and implement infrastructure on AWS for new projects.
   Assist in the maintenance and troubleshooting during high severity incidents on these environments.
   Be available as an escalation point according to a standby roster in order to maintain customer operations.
  
 
 
  Experience Required
 
 
   Tertiary qualifications (or equivalent) in a relevant discipline from College or University.
   Industry experience essential, Amadeus knowledge preferred.
   Coding experience essential
   2 to 5 years experience in DevOps / Cloud Development.
   Coding in different languages for the purpose of IT Robotics / Automation.
   Comprehensive knowledge of the products and functionality of ICM Products and Solutions.
   Track record of providing excellent operational support to end-users for a minimum of 2 years.
 
 
  Diversity & Inclusion
 
  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and seek to hire the best candidate regardless of age, beliefs, disability, ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Employment Type: Permanent Full Time 
  Position Classification: Health Manager Level 2 
  Remuneration: $102,640.00 - $121,739.00 per annum plus 10.5% superannuation 
  Hours Per Week: 38 
  Location: Flexible work options include a mix of work from home and from one of our offices based in Chatswood or Parramatta 
  Requisition ID: REQ383269 
  
 About us 
 eHealth NSW enables patient-centred care in NSW by providing technology services which connect people, data and systems. We partner with health agencies and the technology sector to provide a digitally enabled and integrated health system for patients, clinicians and the NSW community. Focus areas for eHealth NSW include core clinical systems, infrastructure, security, workforce and business management systems, data and analytics as well as digital innovation. 
 If you would like to learn more about eHealth NSW, visit our website. 
 About the role 
 eHealth NSW is transitioning IT infrastructure from on-premise to the cloud to provide greater scalability, flexibility, sustainability and innovation to ICT services across NSW Health. We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to help maintain, deploy and manage cloud infrastructure and workloads. Reporting into the Cloud Operations Manager a key aspect for the role will be to ensure a high-quality level of security, resiliency, stability including cost and performance optimization for the clinical integration applications delivered by NSW Health. The broader aspects include business roadmap activities including migration, transformation and maintenance of technology services workloads 
 We have the systems and policies in place to support flexible working, which may include a mix of working from home and / or in one of our offices. 
 Take a look at the POSITION DESCRIPTION for more role information including the selection criteria. 
 About you 
 The skills, knowledge and experience we are looking for in you include: 
 
  Experience and/or qualifications with systems operations of application or infrastructure services, including documentation, in a large and complex shared services environment 
  Moderate level skillset with Scripting, Version control and any other Code based experience. 
  Demonstrated ability to work with provider and platform services including, but not limited to Microsoft Active Directory, Citrix Virtual Apps & Desktops and Networking / Firewall components as well as knowledge of Windows, Linux, Database, Storage and Backup in cloud environments 
  Experience and knowledge with server administration in a complex enterprise environment including patch management, file share management, website hosting and Anti-virus 
  Demonstrated relevant experience in Incident, Change and Event management processes and technologies as aligned with ITIL methodologies including fault finding and liaising with stakeholders during a critical event 
  Demonstrated ability to liaise with management, vendors, partners and customers both internal and external to eHealth. 
  
 Why join eHealth NSW 
 People join eHealth for a range of reasons: 
 
  Work towards bettering the lives of patients in NSW 
  We are one of the largest technology services organisations in the southern hemisphere and partner with key players in the sector 
  We offer a range of formal and informal training programs in both management and technical skills for staff at all levels 
  Benefits include flexible work arrangements, well-being programs, a range of paid and unpaid leave, financial salary packaging and annual leave loading 
  
 Visit our careers page for more information. 
 We are diverse and inclusive 
 We are committed to having a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and provide a culturally safe work environment in line with NSW Health’s Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging Statement of Commitment. We actively recruit people from diverse backgrounds to build a supportive and inclusive workplace. 
 Visit our Diversity and Inclusion page for more information, or contact our Aboriginal Workforce team or our Access and Inclusion team for support. 
 How to apply 
 To start your application, click the APPLY FOR JOB button at the top. 
 To be considered for this position, you will need to attach your resume and detail your experience, knowledge and capabilities in written responses to the Targeted Questions detailed below in the questionnaire and then submit your application. 
 
  Provide a specific example of where you had to support or resolve a major issue in an enterprise application in a large and complex environment 
  Provide an example where you developed a script or other code. What problem were you solving and for who? 
 
 For role related queries or questions contact Michael Ormerod on Michael.Ormerod@health.nsw.gov.au. 
 Applications close: Sunday 19 March 2023 
 All NSW Health workers are required to have completed a primary course of a COVID-19 vaccine which has been approved or recognised by the Therapeutics Goods Administration (TGA). Additionally, Category A workers are required to receive a booster dose three months after completing the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations. New applicants must have completed the vaccination course prior to commencement with NSW Health, or provide an approved medical contraindication certificate (IM011 immunisation medical exemption form) certifying the worker cannot have any approved COVID-19 vaccines available in NSW. Acceptable proof of vaccination is the Australian Immunisation Register (AIR) Immunisation History Statement or AIR COVID-19 Digital Certificate. Booster doses are highly recommended for all health care workers who have completed the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations. 
 Only candidates with current Australian work rights (Australian citizens, permanent residents, NZ citizens with a current passport, valid work visa) will be considered. 
 Please note, pursuant to the Award which governs the employment conditions of this role, 'Exempt' is defined as a fixed term contract with a length greater than 13 weeks. 
 
 
  .

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Our Mission to be Bold and Impactful
  
  
   Get the opportunity to work with new technologies and experiment with different architectures.
   Our supportive environment makes it a pleasure to come to work every day.
   Join a high growth organization
  
  
  
    How you contribute
  
  
    This role is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic and talented individual to contribute to the development of cutting edge robotic mapping and analytics systems. You will be contributing to and maintaining the build, test, and development processes and infrastructure, and driving improvements in our development process. 
  
 
 
  
   Here’s what we need
   
    
      Contribute to and maintain CI/CD build processes.
      Contribute to and maintain build, test (SIL & HIL) and development infrastructure.
      Drive the process for improving code quality (static analysis, linting, dashboards and automated reports, and other tools).
      Engage effectively with team members and other stakeholders.
      Contribute to and maintain relevant documentation.
    
   
  
  
 
  
   How you’ll succeed
   
    
      University qualifications in Software Engineering, Computer Science or related field.
      Proficient with CI/CD environments
      Proficient with git, git workflows and their automation
      Experience working on Linux based infrastructure including package management
      Experience developing software in a commercial context, with Python, Java or similar
      Excellent communication skills, and a high level of self motivation.
    
   
  
  
 
  
   The added perks
   
    
      Get a competitive remuneration package including superannuation + commission package.
      Participate in our employee share option scheme (Equity).
      Work alongside a friendly and passionate team on cutting edge technology! - We know that our success and growth is a result of our motivated and inspiring teams.
      Take up our genuine learning and development opportunities.
      Settle into our great work environment and facilities.
      Chill out and enjoy our loaded kitchen facilities with games, snacks, drinks, fresh fruit and coffee machine provided.
      Enjoy the flexibility to work from home a few days of the week and our greatly appreciated meeting free Wednesdays.
      Take advantage of our office location in Milton - Enjoy the bustling cafes and tasty food options available!
      Join in on our fun work events and activities such as 'Funky shirt Fridays!', 'Coffee Club!' and 'Emesent Radio'.
      Take up our paid parental leave.
      Work in comfort with a casual dress code.
      Utilise our secure bike storage and shower facilities offered on-site.
      Take part in our generous employee referral scheme.
      Centralised in Brisbane, we offer moving assistance to help you relocate and join our collaborative workplace.
    
   
  
  
 
  
   Who Are We?
  
  
    Emesent has built a reputation as the key leader in automating data collection in challenging environments. Our award-winning technology, Hovermap, utilises innovative hardware, advanced algorithms and machine learning to automate collection and analysis of the physical world. Customers are able to acquire data in GPS-denied environments gaining insights that were not possible before. Our rapidly growing customer base are in the fields of mining, infrastructure and survey & mapping.
  
  
  
    Starting from a humble vision in Brisbane, Australia, with deep connections to Australia's globally recognised CSIRO, Emesent has made an emerging name for itself across the Globe and is successfully becoming a world leader in this unique industry of autonomous technology!
  
  
  
    At Emesent we pride ourselves on the way our people operate, we embrace diversity and equal opportunity, and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds.
  
  
    Our global talents are a cut above the rest who are at the top of their game, thriving in a collaborative environment. The work culture here is inclusive with the perfect balance of delivering results and pushing the boundaries all whilst having a little fun!

title: Product Manager - Visibility
description:
About Kasada
 
 
 
   Join us in stopping bad bots, for good! Kasada protects millions of online users everyday. Founded to stop automated bot attacks, we believe the internet should be a safe place for everyone. Bad bots are highly destructive. They take over accounts, steal content, overload systems and infrastructure and cause billions of dollars in damages every year. Seeking to restore trust in the internet, Kasada stops bots at the very first request including those that have never been seen before.
 
 
 
   We’ve grown from a few friends working out of a shipping container under the Sydney Harbour Bridge to now operating globally, we’re spread across the world protecting some of the most well-known brands on the face of the earth.
 
 
 
   We’re an innately curious team that’s not afraid to bring bold ideas to create better ways of solving problems. We’re looking for people who are passionate about solving some of the most difficult and pressing cybersecurity issues, while having fun doing it!
 
 
 
   The Role 
 
 
  
 
  Do you enjoy immersing yourself in products that deliver amazing experiences and ultimately positively impact not just those who use them but internet security as we know it?
 
 
 
   We’re looking for a Product Manager who can define the next generation of our troubleshooting, log analysis and data. Our customers rely on us to defend some of the most highly trafficked applications in the world.
 
 
 
   In this role you will deliver customers unprecedented visibility into their traffic across billions of requests per day. A core focus of this role will be in the delivery of groundbreaking analytics tools. You’ll look for ways to take raw data and surface key insights. Whether that be helping our customers make use of our data in new or interesting ways or helping them understand the detail of an attack mitigated by Kasada.
 
 
  Day to day you will: 
 
  Become the ‘oracle’ of data at Kasada by building a deep understanding of all aspects of data generated and used by Kasada customers, as well as internal teams
   Gain a deep understanding of the needs of product teams that build on top of our platforms, and make them a reality
   Identify and fill product gaps across the visibility product area
   Go deep! Define problem statements and feature requirements with clarity, then drive the solution
   Work closely with the rest of the product management team to ensure tight coordination of visibility initiatives that impact product goals
   Work closely with engineering teams to deliver fantastic features
   Make difficult priority and trade-off decisions to ensure successful launches
   Evangelise improvements internally and externally to ensure users benefit from these
 
  What you bring;
 
   A highly analytical skill set and tendency to think big
   Prior experience delivering software products (ideally customer facing analytics products - preferred but not essential)
   Experience prioritising opportunities, defining features, and launching capabilities that meet the needs of customers and the business
   A passion for data, combined with a systems-thinking approach
   Excellent communication - you make the complex easy to understand
   Awesome collaboration - you are experienced at working with and influencing teams to deliver positive impact 
 
 
  The Benefits of being a Kasadian
 
 
 
   We want to ensure Kasada remains a great place to work and a place to do great work. It's important to us to build an inclusive environment where you can realize your full potential. We are a highly collaborative team regardless of location, placing a strong emphasis on our core values; and we have designed our benefits package so you can thrive, both inside and outside of work:
 
 
 
   A stake in Kasada’s global success with equity/stock options
 
 
   - Flexible working hours and arrangements - Create a schedule that suits you
 
 
   - Support for growing families - Generous parental leave allowances and return to work coaching
 
 
   - Resources for well-being to support your growth including our EAP - confidential counseling for you and your loved ones
 
 
  An action packed calendar of fun in-person and virtual events
  New Macbooks for all!
 
 
   - Pet friendly offices - We love all Kasadians, whether they have two, four, or more legs!
 
 
 
   Sound interesting? What’s next?
 
 
 
   Hit the apply button and one of our team will set up an exploratory, confidential discussion. We have designed our hiring process to be streamlined and thorough so everyone can make the right call on whether it is the right move for you. We are an inclusive team and this extends to all candidates that interview with us. Interviews are conducted virtually however if you want to come onsite - just ask! When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any adjustments you may need during the interview process, we want to ensure you are set up for success in every conversation.
 
 
 
   Still with us? Just a little bit more…
 
 
 
   Research shows that women and other marginalized individuals tend to only apply when they check every box. We’re always keen to broaden our perspective, so if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point above, please still get in touch, we'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great addition to the team!

title: Product Manager (Technical) | Onboard Personalise - Brisbane
description:
Description
  Product Manager of Get Onboard & Personalise leads the cross functional team to ensure the team delivers service and platform experiences that delight our customers as they try to get onboard and then use our platform over time. You are a strategic thinker yet detail-oriented technical product manager with the ability to define solutions that go beyond the needs of the last customer you spoke with and can define and prioritise solutions that solve problems for a broad market segment / across the variety of verticals we work in. 
 Key Responsibilities:
  What you will work on
  As a Product Manager for Get Onboard and Personalise, you will help define and drive the strategy and roadmap for our customers/users as they onboard and use the platform - critically making the experience frictionless, making them feel supported and like the platform is their home for supply chain management. This includes interfacing and designing the onboarding experience with our product marketing and operational / sales focussed teams. A key part will also be working on the technical solutions that connect our platform end-to-end including our CRM and billing functions, as these will tie-into this seamless experience.   Our users come from a variety of different industries and have a wide ranges of roles within these industries and on the platform, so part of this role is also about helping to manage the access levels and role definition within the platform in close collaboration with our technical team. YOu will also help design the experience ensuring our customers are educated so that adoption is smooth. 
 You will be adept at working to serve a number of distinct customer types - in this case the customer you need to serve includes both our platform users and our internal teams. A key part of the role will be working closely with the technical team to define a strategy around aspects as they relate to buy / build decisions in this space. As this is a new role, you will have a critical hand in shaping this function within the company. We hope you will be invigorated by the idea of wearing a number of hats, and adeptly navigating the ambiguity that arises from dealing with a complex product domain as part of your day-to-day
  In this role, you will collaborate closely with other members of the product management team, Engineering, DevOps, Strategic Partnerships, Sales, Customer Support and other internal and external stakeholders. Learning from and discussions with our potential partners and customers will be an essential part of the role.
  
   Develop the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for Everledger Get Onboard and Personalise including our capabilities and toolsets; communicating both the business value and technical rationale behind your recommendations. 
  Understand the needs of our customer base including their product lifecycle experiential needs to develop a strategy and execution plan for getting onboard and personalising, and driving improvements to the experience with our sales, commercial, product and engineering teams 
  Be the subject matter expert for Everledger Platform account access, authorisation, management and personalisation 
  Develop internal training materials and programs to enable our Sales and Customer Success, Product and Technical teams to understand our solutions. 
  Translate business requirements into user stories for our development teams. 
  Lead User Acceptance Testing activities to ensure requirements have been satisfied. 
  Partner closely with other product leaders and cross functional internal stakeholders to drive joint planning, execution, and success. 
  Meet project deliverables on tight timelines. 
  Assist with contract review and sync with project requirements 
 
 Requirements
  2+ years in a Product Role, delivering technical products to enterprises or similarly complex customers. Experience in customer experience design with an ability to translate the complex to the simple will be highly regarded. 
 You are just as comfortable speaking with Engineers as you are in speaking with end-users or participating in sales calls, or diving in and drawing process / experience maps / diagrams. Everledger is looking for a product manager with a passion for creating wonderful experiences backed with a strong technical knowledge and first-class communication skills to define and direct the development of our critical customer onboarding and personalisation experience across our portfolio of products.
  Desirable
  Deep demonstrable experience working with developers to define technical data-related products/ capabilities, preferably within a SaaS company. 
 Demonstrated experience in establishing product plans and roadmaps based on prioritization of opportunities, deep understanding of customer needs, and the organization’s ability to execute.
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  Experience working on product teams with competing priorities and aggressive timelines.
  Comfortable in front of customers and curious about their pain points.
  Excellent project management, multi-tasking, organizational, and customer service skills.
  Proven ability to understand complex business and technical concepts and to be able to make good judgement when faced with trade-offs.
  Ability to work independently and to maintain tight deadlines.
  BS/BA degree. Major in Computer Science preferred.
  Agile SCRUM Product Owner or Scrum Master certification preferred
  Benefits
  
  Wellness Budget - An annual allowance to invest in your physical and mental well-being. 
  Learning and Development - When our people develop, so do we. We offer an internal learning program, study leaves, and sabbaticals to support your further education. 
  Shares - We have incredibly loyal employees and we reward that loyalty in our ESOP scheme. 
  Flexible Working - Employees have the freedom to optimize their own work schedules. This includes the ability to work from home and time off in lieu. 
  Health insurance 
  Birthday leave - An additional day off each year to kick back and celebrate your birthday! 
  Social Events - We might work hard, but we never forget to spend time together, celebrating our wins, and having fun
 
   Equal Opportunities
  It is Everledger’s policy to provide equal employment opportunities to every applicant, regardless of age, sex, marriage & civil partnership, race, disability, religion or belief, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy & maternity. We celebrate diversity and are committed to providing an inclusive culture for every employee.
  Disability Confident Committed
  Everledger is also Disability Confident Committed, which means we commit to providing opportunities for those with disabilities, including interviewing all applicants with a disability who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy and consider them on their abilities. Please let us know on your application form if this applies to you.
  IMPORTANT: If you require accommodations or adjustments to our standard application or any stage of the recruitment process, we encourage you to make us aware so that we can support you through each stage of your application.
  Right to work
  Please ensure you are applying for a role in a region where you have full rights to work in. Unfortunately at this time, Everledger, is unable to aid staff who require support obtaining a work-visa.

title: Associate Product Manager
description:
Company: Amplified Intelligence Location: Australia (Remote) Reports to: Product Manager Amplified Intelligence are currently looking for an Associate Product Manager to join our product team to help build competitive products in a fast paced, high impact environment. From analysing customer trends & industry trends to evaluating customer feedback and guiding the development team, the Associate Product Manager is an advocate of building the right product, and building it right. The Role The Associate Product Manager will work with product development teams to discover and develop new features for SaaS products. They are passionate about the intersection of strategy, user experience, and technology, and are in love with the problem, rather than obsessing over a solution. Their duties will centre around advocating as the voice of the customer, as well as ensuring that the product is well-supported. To achieve this, the Associate Product Manager will be working across multiple teams and disciplines in a wide range of subject matters, such as supporting customers and synthesising feedback, engaging in product discovery, assisting with the product vision and strategy, analysing product metrics, feature prioritisation and definition with product engineering, and more. Key Responsibilities Reporting to the Product Manager and working collaboratively with the product development teams to meet delivery milestones. Product ownership with research & discovery, feature definition, backlog refinement, prioritisation, defect management, and release planning. Translating product requirements into technical specifications in collaboration with the product engineering team. Synthesising insights and making product recommendations via web analytics, market & consumer trends, and user interviews. Manage internal and external stakeholders regarding the product, its upcoming features and roadmap, feedback, and status. Skills and Experience 2-3 years of professional experience in product or equivalent experience Experience building web products - a strong understanding of SaaS-products, APIs, microservices architectures, and cloud infrastructure. Experience working in a large, fast-paced customer-centric organisation. Comfortable in high pressure environments. Experience in product practices and frameworks such as experimentation, product discovery, jobs to be done, personas, visioning, prioritisation, design thinking, journey mapping, and more. Experience in the advertising industry (desirable) Experience working with a high-performing team of software engineers using agile software development practices including Scrum and Kanban. Strong business sense to analyse industry trends and competitive landscape Ability to maintain strong customer relation and provide product support
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to lead conversations and workshops. Passion for Amplified Intelligence's mission Culture Join an innovative and global organisation with exciting company goals who strive for an in-depth impact on media trading. Amplified Intelligence values Rigour, Agility and Warmth - we move quickly, look outside our comfort zone, build credible solutions, embrace problem solving, care about the larger impact our work has on the world and treat all others with respect and kindness. We have an enviable client portfolio, admirable leadership, and a fresh outlook in a positive attention economy. Small and Global at the sametime. Competencies Conceptual thinking: Ability to find effective solutions by taking a holistic, abstract, or theoretical perspective. title: Manager of Product Design and Innovation, Health
description:
23731 | Product Management | Professional | Non-Executive | Allianz Partners | Full-Time | Permanent
 
  
  
 
 
  Location: Australia
 
  
  
 
  Role Purpose:
 
  
  
 
  Reporting to the Head of Product Management & Innovation for Health, the Product Design and Innovation Manager will work to develop a strategic market management plan, review the products, perform a competitive analysis and identify relevant segmentation to map out new opportunities and execute the PM&I future product strategy.
 
  
  
 
  You'll work on the end-to-end development of the products and go-to-market strategies, supporting a range of internal stakeholders to identify new and innovative opportunities for the market and our existing contracts. The Health line of business aims to support the end customer when they need it the most.
 
  
 
 
  The Product Management and Innovation team aims to further grow the Health line of business by activating new distribution channels and developing new products and innovative partnerships for our partners and members.
 
  
  
 
  Duties and Responsibilities include:
 
  
  
 
  As the Product Design and Innovation Manager, you are responsible for:
 
  
  
 
  Monitoring trends and competitive developments for services in the Australian and adjacent markets, focusing on Health. 
  Monitoring existing portfolios and determining white spots and untapped market needs. 
  Developing and enhancing products to target new market segments or enhance value propositions in existing segments. 
  Support the end-to-end research and product innovation development to enhance our market position and share. 
  Leading the local implementation of new products and services. 
  Support the prospecting of new partnerships through market intelligence and innovations and the growth of new products with existing partners. 
  Monitoring customer satisfaction and product utilisation and deducting improvement in customer experience. 
  Supporting the sales channels in their approach to new or existing clients. 
  Developing and executing with the senior advisor of Product Management and Innovation a B2B and B2B2C marketing campaigns to activate customer relationships and foster product utilisation with a strong focus on ROMI. 
  Sharing best practices from the Australian market with the global product management and innovation team. 
  Support global projects to foster the positioning of Allianz Partners. 
  Translate strategy into deliverable initiatives with clear roles and responsibilities. 
  Advocating for key compliance processes associated with the development and delivery of all products and marketing within the Health. 
  A hands-on approach to the PM&I health team demands as they arise.
 
  
  
 
 
  As the successful candidate you'll be able to show experience:
 
  
  
 
  University degree in business administration, healthcare, research, marketing or relevant experience in the market 
  5+ years’ experience in product development, innovation, and market intelligence, ideally in the financial service industry 
  Experience in Insurance or Assistance Business preferred 
  Strong communication and presentation skills 
  Interest in innovation and digitalisation of the customer experience/ offers 
  A strong writer to communicate effectively to our partners across multiple channels 
  High level of customer orientation 
  A high degree of self-organisation, independence, ownership, team spirit and decisiveness 
  Experience influencing and delivery to support key projects
 
 


 
  Job Level: 
  
   Professional 
  
 
 
  Location: 
  
   
    
     Brisbane, QLD, AU, 4000 
    
   
  
 
 
  Available until: 
  
   31/03/2023 
  
 
 
  Area of Expertise: 
  
   Product Management 
  
 
 
  Unit: 
  
   Allianz Partners 
  
 
 
  Employing Entity: 
  
   AWP Australia Pty Ltd 
  
 
 
  Job Type: 
  
   Full-Time 
  
 
 
  Remote Job: 
  
   Hybrid working 
  
 
 
  Employment Type: 
  
   Permanent

   23731

title: Product Manager (Bookipi)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Digital Product Manager to lead the product delivery for Bookipi. Bookipi has grown 10x in the last year and we need your skills to continue to scale. 
      You will oversee all of Bookipi’s product needs from development to release. In conjunction with the leadership team you will execute on the Bookipi product strategy. You will gather data, create product roadmaps, and work with project managers and developers to prioritise launches. You will take ownership of the success of the Bookipi product. 
      We are a Remote First company and allow full Work From Home. 
      Key Actions & Duties 
      
       Translate business strategy into product strategy 
       Own the product roadmap 
       Execute product strategy 
       Drive action throughout the organization to get products to market 
       Plan and carry out product launches 
       Manage all aspects of in-life products, including customer feedback, requirements, and issues 
       Become an expert with respect to our competition 
       Perform product demos to internal team and external customers 
       
      Skill & Experience Requirements 
      
       Examples and at least one sample of an effective document delivered in the past 
       Minimum of 3 years experience as a Digital Product Manager, Product Manager, or Project Manager 
       Demonstrated success in defining and launching excellent products 
       Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
       Bachelor’s degree 
       Technical background, with experience in B2B digital products 
       Excellent teamwork skills 
       Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority 
       Experience with ClickUp, Asana, Monday, Jira, Trello, or similar task allocation software 
       
      About you 
      You have proven experience in all phases of the product process including user research, competitive assessment, roadmap development, and prioritisation of product launches. 
      You have a desire to build something great that makes a positive impact on our users. 
      You have the ability to effectively execute designated sprint schedules. 
      You possess strong communication skills and work well with diverse teams. 
      
     
      
       
        
         Job Category: Product 
        
        
         Job Type: Full Time 
        
        
         Job Location: Remote Remote - Australia

title: Regional Product Manager APAC
description:
At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation 
 The Solutions Owner is a key role in the newly established Center of Excellence for Engineering (CoEE) of Hitachi Energy Grid Edge Solutions, that design and supply green energy solutions, from microgrids to utility scale, based on Battery Energy Storage Systems. The Solutions Owner will be responsible of the improvement and maintenance of the internal HW and SW engineering standards for solutions, processes and tools and he/her will support Project Engineering in specific customer projects design, approving the delivered client solutions. The Solutions Owner will support the Sales and Tendering process by ensuring that GES’ application platforms are offered in consistently and that adaptations based on customer requests meet regulatory and internal standards. Finally, the Solutions Owner serves as premier voice of customer towards the product management team and is a key junction point towards Product Management in suggesting needed developments to the application platform. 
 Your responsibilities 
 
  The Solutions Owner will deliver guidelines and specification of optimized solutions, processes, and tools to improve basic and detail engineering phases speed and quality. The Solutions Owner will be responsible to deliver specifications of standard system solutions to be used in project delivery by the OU’s. The Solutions Owner will collect and share lessons learned and best practice. The Solution Owner will manage the Systems Field Certification activities in coordination with the other organizations. 
  Prospecting & Bidding - Will work closely with the Regional Tender Specialist and Engineering Specialists and will be responsible for approving practical & applicable solution for client ensuring that technical requirements are met and fit with HE portfolio. Ensures proper control solution to meet client’s and regulatory functionality requirements. Responsible for technical risk analysis of tender/project and identifying mitigation plans. 
  Negotiation - Will be responsible for ensuring that the offered solution comply with regulations and will support accuracy of cost calculation and planning. 
  Maintains compliance with health, safety and environmental regulations while monitoring and reporting progress and results. Assesses risks and safety hazards and implements plans to ensure people and equipment safety. 
  Drives application and development of best practice across the entire value chain to promote a culture of excellence in operational performance. Contributes to continuous improvement initiatives within the GES CoEE teams. Works closely with Engineering Specialists, other GES organizations, and sub suppliers to optimize and improve overall solutions. 
  Leverages support from Regional Tender Specialists, Engineering Specialists, the Hubs’ delivery/execution teams and INOPC Support to develop specification of systems and solutions to meet customer needs. 
  Manage the Design Reviews included in the Tendering and Project delivery Processes. 
  Guides, motivates and trains other Solution Owners. 
 
 Your background 
 
  Bachelor's degree in Engineering. 
  At least 8-10 years of experience with specific engineering expertise in developing Power Systems, Smart Grid, Microgrid and BESS (Battery Energy Storage Systems). 
  Experience in Modular/containerized/building solutions delivery on large scale EPC projects. 
  Very strong technical background in the power engineering or energy industry. 
  Experience in Automation/control solution for Battery Energy Storage System. 
  Field experience in installation, commissioning, designing and/or procuring power storage systems is desirable. 
  Experience and mindset on customer satisfaction. 
  Rigorous and attention to detail while having maturity and a profound understanding of power engineering principles to comprehend complex electrical, mechanical, and electronic systems. 
  Problem solving, open minded, resolute, open to discussion. 
  Comfortable to work in a very dynamic delivery environment in a challenging market. 
  Connecting with other people easily, focus on “getting the job done and done right”, teamwork, leadership, negotiation skills. 
  English language (fluent) is a must. 
 
 More about us 
 Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible and secure whilst balancing social, environmental and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 40,000 people in 90 countries and generate business volumes of approximately $10 billion USD. www.hitachienergy.com
  
 
  Publication date
   
 
 2023-03-06
  
 
  Reference Number
   
 
 
  AU54650541_E2
