title: Product Manager | Minerals & Renewable Energy - Brisbane
description:
Description
  The Product Manager - Minerals and Renewable Energy leads the cross functional Everledger team to deliver experiences that solve a real world problem for our clients, generating business and operational value to Everledger and our customers in the Minerals and Renewable Energy industries. You are a strategic, commercial product manager with the ability to define solutions that go beyond the needs of the last customer you spoke with and can define and prioritise solutions that solve problems for a broad market segment. We’re looking for someone who has a real passion for supporting customers in the key industries that underpin the global transition to clean energy as they work across their supply chains to increase transparency, ESG practices and outcomes.
  Key Responsibilities:
  What you will work on
  As the Product Manager for Minerals and Renewable Energy, you will help define and drive the strategy and roadmap for this set of growing yet critical industries - helping us further our goal in this area to support a transparent and sustainable approach to the energy transition for our customers as they work across their supply chains. 
 This role will directly be responsible for the profitable growth and adoption of the Everledger platform across the broad industries of Minerals and Renewable Energy. You’ll ensure close alignment between our product and service offerings for these industries and our key strategic direction across all industries we work in. You will do this by ensuring you develop and champion a view of the current and desired end-to-end user experience across key user segments within these industries; and working collaboratively with your colleagues in our product management team to align our capability and capacity with market expectations. 
 In this role, you will collaborate closely with other members of the product management team, Engineering, Strategic Partnerships, Sales and other internal and external stakeholders. Learning from and discussions with our potential partners and customers will be an essential part of the role.
  
   Develop the product vision, strategy and roadmap for our Minerals and Renewable Energy industry; communicating both the business value and technical rationale behind your recommendations. 
  Understand the needs of our customer base including their product lifecycle needs to develop a strategy, partner with, and maximize the benefits of our platform for their businesses 
  Work collaboratively to develop our external proposition, including pricing, positioning and training materials and programs to enable our Customers and internal Sales and Customer Success, Product and Technical teams to understand our solutions in these industries 
  Work alongside a passionate, cross-functional team of engineers, marketers and designers to execute the roadmap and deliver an amazing experience to our users 
  Partner closely with other product leaders and cross functional internal stakeholders to drive joint planning, execution, and success. 
 
 Requirements
  5+ years in a Product role, at least 2 at a Product Management level, delivering technical products to enterprises or similarly complex customers. Experience in SaaS and enterprise systems with an ability to translate the complex to the simple.
  You are just as comfortable speaking with engineers as you are in speaking with end-users or participating in calls with senior leaders in our customers. Everledger is looking for an experienced product manager with strong commercial acumen and experience leading and growing a product offering and driving its penetration into market. You thus have demonstrated experience in product strategy, positioning and pricing / commercialisation. 
 You have demonstrated experience working independently, within a complex and sometimes ambiguous environment, to achieve clear product and business outcomes.
  
   Demonstrated experience in establishing product plans and roadmaps based on prioritisation of opportunities, deep understanding of customer needs, and the organisation’s ability to execute 
  Demonstrated experience developing pricing and commercial modelling 
  Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 
  Experience working on product teams with competing priorities and aggressive timelines. 
  Comfortable in front of customers and curious about their pain points. 
  Proven ability to understand complex business and technical concepts and to be able to make good judgment when faced with trade-offs. 
 
 Desirable
  Experience / background in the key focus industry of Minerals and/or Renewable Energy - e.g. Mining and Minerals processing, manufacturing, energy generation/ pricing; or infrastructure
  Benefits
  
  Wellness Budget - An annual allowance to invest in your physical and mental well-being. 
  Learning and Development - When our people develop, so do we. We offer an internal learning program, study leaves, and sabbaticals to support your further education. 
  Shares - We have incredibly loyal employees and we reward that loyalty in our ESOP scheme. 
  Flexible Working - Employees have the freedom to optimize their own work schedules. This includes the ability to work from home and time off in lieu. 
  Health insurance 
  Birthday leave - An additional day off each year to kick back and celebrate your birthday! 
  Social Events - We might work hard, but we never forget to spend time together, celebrating our wins, and having fun
 
   Equal Opportunities
  It is Everledger’s policy to provide equal employment opportunities to every applicant, regardless of age, sex, marriage & civil partnership, race, disability, religion or belief, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy & maternity. We celebrate diversity and are committed to providing an inclusive culture for every employee.
  Disability Confident Committed
  Everledger is also Disability Confident Committed, which means we commit to providing opportunities for those with disabilities, including interviewing all applicants with a disability who meet the minimum criteria for a vacancy and consider them on their abilities. Please let us know on your application form if this applies to you.
  IMPORTANT: If you require accommodations or adjustments to our standard application or any stage of the recruitment process, we encourage you to make us aware so that we can support you through each stage of your application.
  Right to work
  Please ensure you are applying for a role in a region where you have full rights to work in. Unfortunately at this time, Everledger, is unable to aid staff who require support obtaining a work-visa.

title: Product Manager - Investments & Managed Portfolios
description:
The opportunity 
 The purpose of this role is to assist management and simplification of North Investment Menu (including legacy offers) and provide support for regulatory requirements that impact the Investments team. This will include competitive analysis, reporting, on-going fund manager relationship management, as well as acting as providing support for various regulatory requirements. 
 How you will make an impact 
 Engage and deliver on strategic objectives of the Platform Investments team in relation to effective ongoing management of the Investment Menu and simplify internal funds and trusts; 
 
  Product development and rationalisation 
  Undertake analysis and provide insights regarding APRA peer comparisons (Heatmaps, Annual Performance Tests) 
  APRA APT (APRA Annual Performance Test) outcomes review and operational execution (Legislation review & interpretation) 
  Support the performance and fee data validation in preparation of the APT test outcomes 
  Assisting with various investment related activities covering the North Investments range; 
 
 Activities associated with the implementation of investment menu changes (Simplification of legacy offers), such as client, adviser and BDM communications, product disclosures etc. 
 
  Competitor analysis of the investment menu 
  Manage queries from Distribution / Operations / external sources regarding the investment menu or as they relate to APT and Investment Governance 
 
 Support the data analytics and navigating the trustee investment frameworks to support business decisions. Understanding of risk management and compliance by contributing to: 
 
  Resolution of incidents and breaches relating to the Platform Investments team 
  Documentation and maintenance of key process maps and obligations, RACI 
  Contribution to the Investment Management Framework (IMF) 
  Maintenance of all relevant controls in risk and compliance strategic systems 
  Ensure compliance with FSC Standards 
 
 What you will bring to the role 
 Experience & Qualifications required 
 
  Experience in product management of superannuation and investment products 
  Minimum 5+ years in wealth management 
  Relevant qualifications within actuarial, economics or finance is essential with advanced or post graduate study preferred. Experience in law or risk management desirable but not essential. 
  Ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment and comfortably deal with change (marketplace and business) 
  Demonstrates a sound understanding of risk frameworks, systems, and controls 
  Experience in successful stakeholder management 
  Experience working within a project capacity is favourable. 
  Experience in the production of Board quality papers and investment reports. 
 
 Job Specific Capabilities Required 
 In addition to your technical skills, you should be able to demonstrate an excellent level of competency in the following: 
 
  Strong understanding of investments, fund managers and Investment operations and ability to critically evaluate and analyse the impacts from investment reports and change activities. 
  Demonstrated understanding of investment products and markets 
  Ability to make sound and justifiable recommendations and the confidence to present those recommendations to investment committees if required. 
  Effective cross functional stakeholder engagement and relationship management. 
  Strong analytical and implementation skills. 
  Strong Excel & PowerBI skills and the ability to manipulate large data sets. 
  Python & SQL knowledge would be advantageous 
  Demonstrates a strong understanding of risk frameworks, systems, and controls 
 
 Is this your dream job? ….then apply today! We review applications as soon as we receive them and if we find our perfect candidate, we may close the role earlier than the advertised close date. 
 Working for AMP 
 We are transforming our business. We are looking for people with courage, accountability and integrity who inspire the same in others. If you are comfortable challenging the status-quo and perform at your best in an evolving and complex environment - we need you. 
 The investor in all of us - AMP 
 Wellbeing & Benefits 
 We invest in the health, wellbeing and development of our people by offering a range of great benefits to support you be your best, professionally and personally: 
 
  We-Flex: Choose how, when and where you work. 
  CHAMP Program: Access for you and your family to 24/7 wellbeing and counselling support. 
  Well-being programs and activities: Annual health checks, flu vaccinations, information sessions. 
  LinkedIn Learning: and other Learning@AMP programs to grow your career. 
  Volunteering: opportunities through our AMP Foundation. 
  Financial Well-Being: competitive home loans, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance. 
 
 Inclusion & Diversity 
 The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and achieve great outcomes for our people, customers, shareholders and the community. If you have a natural curiosity, an appreciation for differences and an innate willingness to help others you will be valued at AMP. 
 At AMP we are committed to improving employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and we encourage applicants from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent to apply. Read more about our Reconciliation Plan here . 
 Let us know when you apply what we can do to help you show up at your best during our selection process. 
 Message to recruitment agencies 
 Please do not send unsolicited resumes to any AMP employee in relation to this role or others. We cannot accept unsolicited resumes or be responsible for fees related to unsolicited candidates.

title: Expressions of Interest | Technical Product Manager | Data and Analytics
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
 
  If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?
 
  At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.
 
  We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.
 
  What's in it for you?
 
  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors. We are looking for a seasoned product manager who will be responsible for delivering the success of building a product suite for EY. This includes product planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle, helping the team to transition prioritised product requirements to the actual products, defining the product vision, and working closely with global engineering, client leadership and marketing & communications to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met.
 
  What we're looking for
 
  Here's our wish list but don't worry if you don't tick all the boxes. We're interested in your strengths, what you want to learn, and how far you want to go.
 
   Experience developing complete product offering from early-stage research and ideation, to implementation and iteration.
   Demonstrated experience with go to market strategy & execution, strategic marketing and comms, product iteration and management of the entirety of product development cycle.
   Experience in running beta and pilot programs with early-stage products and samples
   Work with external third parties to assess partnerships and licensing opportunities
   Develop, implement and maintain production timelines across multiple departments
   Enforce product governance structures and compliance activities to maintain internal product development compliance and standards
   Cultivates and builds relationships across business & IT and industry to gather intelligence and bring insight about the wider enterprise picture and enable the leveraging of emerging industry standards and approaches within EY
   Oversees the development and implementation of an ongoing communication plan to educate stakeholders on the purpose and benefits of Product Management
   Develops technical requirements for features balancing needs of the functional requirements, timelines, and resourcing
   Sets and monitors product goals and assess overall performance of teams utilizing Agile reporting
   Receives general direction from leader of the Product Architecture & Technology Strategy group
 
 
  What we can offer you
 
   Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment
   Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
   Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness
   Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits
 
 
  A tech career @ EY means working with 40,000 fellow technologists who are creating cutting edge applications in blockchain, AI, cloud, analytics, robotics and cyber, harnessing tech to power the human enterprise and build a more equitable, sustainable world. We offer world class training and a free Tech MBA to all our people.
 
  Acknowledgement of Country
 
  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY office are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders - past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation

We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.

  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider.
 
  The minimum salary for this role is AUD $90,000 inclusive of 10.5% superannuation and dependent on skills and experience.
  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
 
  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider.

title: Product Manager
description:
Product Manager
 
   Ongoing/Permanent role
   Grade 11/12 - The package includes a base salary range of $134,411 to $155,445 plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading
   The Department of Customer Service offers flexible work arrangements
 
  Who we are  
 The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is a service provider and regulator, focusing on delivering first-class customer service, digital transformation and regulatory reform to create better outcomes for the people of NSW. Government Technology Platforms (GTP) forms part of Digital.NSW and delivers core and common digital capabilities and infrastructure solutions including cross sector leadership across NSW Government underpinned by the Digital Government Strategy. Our Digital Programs team within GTP is currently recruiting at scale to deliver on high profile and exciting large scale digital transformation programs.  Benefits of working for DCS
 
   Accrued Flexible leave 
   Hybrid working options- flexibility to work from home and office 
   Potential to work anywhere in NSW 
   Generous leave entitlements including up to 14 weeks parental leave 
   Access to health and well-being programs including Fitness Passport 
   Competitive pay and conditions
 
  About the Project
  The Licencing Reform and Complaints, Compliance & Enforcement (CCE) Program is key to DCS’ vision to give the people of NSW a great customer experience when they interact with NSW government regulators and forms part of the overall e.Regulation strategy to create the world's easiest and secure digital regulatory experiences.
  These Projects will all support creating a single view of business compliance requirements and aim to remove manual processes and products which will increase the productivity of customers and agencies, contributing significant economic benefits to NSW.
  Through this work you will make a personal contribution to ensuring that consumers and workers in NSW are better protected and that markets operate fairly.  
 You will do this by helping to build digitally enhanced compliance and enforcement solutions, integrating tools that are easy and secure for modern proactive, risk-based regulatory practices that improve outcomes for consumers, businesses and workers. 
 These include:
 
   Enhanced functionality in the Service NSW ‘My Business Profile’ to give businesses a consolidated view of their regulatory obligations, reducing effort for businesses to comply with their regulatory obligations  
  A new case management system for regulators to manage complaints, compliance inspections and programs, and investigations & enforcement more effectively and efficiently. 
   Ground-breaking data-dashboards which give regulators an intelligent joined-up view of regulated businesses and industries drawing on data from across state and federal government
 
  You’ll thrive in our dynamic environment if you enjoy the idea of transforming business processes and delivering enhanced digital capabilities. It’s an exciting time to join as we’re quickly scaling across three streams of delivery, where you will help shape what the digital regulatory solutions options look like for whole of government in the future.
  About the Role
  The Program is seeking multiple Product Managers to change the way licensing services are delivered to the citizens of NSW. The Product Manager is responsible for end to end management of a group of products, including taking products from strategy, through to initial idea, implementation, support and continuous improvement to enable the successful delivery of the Division’s objectives. The Product Manager will establish an effective product team  and culture to support the development and management of Division’s services delivering meaningful customer value.
  Key accountabilities include:
 
   Lead multi-disciplinary Agile team to manage the product lifecycle
   Lead research, including consultation with stakeholders and related activities, to define current and future product enhancement to meet customer needs and maximise return on investment
   Consult with service and technology providers to integrate products and services to maximise value for money in digital service delivery
   Design, lead and support communications and engagement activities to build organisational understanding and by-in of customer-centric design and approach in Agile environment.
   Manage end-to-end product lifecycle, helping to define, de-risk and execute against product vision
   Effectively communicate product roadmaps to stakeholders, supported by customer research and data analytics
   Design, lead & champion user-centred product development methodologies and customer-centric approaches
 
  About You
  To be successful in this role you will be an experienced Product Manager with experience working in an Agile and Lean methodologies. This is a highly technical role. experience in building or managing software product(s) is a must.
 
   You have strong stakeholder management skills with the ability to build effective working relationships with stakeholders at all levels. You are experienced in working with working directly with clients and delivering on projects. You are team player with experience working in collaborative, cross functional teams.
   Above all, you have a strong customer service focus with an empathy and passion for our customer, the citizens of NSW.
   Strong experience developing product roadmaps for new and existing products, creating MVP, and translating roadmaps into meaningful user stories, acceptance criteria and success metrics
 
  Applying is Easy! Launch your career to the next level by submitting your resume and a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the skills and experience of this role. We will then get back in touch after the closing date with the next steps.
 
  Salary Grade 11/12, with the base salary for this role starting at $134411 base plus superannuation
 
  Closing Date: Thursday 23rd March 2023 at 9:59am
  Working at Department of Customer Service
  The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is a great place to work! Our values of accountability, trust, service, and integrity drive our initiatives and culture. We support innovative programs in areas as broad as digital government, consumer protection and major public works. We are an inclusive organisation that celebrates diversity and flexible work practices and believe our people are our greatest asset. Visit our Careers site to find out what it means to work for us. Our Commitment to Diversity, Inclusion & Flexibility We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and new ways of working.  The Department of Customer Service serves all the people of NSW and we want to reflect that diversity in our people. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQA+ community, veterans, carers, refugees, people in regional NSW and people of all ages. We strive to be an inclusive workplace where all our people can bring their authentic selves to work without judgement.  We understand that there are different ways of getting the job done and offer flexible working arrangements where and when possible.  If you do require an adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify us on your application form or contact the recruiter via sujatha.sankarankutty@customerservice.nsw.gov.au

title: Product Manager/Strategy - Mobile Apps
description:
Product Manager/Strategy - Mobile Apps-2300011F
  
  
    
  
   Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages
  : English
   
  
 
 
   Preferred Qualifications
  
   Who are we? 
  The Oracle Software Assurance organization is a world-class team of high caliber application security researchers, analysts, software engineers and site reliability engineers who thrive on new challenges. We are an inclusive and diverse team with a full spectrum of experience distributed globally. We have the resources of a large enterprise and the energy of a start-up, working on a critical greenfield software assurance project collaboratively with our cloud and mobile engineering teams. The Software Assurance organization has the mission to make application security and software assurance, at scale, a reality. We are a dedicated team, leveraging each other’s insights and abilities to produce cutting edge solutions to difficult problems through automation and CI/CD. Join us to grow your career and create the future of software assurance at scale together. The Technical Product Manager role reports to the PMO Director and is an individual contributor role in a matrix structure. 
  You will lead a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product is on schedule and within budget.
   
   
  As a member of the product development division, you will analyze and integrate internal/external customer specifications. Suggest and justify product directions and specifications. Specify, design and implement required changes to existing software architecture. Build new products and development tools. Provide inputs into the release test plans. Communicate and collaborate with engineering to discuss changes to functionality. 
  The job needs ability to work globally across multiple time zones in a fast paced dynamic environment. You will have an ability & desire to learn new things quickly and having a strong background in one or more (preferable) operating systems, mobile, security, software assurance, system software. 
  A strong drive, sense of ownership and ability to work autonomously is required. You must have experience in a company working in the agile software development lifecycle, with new product development preferred. 
  Responsibilities 
  Do you have a passion for high scale services and working with some of Oracle's most critical customers? We are looking to hire a Product Manager for the Software Assurance program at Oracle. The Software Assurance Product manager will be responsible for managing requirements working with our client, architects and technical experts. You will have technical skills to follow conversations around mobile/server software development and/or operating systems code, and their intersection with software assurance needs. 
  You are self-motivated, technical-minded individual with a passion for getting things done. You are ambitious, yet humble – you realize there are always opportunities for improvement, you take on feedback from team members and introspect to raise the bar for yourself. You are comfortable with ambiguity, exploring new complex codebases and systems, making your team shine.
   
   
  Work You’ll Do 
  
   Develop and manage product requirements in the mobile development space both Android and iOS platforms. 
   Work with a diversified group of stakeholders and technical leads in managing complex dependencies 
   Provide direction to the team from product management perspective. 
   Be involved in the sprint planning, backlog grooming and provide guidance and structure to the teams task requirements. 
   Be involved in defining key test metrics before and after product releases 
   Be involved in coordinating with the various release processes during product releases 
   Provide weekly reports into leadership 
   Update and set key milestone dates, build a short and long-term roadmap. 
   Consult with the customer(s) and stakeholders on a regular cadence. 
  
  What You’ll Bring 
  
   Bachelors or Master’s degree in management, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Cybersecurity or related discipline. 
   The ideal candidate will have 8 years of overall experience in the software industry with at least 8 years as a product manager preferably 
   Extensive experience working with mobile Apps on both iOS and Android platform preferred. 
   Excellent written and verbal communications skills. 
   Eligibility to work in Australia without sponsorship is essential 
   
  Nice to Have 
  
   Experience as product manager in managing requirements for operating systems 
   Experience/background in security space 
   Experience working on complex and multiple releases
  
   
   
  What We'll Give You 
  
   A team of very skilled and diverse personnel across the globe 
   Ability to work in a flexible work from home arrangement 
   Exposure to mind blowing large-scale cutting-edge systems 
   The resources of a large, global operation while still having the small, start-up feel of a smaller team day to day 
   Develop new skills and competencies working with our vast cloud product offerings 
   Ongoing extensive training and skills development to further your career aspirations 
   Incredible benefits and company perks 
   An organization filled with smart, enthusiastic, and motivated colleagues 
   The opportunity to impact and improve our systems and delight our customers 
   
  If this sounds like you and you want to roll up your sleeves and make an impact in the software assurance world, please hit the apply button and our hiring team would love to get in touch.
  
  
    
  
 
 
   Detailed Description and Job Requirements
   
   Lead a team that acts as the central resource and driving force for the design, process, manufacturing, test, quality and marketing of product(s) as they move from conception to distribution. Organize interdepartmental activities ensuring completion of the project/product on schedule and within budget.
   
   As a member of the product development division, you will analyze and integrate external customer specifications. Suggest and justify product directions and specifications. Specify, design and implement moderate changes to existing software architecture. Build new products and development tools. Build and execute unit tests and unit test plans. Review integration and regression test plans created by QA. Communicate with QA and porting engineering to discuss major changes to functionality.
   
   Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 7 years of software engineering or related experience.
   
  
 
  Job: Product Development
  Location: AU-Australia
  Job Type: Regular Employee Hire
  Organization: Oracle

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
Are you a Technical Product Manager that likes to influence and own a portfolio of products? Have you got an entrepreneurial mindset and can story tell to gain buy in from the stakeholders? This is a start-up venture within a large well known organisation based in the CBD. 
  This organisation has already launched products to market, which will enable you to disrupt the market further and sit close to the customer to develop these products 
  As the Product manager you will have responsibility for product success where you will also wear the product owner hat.. To be successful you will possess an entrepreneurial drive to develop new products within specific time frames, where you will lead your peers, influence decision makers and being the driver in those sometimes-complex relationships. You will need to be able to demonstrate skills across innovation, product development and commercialisation, and ideally you will possess the following; Degree in a Technical Discipline (e.g., Computer Science, Electrical Engineering) MBA or equivalent post-graduate qualification desirable Demonstrate excellent leadership skills and communicate well across multidisciplinary team Ability to influence through persuasive verbal and written communication Experience with management of product integrations, launches, and change management Experience leading development, training, and communication of new product introductions Strong organisational, research, and time management skills Experience setting and managing expectations at the executive level 
  If you would like to find out more, please email matt@matts175.sg-host.com

title: EL 1 - CN 14 Product Manager
description:
$108,195 - $122,044 (plus Super) 
  Waverton - NSW
 
  
  The Role Within the Product Management function an EL1 Product Manager is accountable under broad direction to perform and achieve complex to very complex product management work within an integrated workforce. They will require an in-depth knowledge of and compliance with legislative frameworks, government decision-making and Defence's mission and policy requirements. An EL1 Product Manager will exercise a considerable degree of independence and perform a leadership role.  They will exercise sound decision making and judgement to provide expert policy advice. They will have in-depth knowledge of the Product Management function and are responsible for the development, implementation, compliance and review of policies and procedures relevant to their work within that function. They will engage in complex to very complex problem solving and issues management and may coordinate and perform detailed or sensitive projects that impact on strategic, political or operational outcomes for Defence.  About our Team The key objective of the MCDSPO is to acquire and sustain Mine Warfare, Clearance Diving and Hyperbaric assets so the ADF can fight and win in the Maritime environment. The MCDSPO is responsible for the sustainment and through-life support of the Mine Hunter Coastal vessels, Deployable Autonomous and Robotic Mine Warfare Systems, Sail Training Ship Young Endeavour, Mine Clearance Diving and Hyperbaric Systems, and General and Specialist Dive Equipment.  The CN14 Product Manager is responsible for the coordination of sustainment activities for the Royal Australian Navy’s fleet of Huon-class Mine Hunter Coastal vessels, in partnership with a collaborative network of Defence and industry partners through varied contracting arrangements.  Our Ideal Candidate This role will suit someone who is ready to make the step up from the workforce and into a key leadership role within the MCDSPO. The incumbent will have a degree of autonomy to achieve tasks and on how best to work with a large range of stakeholders. The successful candidate will need to be able to manage a complex workload independently whilst being able to influence others who they do not have direct management control over.  The role is designed for someone who can make decisions with a demonstrated track record of delivering excellent outcomes, regardless of timeframe pressures. If you are highly organised, self-motivated, able to work independently and can confidently brief others, than this role is for you.

title: Product Manager/ Digital Experience and Product Manager
description:
Digital business platform owner | Contribute to PRW evolution | Innovative and experimental mindset | Project & Stakeholder Management
 
 
 
  
   
     Global Wine, Spirits & Champagne company with the world’s most iconic brands
   
  
   
     New Position| Exciting CEO driven project | Empowered to Perform
   
  
   
     Convivial Culture | 12 month Fixed term Contract | Barangaroo Office
   
 
 
 
   Salary/ Benefits
 
 
   Product Allowance, Bonus, WFH options
 
 
 
   The Pernod Ricard Way
 
 
   We have our own way of doing things. We call it conviviality! It’s our way of being, and something unique you feel and experience when working for Pernod Ricard.
 
 
 
   We’re committed to conviviality, and with this, you’ll be Proud to Belong to our Pernod Ricard family. You’ll be Empowered to Perform, supported to succeed, and acknowledged for the value you bring.
 
 
 
   We combine all this with our Commitment to Care, and a strong focus on sustainability and responsibility where our “Good times come from a Good place”—the only trace left behind is conviviality.
 
 
 
   Be Part of Something Bigger
 
 
   Pernod Ricard are an international family with over 19,000 employees spanning across 73 countries and are the world number 2 in the wine and spirits industry. We have an unrivalled portfolio of iconic brands such as Absolut, Chivas Regal, The Glenlivet, Jameson, Malfy, Mumm Champagne, as well as Jacob’s Creek, Church Road, Stoneleigh, Campo Viejo, and Kenwood wines.
 
 
 
   Our employees are our brand ambassadors, and our employees are at the heart of our company.
 
 
 
   Your unique contribution
 
 
   Outstanding opportunity to take a leading role on creating a new, exciting, innovative experience for our consumers, working with a dedicated transformation team on a new future driven consumer engagement project as a Digital Experience and Product Manager. This position is located in our HQ Barangaroo office in Sydney.
 
 
   You'll be collaborating across the Pernod Ricard Winemakers business and be responsible for the implementation of a brand-new digital experience platform and engagement program for the PRW fine wine portfolio (from strategic development to execution and management) Your work will cover the development and creation of industry first, innovative CX and digital product experiences, loyalty, CRM, e-commerce, digital innovation and more !
 
 
   This role would suit a person who likes a varied role and wants to work in the innovation space on projects that are first, different, and unique.
 
 
   This is a great opportunity to join a global company, not only with a portfolio of iconic brands, but with a leadership team who drive the agenda on career development, empowering you to reach your full potential.
 
 
 
   You will:
 
 
  
   
     Be the driving force behind the platform to deliver towards long term strategic outcomes
   
  
   
     Develop the product roadmap to grow and evolve the offering and prioritise through value /effort assessments.
   
  
   
     Create and implement a digital action plan to improve consumers experiences within our ecosystem following a strategic roadmap
   
  
   
     Build passionate and engaged communities through consumer audience segments, automations, journeys and personalisation
   
  
   
     Contribute to the creative and content strategy
   
  
   
     Conduct analysis and translate data into stories and actionable insights for testing and optimisation
   
  
   
     Provide strategic project leadership
   
  
   
     Lead product and portfolio management and merchandising
   
  
   
     Ensure operations are running seamlessly across logistics, pick & pack and customer service
   
  
   
     Own the P&L and financials
   
 
 
 
   Your perfect blend of Talent
 
 
   As well as having an impressive blend of entrepreneurial spirit, mutual trust, and ethical commitment, you will also bring:
 
 
  
   
     Experience in creating digital experience and product strategies.
   
  
   
     Experience with e commerce platforms that have a membership program, CRM as part of the offering
   
  
   
     Strategic thinker, familiar with working in transformation space and developing future focused change programs.
   
  
   
     Understanding of user requirements and software development lifecycle (SDLC)
   
  
   
     Strong knowledge in data mining, analysis, and manipulation
   
  
   
     Engaging communicator with the ability to influence a wide variety of stakeholders from various areas of the business.
   
 
 
 
   Become a creator of conviviality
 
 
   If you want to work with people who acknowledge you and the value you bring, then apply now! You too can be part of the Pernod Ricard Way.
 
 
 
   Only those with full, unrestricted working rights in Australia will be considered for this position.
 
 
 
   Pernod Ricard “MyBlend of Benefits”
 
 
   Fun Stuff
 
 
   Product allowance | Tastings | Product Education | Office Drinks & Events | Flexi Work | Summer Hours
 
 
   Serious Stuff
 
 
   EAP | Great Parental Leave Policy | Skin Checks | Flu Shots | Life Insurance
 
 
   Feel Good Stuff
 
 
   S&R Initiatives | Career Development | Volunteer Leave | Responsib’All Day/ The Good Challenge
 
 
 
   Diversity & Inclusion at Pernod Ricard
 
 
   We are proud to be awarded Employer of Choice for Gender Equality and believe that building richly diverse teams and an inclusive culture are integral to delivering our business strategy.
 
 
 
   We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunities employer – we welcome applications from diverse communities.
 
 
 
   Job Posting End Date:
 
 
 
   Target Hire Date:
  2023-02-09-08:00
 
 
   Target End Date:
  2023-04-30-07:00

title: Graduate UX Designer
description:
Graduate UX Designer 
 Start your career by making an impact and real connections with some of the most meaningful challenges around 
 Make the Best You. 
 Working at Honeywell is not just creating incredible things. You will have the opportunity to work with our talented and friendly team of professionals and be part of a global team of future shapers. 
 Join Us and Make an Impact. 
 The Honeywell Software Centre Sydney is a global software development centre & design studio for Honeywell. We build systems that enable our industrial and commercial customers to improve their operations and achieve their sustainability goals. We are recognised as a worldwide leader in the development of innovative systems and human machine interface software, using contemporary development methodologies & tools. We hire talented people, nurture their growth, give opportunities to make a difference, and promote from within. 
 If you are you passionate about solving real word technical problems using software to make the world a better place, would like significant product software projects to work on, and are looking for a supportive organization with plenty of opportunities to build you career this could be the dream job for you. 
 About the Role 
 As a Graduate User Experience Designer, you will work with other designers in an interdisciplinary studio to create the framework and best practices for world-class design. You will join our team that is responsible for the design of the user experience for Honeywell’s flagship automation solutions. Your role is to apply user experience design to help continually improve the end-to-end user experience for our customers. 
 Together, we will create design strategies, develop advanced design concepts and deliver outstanding products to market that delight our end users. 
 Key Responsibilities: 
 
   Design user experiences exploring to build an ideal product experience that exceeds the expectations of our business and customers while partnering with cross-functional teams
  
 
   Participate in the entire iterative design process from discovery through launch
  
 
   Account for each stage of the user journey using user flow diagrams, sketches, etc.
  
 
   Design, implement and verify user interfaces for massively scalable programs and applications desktop and mobile
  
 
   Document functional user requirements to communicate design, process, rationale and decisions that direct and support UX/UI and functional design
  
 Key Experience & Capabilities: 
 
   Degree completed in the 2 years preceding the start date for the Graduate role, February 2024 or equivalent experience in HCI, UX design other user centered design program
 
  · Fluent with design sketching and prototyping tools (e.g. Sketch, InVision, Figma, Adobe XD, Abstract, etc.) 
 This role will require you to communicate with variety of project stakeholders and thus you must be able to clearly communicate your thoughts. We are also looking for self-motivated individuals who love to challenge themselves and continuously learn. Join a dynamic team and get the opportunity to add value by solving real world problems and be a true #futureshaper 
 Application Information: 
 
   Applications will close 16th April’23
   Anticipated start date would be Feb 2024 
  Permanent Residency in Australia or New Zealand, or Citizenship is required. Student and bridging visas may be accepted 
  Successful candidates will be required to successfully complete pre-employment background and drug screening. 
  For more information visit https://careers.honeywell.com/us/en/pacific-earlycareers. Also meet our graduates at https://careers.honeywell.com/us/en/pacific-earlycareers) 
 
 Discover More 
 We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/ 
 If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell. 
 The future is what we make it. So, join us and let’s do this together. 
 Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer, and we support a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply. 
 Copyright © 2020 Honeywell International Inc
  
 Additional Information
 
   JOB ID: req392011
   Category: Engineering
   Location: 2 Richardson Place,North Ryde,NEW SOUTH WALES,2113,Australia
   Nonexempt

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
AdVisible is on the lookout for an enthusiastic and talented UI / UX Designer to join our fast-growing team of creatives and digital marketers.
  This is your opportunity to thrive in a company with an amazing culture. Each team member is genuinely valued, and your personal growth is always a priority.
  About AdVisible
  Founded in 2010, our agency specialises in generating traffic, leads and sales for our clients through creating amazing digital experiences, branding, SEO, Paid Search and Social Media.
  We were one of the earliest agencies to achieve Premier Google Partner status, and were finalists for Best Marketing Agency in both SEMrush’s Search Awards and AMI’s Awards for Marketing Excellence in 2020.
  The opportunity
  Our close-knit team looks out for each other and inspires one another to learn and grow daily. We balance our hard work with office banter, rewards and social activities so that you love your job as much as we do.
  The work that you contribute will be valuable, as you’ll be able to see the direct impact you have on our clients’ businesses. You’ll be bringing aesthetic websites to life that are user friendly and offer a great user experience. You’ll have the opportunity to attend workshops, industry events and stakeholder meetings to ensure you continuously grow and learn.
  Roles and responsibilities
 
   Full-scope UX design (discovery, research, strategy, user personas, user flows, sitemaps and wireframing)
   UI design of websites and applications using Adobe and Figma
   Build website prototypes and have them ready for our developers
   Collaborate with our team of web project managers, developers, designers and content creators to deliver high-quality and on-brand websites to our clients
   Communicate with stakeholders along the way how our design solution will satisfy end-user requirements, solve pain points and meet business objectives
   Assist with shoots, illustrations and other creative work where required
 
  The ideal candidate will have:
 
   + 2 years experience designing websites in an agency environment
   Passion for all things UI & UX
   Experience using the Adobe creative suite, Figma, Sketch and project management software
   Impeccable organisational skills, attention to detail, and is a natural problem solver
   Good communication skills and experience in delivering positive customer experiences
   Pride in delivering quality work and an outstanding portfo lio to back this up
 
  Why us?
 
   Work-life balance with flexible working arrangements
   Monthly social events (pizza and drinks, movie nights, bowling, axe throwing, and more)
   Fully stocked kitchen with fresh fruit, snacks and coffee
   Zen corner (Nintendo Switch, books, beanbags)
   Convenient Sydney CBD office (4 minute walk from Wynyard Station)
   Work with a tight-knit and talented team
   Transparent career progression with half-yearly and annual performance reviews
 
  How to apply
  If you feel that we’re the right fit for each other, please apply now for this role with a cover letter, resume and link to your portfolio.
  If you have any additional questions about the role, please email welcome@advisible.com.au.

title: UI/UX Designer - Government sector
description:
Government agency seeks experienced UI/UX Designer with knowledge and skill in Figma to create user flows, prototypes and mock-ups for applications
  UX/UI Designer opportunity 
  
 
  $750-$950 per hour plus super dependent on experience 
  Full-time, 4 month contract until 30 June 2023. Immediate start 
  CBD location 
  
 
 About the role 
  
 Our client, a government agency, requires an experienced UI/UX Designer to deliver adaptive and creative innovative products. You will be responsible for creating user flows, prototypes and mock-ups for applications support the end-to-end design process including, wireframing, prototyping, user validation, and ensure that all elements of the user experience are optimized for improved usability, accessibility, usefulness, and exceptional visual design. 
  
 Responsibilities and Duties 
  
 Your main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: 
  
 
  Coordinate design projects from concept to completion, implementing best UX and UI standards. 
  Establishment and promotion of design guidelines, following best practice design standards and a common design system where it's applicable 
  Knowledge and experience with Figma, systems thinking and design systems, and the WCAG accessibility standards 
  Work closely with project stakeholders and UX/UI designers to create, update, and develop engaging, innovative, and measurable design experiences through the use of sketches, wireframes, prototypes, visual designs, and other design artefacts to deliver responsive web and mobile app, content and production designs. 
  Provide reviews on development team outputs to ensure that as far as possible implementations meet WCAG guidelines and align with the design system and agreed design outputs. 
  Preparing and presenting both UX and UI concepts to internal teams and key stakeholders for review, validation, and feedback. 
  Participate in user research to help inform features and design direction 
  Proactively coach and develop the skills of other team members. 
  
 
 Your Experience and Skills 
  
 To be successful in this role, you must possess: 
  
 
  Knowledge of modern best practice UX and UI standards. 
  Ability to turn user requirement into a user interface design / prototype. 
  In-depth knowledge and skill with interface design tools preferably Figma. 
  Working knowledge of the ideation and creation of UI design deliverables: Sitemaps, user flows, wireframes, lo-fi and hi-fi layouts, prototypes. 
  
 
 Qualifications: 
  
 
  Qualification(s) in UX/UI design 
  5+ years' experience in UX/UI Design 
  Previous government experience is desirable, but not essential 
  
 
 How to apply 
  
 To submit your application, please apply online using the appropriate link below forwarding a copy of your resume and cover letter highlighting your UI/UX Design experience and suitability for the role. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Edgardo Robinson on 03 7065 1820 quoting Ref No. 225434.
