title: Product UX/UI Designer
description:
Come join one of the world’s fastest growing tech startups in mining!
   CorePlan is the world's only digital operations platform for mining. We’re not only empowering and modernising the way that people in mining work together, but making it smarter than ever before imagined.
   Since 2020, we have seen phenomenal business growth for us with over 10x the number of customers which includes brands such as Chalice, BHP and Sandfire.
   Our team is small but we are gearing for growth to double our team size so we can scale across mining here, in Australia, and internationally.
   What your role is:
   You will be part of the product development process from the get-go. You will lead the product discovery and design process for our mobile app and web platform, translating user workflow pain points into product design solutions.
   You will join a tight-knit product team that values good design and prides themselves in shipping the modern, intuitive software that our users know and love.
   What you will be doing:
   
   
    
      Become a 
     product expert: gain a thorough understanding of the industry we play in, our end users, and why they choose to use (and love) our software
     
   
    
      User research and discovery: map out user journeys, workflows and pain-points based on a thoroughly researched understanding of the different job roles of our customers and frame them as design problems to be solved
     
   
    
      Product design: design world-class, user-centric solutions all the way from conceptualisation, to user acceptance, to high-fidelity prototypes
     
   
    
      Maintain design standards: define and maintain product design standards and principles, ensuring they are consistent and follow modern web and mobile application best-practices
     
   
    
      Guarantee 
     product quality and success: gather user feedback and iterate on designs through data-driven feedback processes
     
   
    
      Communicate and collaborate with internal teams for continuous feedback and 
     stakeholder alignment
     
  
   We're looking for each other if you:
   
   
    
      Are a master at Figma
     
   
    
      Have demonstrable 
     at least 2 years end-to-end experience in the delivery of design projects, from conceptualisation to production
     
   
    
      Have a deep understanding of modern product discovery practices and love conducting them: user interviews, user acceptance testing, etc.
     
   
    
      Believe in user-centric design and value simplicity in solving design problems
     
   
    
      Are able to communicate concepts and solutions effectively in a way that clearly articulates the reasoning behind design decisions
     
   
    
      Recognise the importance of a smooth user experience: you have a passion for streamlining both software and workflow processes
     
   
    
      Always strive for both professional and personal self-improvement: you’re inherently curious and you’re always learning
     
   
    
      Have a strong understanding of the software development process: experience of Agile/Scrum is a plus
     
  
   Why you should care about this role:
   
   
    
      You’ll be innovating for a modern software platform which is revolutionising the mining industry - by understanding the need to put users first
     
   
    
      Interesting design problems in unique environments across a wide variety of user roles
     
   
    
      Autonomy and ownership over the work you do, with flexible working hours
     
   
    
      A laid-back but professional workplace with a team of extraordinary, motivated and fun co-workers
     
   
    
      A brand-spanking-new Macbook
     
  
   Why CorePlan?
   We are a modern SaaS startup born out of Western Australia and having achieved product-market fit in 2020, we are ready to rapidly scale the business.
   Expect autonomy, responsibility and problem solving like you've never imagined, in a growth-focused environment. We work with impact, surrounded by like-minded people who are unusually committed and who love what they do.
   Our mission at CorePlan is to help people in the mining industry work better together in the modern age. And, that’s why we have built the world’s easiest to use (and only) digital operations platform for mining.
   How to Apply
   Applying is simple, but like with all good things, it takes time.
   While we know your resume looks great, our company culture is a big part of who we are and so we’d like to know a bit about who you are.
   Please, do us (and yourself) a favour by telling us how great you are so that we can skip the formalities and get down to business!

title: UX/UI Designer (AU)
description:
Sydney, Australia / Full Time
  DroneShield is seeking a User Experience/User Interface Designer with relevant experience to join the team in Sydney, New South Wales. The position will report to Vice President of Design. It represents a unique opportunity to design user-centric solutions in the defence space.
  The role is primarily focused on the design of DroneShield’s C2 platform, Product Device Managers and the DroneShield Software Portal. The C2 platform combines data from multi different deployed sensor types and displays this information to the user in a meaningful way. It represents an exceptional opportunity for a result-driven individual in a new niche but exploding market. The company has a strong foundation in design and collaborates with a variety of commercial and military companies around the world.
 
  Responsibilities, Duties and Expectations
 
  Optimize existing user interface designs
  Test for intuition and experience
  Create user flows and functional prototypes using tools such as Figma
  Must have a keen eye for detail
  Prepare and conduct user testing
  Recognise the importance of a smooth user experience
  Adhere to style standards on typography and graphic design
 
 
  Qualifications, Experience and Skills
 
  2+ years of experience in User Experience and User Interface Design or Product Design
  Bachelor's degree in UX/UI design, Product Design, or related field
  Have a strong understanding of the software development process: experience of Agile/Scrum
  Excellent communication skills
  Strong conceptual thinking, interaction, and visual design skills
  Experience in website design and/or web development (preferred)
 
 
  Please submit your Resume and Portfolio when applying for this role.

 


 HOW TO APPLY
  To apply, email us at careers@droneshield.com with a copy of your CV and title of the position you are interested in.
  Your background not matching to the advertised roles? Contact us with your details to be considered.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
The Role 
  As MLC Life Insurance continues to embark on a transformation journey with the aim to become a leader in providing digital experiences and insights within the Life Insurance sector, we continue to invest and grow our Digital and Customer Experience capabilities. 
  We aim to create compelling experiences for our Super Fund partners and their members, with a focus on reshaping the experience to materially enhance member and partner advocacy! 
  Reporting into the Customer Experience Design Manager, the UI/UX Designer role will play an important part in the design and development of intuitive and seamless products and digital experiences. 
  Working alongside our CX Designer, you will be responsible for leading and facilitating the problem-solving processes with key business stakeholders, framing any problems and solutions through the user lens to create an experience that is aesthetically pleasing and technically refined. 
  Your role is broad and varied where every day is a different day! You will participate in any user/customer research, capturing and interpreting research findings into actionable user insights to drive product design and best practices, building and developing wireframes and participating in user testing activities. 
  About You 
  With a strong user first mentality and human-centred design approach, you possess 2+ years of design experience in a similar capacity. 
  You can clearly demonstrate your technical capabilities, your keen eye for design aesthetics and have built up an excellent portfolio showcasing your UX and UI design work. 
  You have a passion for delivering traditional user tasks and actions into transformative digital experiences for your stakeholders and customers. 
  Lastly, your curiosity and customer-obsessed mindset will enable you to put yourself in the shoes of your users, understanding every touch point of the customer journey with an end to end view of the customer experience. 
  Other technical skills set include: 
  
   Postgraduate qualifications desirable 
   Minimum of 2 years’ experience 
   An excellent portfolio demonstrating UX and high-end UI design 
   Ideation 
   Research & testing 
   Synthesise & report generation 
   Wireframing 
   Prototyping 
   UI design for developer handover 
   Figma 
   Miro 
   Webflow (nice to have) 
   HTML, CSS, JS, React understanding (nice to have) 
   
  Our Purpose 
  MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide almost 1.2 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most. It’s a promise that provides peace of mind and helps them sleep at night. 
  Our purpose is supported by Our Values of Do What’s Right, Deliver Together, Make it Simple, Own it and Aim High. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers, partners and each other that defines who we are. 
  Our Strategy 
  Our strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment, energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance, working together, that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support all of us to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution. 
  With more than 1500 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are. 
  Why Choose Us? 
  At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to: 
  
   enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution 
   embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer 
   access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and 
   wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.
  
   
   
  Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates, however they will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the position.
  
  
    
  
 
 
   Primary Location
  : AU-VIC-Docklands
 
 
   Work Locations
  : Level 14, 727 Collins St Level 14 727 Collins St Docklands 3008
 
 
   Job
  : Information Technology
 
 
   Organization
  : MLC Limited
 
 
   Schedule
  : Permanent
 
 
   Employee Status
  : Group Level 2
 
 
   Full-time
 
 
   :
 
 
   Job Posting
  : 26-Feb-2023, 8:35:19 PM

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Opportunity to join our Qantas Loyalty business and take the next step in your career
   Be part of a high performing team
   2 x full-time permanent positions, based at our Head Office in Mascot
 
 
 
   Qantas Loyalty is a high performing business and has a history of launching exciting new brands and services that make a difference to its millions of Frequent Flyer and Business Rewards members. Qantas Frequent Flyer and Qantas Business Rewards remain at the core of the program, while the business has evolved to include a number of new ventures and other businesses such as Qantas Money, Qantas Insurance and Qantas Wine.
 
 
 
   As a Senior UX Designer, you will define and drive the future of Qantas Loyalty design. You will co-design product strategy, envision complex UX ecosystems and inspire teams to push the boundaries of what is possible. You possess a clear vision of the future for our customers and people, and have the courage to pursue forward-thinking design. You will apply your passion for brand, craft, and design fidelity to direct research and design processes, mentor and manage talented members of your team, and collaborate with leaders of other product and engineering teams to create innovative experiences across the product ecosystem we are responsible for. The role is designed to span across both experience design and research to ensure there is one voice for our customer by tribe within Qantas Loyalty.
 
 
 
   To be successful in this role, you will need to align customer needs, business goals and technology platforms and champion the customer experience both from within a Qantas Loyalty Tribe as well as connected across the Loyalty ecosystem.
 
 
 
   You’ll have –
 
 
   5+ years of experience in UX design, with demonstrated product leadership roles and exposure to high growth and fast paced environment
   Tertiary qualification - BS or MS in Human Computer Interaction, Human Factors, Information Science, Anthropology, Psychology, Architecture; or BS in Computer Science with emphasis on UX development; or BA in Graphic Design with emphasis on UX design (preferred)
   Hands-on experience designing UI/UX from conception to minimum viable products to scaled launch & adoption
   Expertise in building interactive prototypes to illustrate UX & UI design for web sites and mobile apps using modern technologies
   Comfortable working within multidisciplinary teams of product managers, strategic, visual, and motion designers, and engineers
   A demonstrated history of accountability and performance delivery, leading products to meet or exceed objectives
   An entrepreneurial spirit and ability to operate collaboratively with all levels of the organization
   A commercial mindset to identify opportunities that align to the strategic vision and mission of the squad/tribe
   Knowledge and experience with Design Thinking and Agile frameworks (e.g. Scrum, Kanban, Design Thinking / HCD, Lean).
   Understanding of accessibility principles and their application in a range of digital products and devices
   Experience with using tools such as JIRA, Confluence, Figma, Zeplin, ZeroHeight, InVision, etc.
   Proficiency in Google analytics/Data analytics will be highly regarded
   Passionate about solving customer problems through world class design aspiration and be open to design jam and critique
   Ability to work in a team and matrix environment and be able to collaborate and communicate effectively that realises engagement of peers and transparency of approach
   Ability to iterate concepts and designs to realise business metrics and outcomes
   Ability to identify opportunities for product iteration vs evolution
   Ability to understand what best practice ways of working are and to apply where possible throughout design process
   Creative problem solving and strong communication skill
 
 
 
   Why Qantas?
 
 
   You’ll join a team where creativity and passion are encouraged. Our people come together to allow us to dream big and deliver successfully.
 
 
 
   There are many different opportunities across our team, which means you’ll be able to grow both personally and professionally at Qantas. Your development is a priority for us – so that you can maintain the high standards our customers have come to expect and can continue to develop over time. You’ll be supported from day 1 with on the job training and coaching as well as our formal training opportunities. While you may start in this role, we’ve got a great track record of supporting our people to take their career in so many different directions, the destinations are endless.
 
 
 
   The Qantas employee benefits program offers amazing benefits that extend well beyond travel.
 
 
   We love to travel: Enjoy heavily discounted air travel within Australia and across the globe, both for you and your family and friends, as well as exclusive deals on accommodation and holidays.
   We have flexible leave options: Make use of leave and flexible working opportunities including 14 weeks paid parental leave and the option to purchase additional paid leave for eligible employees.
   We’ll give you access to thousands of rewards: Through our partnerships we can offer you discounts across shopping, food and wine, insurance, health and wellbeing, leisure and entertainment. You can also take advantage of our salary packaging program including motor vehicles, eligible portable electronic devices and professional memberships.
   We’ll support your wellbeing: Whether it’s learning to better support your own and others’ mental health, our interactive wellbeing app or your very own tailored nutrition plan.
 
 
 
   Qantas is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds to apply. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application. Your personal information will be kept confidential in compliance with relevant privacy legislation.
 
 
 
   Be a part of something special and play your part in the Qantas story – get in touch today.
 
 
 
   Applications close 26th of March
 
 
 
   Please note: applications will only be considered for candidates who have the right to work in Australia / New Zealand without restriction or sponsorship.

title: UI/UX Product Designer
description:
Liquid is looking for a Mid/Senior Product Designer to join our team. Your role will see you use your creative abilities to explore and iterate through different solutions to solve design problems from our client’s point of view, which is backed by our team’s dedication to research and testing. 
         We are a digital agency that prides itself on solving complex problems and creating new opportunities. Sometimes that’s transforming how an organisation works and the services it delivers. Often, it's tackling difficult social challenges like mental health, aged care or education. Always, it’s as a trusted part of the client team. 
         We apply creative and technical expertise to produce digital products and strategic solutions, supported by reliability, consistency, and data-driven reporting valuable to our clients. 
         You can read more about our work here. 
         As a Product Designer at Liquid, you will excel in both UX practice and beautiful visual design: a consummate product designer and design thinker. You believe the fundamental concept of “design” means considering form, function, behaviour and affect together. It’s still good if you feel most confident in one particular area – we’re all specialists in different, complementary ways – but it’s the curiosity of a generalist mindset that we really value. 
        You will need to show a minimum of 3-5 years of relevant experience, with knowledge and experience working autonomously and collaboratively in multi-disciplinary teams, on projects that demand a broad set of skills from defining product requirements and contributing to workshops, through to lo-fidelity prototyping and creating hi-fidelity UI. 
        Core responsibilities of the role: 
        
         Deliver the product design, ideation and execution for key projects 
         Work as part of a diverse multi-disciplinary team in a highly collaborative environment 
         Provide guidance and support for peers 
         Team up with service designers, strategists, writers, producers and the technology team to deliver great products 
         Use tools like Sketch or Figma to design interfaces, prototype with the likes of InVision and don't shy away from editing content with Adobe Creative Cloud 
         Communicate UX thinking and systems design through user flows, diagrams and the odd wireframe
        
         
        To be successful you'll need: 
        
         Formal qualifications in design 
         Strong communication skills, written, verbal and listening 
         Strategic problem-solving skills with the capacity to distill complex information into meaningful concepts, ideas and designs 
         Knowledge of best UX practice and standards, designing for different contexts and screen sizes 
         A good eye for colour, type and proportion 
         Agile environment experience 
         Be an excellent team player 
         Open to sharing thoughts, ideas and work in-progress 
         Ability to experiment and adapt to new technologies and ways of working 
         Curiosity 
         
        Advantageous, but not essential: 
         
         Experience working in a digital agency 
         Experience working in a consulting role 
         Experience working with and contributing to design systems 
         
        If this sounds like the role you’ve been looking for, please apply via our form below. 
         To apply for this role, you must have working rights to work in Australia. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted for an interview. 
         This is Liquid.

title: Junior Digital Designer
description:
Sheet Society 
 
 
  If you're obsessed with making pixels look amazing then you sound like just the right person to join our in-house creative team as a Junior Digital Designer. Working closely with the Digital Designer, you to help bring our brand and products to life in the Digital realm. 
 
 
  If you’re obsessed with making pixels look amazing then you sound like just the right person to join our in-house creative team as a Junior Digital Designer. Working closely with the Digital Designer, you to help bring our brand and products to life in the Digital realm. You’ll have a strong, consistent eye for design, in social and digital space. Each day will be different, from an array of marketing briefs to campaign rollout in EDM and ADs - you’ll need to be organised, efficient and able to pivot if necessary and work under pressure to meet daily deadline. 
   Digital Design 
   
   Work closely with the Digital Designer within the Creative team 
   Produce high-quality digital design assets in both static and moving image, applying and creating animation where possible. 
   Create, champion and comply with a consistent on-brand digital design ensuring it is distinctly on Sheet Society brand. 
   Understand and work with distinctive brand assets such as logos, sub brands, icons, typography, typographical lockups, colour and imagery that is fit for purpose digitally. 
  
  
   Be organised, and motivate those around you to achieve the shared creative brand vision. 
   
  Digital Asset Creation 
   
   Work collaboratively with Social and Content Creation team members for asset creation and fit for purpose. 
   Work with the digital designer from ideation through to production for new campaigns, focusing on assets such as Socials, EDMs and ADs. 
   Work collaboratively with the digital designer and creative team and assist in creating parts of the campaign style guides. 
   Work closely and collaboratively with the marketing team on monthly campaign deliverables that follow the style guide; bringing the campaign creative to life in a succinct and marketable way in ADs, EDMs, Socials and online experience. 
   Work collaboratively with the UX/UI and Ecommerce team to develop assets for web design with a customer-focused methodology. 
   
  Asset coordination 
   
   Liaising with relevant stakeholders to ensure that briefs are complete. 
   Accountability to the delivery of digital design for daily and weekly deadlines, working within ASANA and Slack to collaborate and communicate. 
   Assist in upkeeping the creative asset library, ensuring updates are done for brand assets and campaign assets. 
   Keep up to date with the customer experience calendar. 
   
  Must-have skills for this role.. 
   
   Excellent communication, collaboration and prioritisation skills. 
   A keen eye for design and all the finer details 
   Skilled in Digital Design with a relevant tertiary qualification 
   Experience in producing printed assets 
   Minimum of 2 years experience as a Graphic or Digital Designer. 
   Proven ability as a graphic designer to then further push into motion and animation 
   Competent in Adobe CC Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Adobe Animate, After Effects) 
   Competent in work management system ASANA and SLACK 
   Experience with a website software design tool Figma 
   Experience with in After Effects 
   
  OUR VALUES 
   Good Humans We’re the kind of people you want to work with and have dinner together after. We treat our colleagues like family, and talk to our customers like friends. 
   Driven Dreamers We’re committed to our vision and value the journey, not just the destination and believe in taking risks, working together, learning from failure, and remaining optimistic. 
   Humble Hustlers We’re quiet achievers, always at the top of our game.We use our intelligence and initiative to determine where we can have the most impact, and our resourcefulness to get things done. 
   Support Crew We believe that great ideas come from great, motivated, people, so we prioritise our team’s diversity, growth, and development (alongside our own) above all else.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Canva’s Commitment and Mission 
    
    
     Ngā Manawanuitanga me ngā uaratanga o Canva 
    
    
     
    
     At Canva, we celebrate diversity. We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key to building the best product, team and company. We look for many different skills and abilities, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So, even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you!
      
    
    
     
    
     Our mission at Canva is to empower the world to design and since launching in 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 110+ million monthly active users across 190 different countries and a team of over 3,400 people… and the best bit is that we’ve only achieved 1% of what we know we’re capable of.
      
    
    
     
    
     Join us and design your future.
      
    
    
     
    
     About the group you'll be joining 
    
    
     
    
     User Growth group is on a mission to increase activation, frequency of use and drive viral adoption of Canva globally. We’re laser focused on driving impact on monthly active user (MAU) metrics that are mission-critical for us achieving our company goals.
      
    
    
     
    
     We leverage our mature experimentation framework, data and research capabilities to maximise the performance of our top-of-funnel product-led growth engine, which encompasses new users' first experience as they visit canva.com , sign up and familiarise themselves with all that Canva has to offer.
      
    
    
     
    
     We have come a long way, but we have huge company growth aspirations and crazy big goals; as a product designer joining the User Growth group, you’ll be critical in helping us make Canva a household name.
      
    
    
     
    
     About the Digital Design (UX/UI) specialty 
    
    
     
    
     Digital designers have the chance to collaborate and work between Brand and Product. Working at the top of the funnel you will be designing pages viewed by millions. This is an incredible opportunity to help develop our brand awareness and have a direct impact on our MAUs and revenue goals. Being the first touch-point at the start of the user journey, you will be responsible for delivering landing pages that meet our user’s needs and drive adoption. Working in a cross-functional team, you will be responsible to bring designs to life from start to finish. That may involve a wide range of tasks such as brainstorming, writing creative briefs or design documents, wireframes, visual designs, prototypes, interaction, and more. 
    
    What you’ll do 
    
     Discovery — Contribute to the discovery phase with user stories, research, competitor analysis, wireframes, user flows, and help define the problem and solutions.
      Definition — Translate insights, data and user research into prototypes to validate ideas with stakeholders and end users.
      Visual design — Design creative and on-brand visual solutions such as emails, banners, graphics, UI motions, landing pages and websites that drive users to the product and inspire them to create a design.
      Implementation — Work closely with engineers during implementation and review final deliverables with an exacting eye, ensuring that layout, images, typography and general experience is flawless and on-brand.
      Iteration — Iterate and optimise pages and user flows for conversion.
      Design at scale — keeping in mind internationalisation, CMS integration, accessibility, design system, mobile design and various technical constraints and opportunities.
     
    What you'll bring 
    
     Experience designing websites and landing pages with a strong understanding of user behaviour and how to drive conversion.
      You work iteratively and love A/B testing, user testing and using data to inform design decisions.
      You are comfortable with the various acquisition channels (SEO, SEM, Social etc..) and are able to provide holistic, consistent and performant solutions.
      Highly collaborative, you are able to bring people with you on the design journey, proposing creative solutions that address business goals and strategies.
      You shine through your designs, creating user flows and wireframes that simplify the user experience.
      You are eager to visually communicate your ideas through prototypes to test with users.
      You appreciate big-picture thinking. While details are everything, creating an experience that always keeps our users in mind is equally as important.
      You are a problem solver that’s excited by a challenge. You enjoy sitting in a room and whiteboarding ideas to confidently come up with simple, elegant solutions that everyone can move forward with.
      You enjoy a little flexibility in your work. Our growth means there are constantly new things to work on every day, as such it’s likely that you’ll often be working across the board on new and exciting projects.
      Comfortable with chaos. You can find solutions even without perfect precedents or direction, and map out a path to clarity and execution. You can work out ways to achieve the impossible and ride through change like a boss.
     
     
       ** Please send across your portfolio/examples of your work when applying
     
     
    What you’ll learn at Canva 
    
     Learn to design at scale and have a real impact on the business and on people’s everyday lives.
      Develop your craft with some of the most talented designers.
      Build your coaching, mentoring and leadership skills. There is so much we want to build at Canva with incredible growth opportunities.
     
    
     Working at Canva 
    
    
     Tō mahi ki te Canva 
    
    
     
    
     Our culture is unlike anywhere else and we design your #CanvaLife experience to empower you to do the best work of your life.
      
    
    
     
    
     Whether you’re in the office, working from home or choosing your own adventure, our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include:
      
    
    
     
    
     Our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include: Flexible hours and working fully remotely from anywhere in New Zealand, which values your work-life balance because you know how you work best. 
    
    
     Unique and flexible leave so you can recharge, give back, support others or focus on your own professional development. 
    
    
     An inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey. 
    
    
     An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance. This is for you to spend on whatever will support your wellbeing and development. Because you know what you need to Vibe and Thrive, better than anyone. 
    
    
     We have virtual wellness & development benefits including Canva University, Employee Assistant Programs, Fitness & Yoga Classes and other benefits to support your physical, mental, and social wellbeing. 
    
    
     Canva For Good program matching your not-for-profit donations, Force for Good leave (3 paid volunteering days) and a range of sustainability and ethical initiatives to get involved in. 
    
    
     
    
     We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. 
     Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. 
     When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process. / Ka whakatauhia e mātou ngā tikanga i runga i ōu whēako, ōu pūkenga me tō ngākaunui mō te mahi. Kia mahara mai; He uiuinga tata te 
     uiui.Ina 
     tono koe, tēnā, kōrero mai ki a mātou ngā kupu hunga ingoa e whakamahia anae koe, me ngā rereketanga whaitake e hiahiatia ana e koe i te wā o te uiui. 
    
   
  
  
   
    
     Senior UX/UI Designer

title: Interaction Designer
description:
Who you are
   You’re a skilled UX/UI, interaction or product designer, experienced in designing user-focused, accessible digital products.
   You use human-centred design principles to design everything from user journeys, to wireframes, to high-fidelity prototypes, to iterations on live services.
   You are at home using a range of prototyping tools (we use Sketch, Figma, and occasionally XD, but welcome all sorts.)
   You enjoy working in a lean, agile, collaborative and client focused environment. You love being part of all stages of the design process from project inception to delivery.
   Your design decisions are driven by user needs. You use data and user research to define success and learn lessons. It’s not about your instincts but what our users need.
   You can manage stakeholders and clients, communicating effectively and balancing user needs with business priorities.
   You’re self-sufficient and able to take a task and run with it.
   You’re excited to work with experts in adjacent fields, such as user research and service design.
   Who we are
   We’re a dynamic ‘consultagency’ based in Canberra, helping public and private sector organisations transform their digital services. We work with high profile clients, large and small, and we love working on digital services that improve peoples’ lives. Our clients love working with us, and we love what we do.
   We are user-centred design experts, but we come from a range of fields. Our team includes experienced and skilled user researchers, service designers, content designers, content strategists, technical leads, delivery managers and business architects.
   Our approach is in our name – being pragmatic means dealing with things sensibly and realistically. Pragmatism means responding to the world as it is, not theoretically. We help our clients design services that lead to real outcomes.
   We work from home some of the time, and from the office some of the time. We run regular design crits and team planning sessions, as well as Pragma-sponsored team lunches and activities. We enjoy spending time together!
  
    Part-time and flexible work arrangements are available.
    If you are excited by this opportunity, but don’t quite fit the description above, we’d still love to hear from you.
    Due to our government clients sensitivities, Australian Citizenship is required.

title: Ux/Ui Designer
description:
Job no: 505420
   
  Work type: Full time
   
  Location: VIC - Metro
   
  Categories: e-Commerce
   
  
 
  
   Australian owned global retail business 
   Career Progression, Profit Share & Team Member discounts 
   A vibrant, team culture where we embrace pace, encourage new ideas & leadership
  
   
   
   Who We Are: 
   We are an iconic Australian owned global retail organisation that includes Australia’s most successful retailers encompassing the Spotlight, Harris Scarfe, Mountain Designs & Anaconda brands 
   The eCommerce team plays an integral role in supporting organisational growth through assisting our leaders to ensure a streamline outcome across online and fulfilment of orders. 
   It’s a hands-on, fast-paced culture that rewards initiative and great ideas – and like any family, we back you to achieve your potential with excellent training and career development opportunities. 
   This role involves collaborating closely with the Digital & Brand Teams to ensure requirements and designs are properly implemented & managed
   
   
  What You Will Be Doing: 
   
   Develop sound UX concepts, including the definition of customer needs, task analysis, and the creation of personas, storyboards, customer journeys, scenarios, user flows and use cases. 
   Transform ideas and mock-ups into high fidelity concepts and designs. 
   Evangelise and advance our understanding and adoption of UX best practices, tools and documentation. 
   Ability to bring together user needs, business goals and technical realities. 
   Manage artwork files, style guides, design documentation and other graphical assets for development. 
   Create visual designs for mobile and web with finished artwork to accurately represent the final product 
   Optimise websites to ensure the best experience through understanding and analysis of users’ behaviour. 
   Apply specific experience using Analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics) to architect websites to drive desired traffic results.
  
   
   
   About You: 
   
   Must have at least 2+ years’ experience in UX/UI design for mobile and web. 
   Ability to work with Digital, Marketing or external vendors to define user scenarios, personas, user customer journeys and screen flows based on requirements. 
   Strong interaction / screen design skills based on user centric design processes with a high attention to detail. 
   Proficiency in Figma, Miro and associated design tools. 
   A strong sense of time management and the ability to adapt to competing priorities to meet deadlines. 
   Experience in incorporating UX/UI in the Agile methodology. 
   Exceptional collaboration, presentation & communication skills to defend designs & align key stakeholders. 
   Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards. 
   eCommerce experience in a retail environment.
  
   
   
   What’s in it for you? 
   Along with the incredible career- growth opportunity of being part of this evolving team, we can offer you; 
   
   Great salary base + Super + Profit Share 
   Career progression & personal development 
   A culture that rewards initiative and creativity 
   Centrally located office, close to South Melbourne Market 
   Benefits; team discount, EAP, gym discounts & more

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane, AU 
 
 
 
  Creativemass, through our flagship product WealthConnect™ aims to revolutionise the delivery of Financial Services. WealthConnect™ has been designed with investors at its core. We believe that complex, proprietary, closed and costly systems are not required for Advisors to provide good advice. 
   Building on customer-first principles of the world’s leading CRM platform, we have developed the world’s first investment and compliance platform based solely on Salesforce. We successfully listed on the Salesforce AppExchange in early 2020 and are on track to becoming the fastest growing Salesforce backed ISV company in Australia. 
 
 
 
  What we’re looking for 
 
 
  We are looking to expand our Product Development team and are looking for a highly motivated UI/UX designer to grow with our company and contribute something new to our eclectic mix of personalities. We have learnt that individuals that work best with us have the following traits: 
 
 
 
  You are open-minded and open to having your ideas tested 
 
 
  We are a close knit team and will continue to be as we scale. We want the team to be radically truthful and transparent with each other. There will be occasions where you will have a difference of opinion with a colleague and in these situations, you should be willing to speak up, put aside your ego or opinion and have a healthy debate on the problem at hand based on facts and fundamental design principles. 
 
 
 
  You embrace challenge and hard work 
 
 
  We are searching for someone who has a natural bias towards hard work and taking on new challenges. While this is something we will continually strive to minimise, there will be occasions where we will have to pull together a team and put in the extra effort to make sure we hit critical deadlines. 
 
 
 
  You roll up your sleeves when required 
 
 
  While design is a critical part of the Product Development value stream, without help from our colleagues, our product will not be successful. We are looking for creative individuals who are willing to roll up their sleeves when needed, to think creatively about our design solutions but to also help with testing, or fulfilling some other team obligations. 
 
 
 
  Responsibilities 
 
 
  You will be responsible for the design of functionality and components for our product, WealthConnect. To be successful in this role, you should be someone who is enthusiastic about all things related to design and more, be an excellent communicator and a champion working with other cross functional streams of the business. In this role, you will: 
 
 
 
  Design new features for our WealthConnect product. 
   
   
    
     
      
       Work closely with product owners to design new features and improve existing ones. 
       Conduct user research that can be used to validate solutions and implement best practice. 
       Design wireframes, interaction designs, visual designs and prototypes. 
       Understand and challenge UX trends and reflect on how we can apply it to our product for our customers. 
       Continuously learn about new features and propose solutions to the team to increase group productivity. 
       Work closely with our developers to share understanding of the designs and review work for quality control. 
       Collaborate with other designers to maintain a level of design consistency through quality of work and process workflow. 
       Interview users to gain an understanding of their needs and behaviours and document the requirements. 
       Track and analyse user experience metrics and reports to continuously improve on the UX of our product. 
       Ability to shift priorities and accomplish any other duties as directed by management. 
       Ability to support with the development of copy for the product. 
       
     
    
   
  
 
 
 
  Design and update our marketing resources 
   
   
    
     
      
       Create and update sales deck, reports, web content 
       Create and design marketing material such as infographics, images and videos. 
       
     
    
   
  
 
 
 
  Essential Skills 
 
 
  
   
    
     
      
       You have 3+ years experience of working in Adobe XD. 
       You have experience with web UX design and understand best practice for web and latest trends in web apps. 
       You have experience in mobile responsive design. 
       You can produce and review wireframes and storyboards for digital solutions. 
       You can build prototypes and design tests to validate designs based on customer needs, requirements and behaviours. 
       You are able to put yourself in the user’s shoes and understand and solve for their pain points. 
       You have a positive attitude and are willing to learn within a high-energy environment. 
       You are excellent at communicating your ideas, issues and solutions in a team environment, and have the ability to articulate your designs and take feedback well. 
       You have an eye for detail and can deliver elegant product experiences as part of a cross-functional team. 
       You challenge the status quo and continuously strive for new and innovative ways to improve our ways of working and our product. 
       You can manage your own workload effectively to make sure required tasks are completed. 
       Experience in finance/ fintech is highly valued. 
       Experience in Salesforce design is a plus. 
       Basic CSS/ HTML knowledge is a plus to be able to support build. 
       
     
    
   
  
 
 
 
  If you’re interested in the above position, please send your CV to careers@creativemass.com

title: Front-End/Web Developer
description:
At Neota, we are pioneers in no-code automation. Our technology empowers customers to fundamentally transform how they work and how they deliver services, with the result being business automation solutions delivering outcomes of much better quality, far greater consistency, and of astronomical scale compared to traditional or otherwise manual ways of working.We believe that our greatest asset is the people behind our platform. title: Front End Engineer
description:

For 12+ years we have worked with some of Australia’s biggest brands, delivering innovative experiences on both mobile and the latest in emerging technology.With offices in both Sydney and Melbourne, Bilue is driven by its mission to 'mobilise millions'. title: Junior Front-end Developer
description:
Job Status  : Full-Time, Ongoing Salary  : Base salary of $80,619 per annum, plus 10.5% superannuation contributions Position No:  SOH2119 Applications Close:  Tuesday 14 th March 2023, 11:59pm Role Enquiries:  recruitment@sydneyoperahouse.com Technical Enquiries:  Jobs NSW Helpdesk on 1800 562 679 An organisation where diversity of thought & experience is valued, supported & respected.  THE HOUSE At the Sydney Opera House you will be surrounded by supportive and hardworking teams who are filled with passion and creativity. You will be inspired to create value in everything you do and will be provided with opportunities to grow and achieve while making a positive contribution to our community. Our vision for diversity, inclusion and belonging (DI&B) is that the Sydney Opera House – who we are and everything we do – reflects and respects the diversity of the community. Our 2021-23 DI&B Strategy sets out the change we are driving in the lead up to our 50 th anniversary in 2023. These commitments work hand in hand with the commitments in our longstanding Reconciliation , Accessibility and Environmental Action Plans.We welcome and encourage applications from First Nations people, recognising the value, unique skills and knowledge that First Nations employees bring to the workplace. We encourage applications from people of all genders, as well as people from one or more of these underrepresented groups/communities, including but not limited to d/Deaf and Disabled people/people with disability, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and people who identify as LGBTIQ+.We recognise that everyone is unique, and that you might require some adjustments to ensure you have the best opportunity to apply and put your skills forward for consideration. If we can make some adjustments to the SOH recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, then please email us at recruitment@sydneyoperahouse.com or call us on 02 9250 7743 and let us know. Adjustments may include but are not limited to; alternate application methods, interview setup, physical requirements, guidance for trans or gender diverse applicants, interpreters or other access supports or specific interview availability times and more.For more information about the Sydney Opera House please refer to our website . YOUR NEW ROLE This position develops and maintains the front-end codebase for sydneyoperahouse.com and its associated applications. It works with internal specialists to and outside agencies to help provide a frictionless customer experience.Further detailed information about the role and its requirements can be obtained from the role description. ARE YOU THE ONE? We Are Looking For Someone With Front-end web development experience, including demonstrated HTML, CSS, and JavaScript ability.  Strong communication skills.  Strong analytical and problem-solving ability.  Flexibility and a commitment to continuous improvement. Desirable Experience with front-end frameworks, formats, and libraries such as React and Bootstrap.  Experience with Git and Webpack.  Experience developing for Drupal CMS.  Experience with software testing methods and frameworks such as Jest and Cypress. Benefits & CultureBeing Australia’s premier cultural institution, tourism destination & a celebrated community meeting place, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and dynamic working environment for all our staff. With values of Safety, Creativity, Excellence, Collaboration & Accountability your professional life is provided with every opportunity to succeed and develop in your chosen profession. Working with the Sydney Opera House gives you access to a great range of benefits including: Flexible working arrangements  5 weeks annual leave  Access to a range of internal and external professional development programs and staff engagement initiatives  Staff community groups like SOH Pride, First Nations Staff Network, Sustainable Environmental Action Leaders (aka ‘SEALs’) and more.  Fitness Passport & complimentary wellbeing programs including pilates, yoga, circuit classes, physiotherapy sessions as well as other wellbeing initiatives  Working for an organisation with a 5 Star Green Star Performance Rating from the Green Building Council of Australia (GBCA)  Working for an organisation who has committed to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals  And many more!  SOUND LIKE YOU? APPLY! Applicants are asked to include the following documents with their applications Up to date resume of no more than five pages  Address their suitability in a cover letter of no more than one page In addition, applicants will be prompted to answer the following two targeted questions in the online application platform. The Sydney Opera House is one of the world's busiest performing arts venues and aims for excellence in online customer engagement. Please outline how you think your skills and experience will assist you in contributing to Sydney Opera House web development.  As a Front-end Developer you will have created or contributed to an array of exciting projects. Tell us about the one you are most proud of and why? Applicants are required to create a profile and submit their application electronically for this position at https://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au/ .  Only applicants who apply online and include the requested documentation will be considered for this position  , unless otherwise discussed.To be eligible to apply for this position, applicants must have existing Australian work rights. Any offer of employment will be subject to a satisfactory National Police Check and Pre-Employment Health Assessment . The assessment seeks information only relevant to performing the inherent requirements of the job, it remains strictly confidential and applicants will be informed of the result.This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months.Applications will not be accepted from recruitment agencies.

title: Front-end Developer
description:
At Fastmail, we’re building a better future for the internet. We are creating this through our commitment to advancing open standards and user privacy. When the vast majority of people get email for free, our users choose us because they value both privacy and a great user experience. Our podcast, Digital Citizen, provides listeners with actionable advice about digital citizenship in their lives and our open source projects power email applications and more across the world.We’re searching for a mid level front-end developer to join our team. You’ll work with our collaborative team of developers, designers, and researchers to improve our customers’ experience, keeping it secure and a delight to use. We work together to write code that is optimised for in-browser speed and resilience. Our web app has to stay responsive while interacting with a sometimes-wayward server. The network isn’t reliable, latency is non-zero, and every missed data binding means one more bizarre state that the interface can enter. There’s always an interesting new challenge to solve!We use the tools the browser provides. Our interfaces are built in JavaScript, on our own Overture framework and the JMAP network standard. This gives us full control from top to bottom to build the right solutions.RequirementsMuch of what we do is bespoke so the most important attribute for success in this role is a willingness to learn and ask questions. The Fastmail web client is a complete network application running in the browser. You'll be learning many parts of the web API that often look cool but don't get used: IndexedDB, web workers, push, and the list goes on. As a web client for real standards, you'll also learn the web, calendar, and contact standards as they are, without lossy mediation by a third party web service API.You’re comfortable working with marketing, design and product managers to collaborate on feature development. You enjoy engaging with your colleagues to find the ideal solution. Experience with design systems is a bonus.You strive to find root causes and apply the fix at the right level of the stack; this includes reading other people’s code and determining why it exists before making changes. You delight in an elegant solution, especially if it makes the user’s experience faster. We take pride in the little details, and we hope you do too.You have excellent written language skills for async communication, strong verbal and interpersonal skills for collaborating in person, patience, diligence, and an ability to gracefully adapt to change.If this sounds like you and you’re not sure if you have enough experience, we encourage you to apply and have a chat with us.BenefitsThis is a full time hybrid role. And, like everyone on our team, you’ll get great benefits.4 weeks paid parental leave at full salaryannual professional development budget to fund your own growthopportunities to travel to our sister office in Philadelphia, a historic US city!dedicated time to contribute to open source, internet standards, and conference talksThis job is based in Melbourne CBD. We have a strong in-person culture and are looking for someone who will be on-site and part of that culture. We aim to be in the office 3 days a week and you are welcome to work your remaining schedule at home or in the office. We also offer further remote flexibility for life events.We’re in close communication with our colleagues in Philadelphia. This means that you’ll need to be available for an hour or two of morning calls (from 8am) each week. We are partners, parents and caregivers ourselves, and we understand time-zone flexibility goes in both directions. Talk to us if you’re unsure.We encourage employees to write and speak about the great work we do, and to stay engaged with their professional peers. Many staff members choose to attend conferences for learning and networking, and several staff members are regular conference speakers.You can read about our values, and our blog contains interviews with some of the people who will become your colleagues at Fastmail.We welcome all applicants regardless of race, colour, religion, age, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, disability, or sexual orientation. The thing we can’t help with is a visa or sponsorship. You must already have the right to work in the Australia.

page applications (SPAs).Working knowledge of Web protocols and standards REST, SSO etc.Good Expertise in development and debugging tools such as VSCode, git, npm, chrome developer tools,Familiar with creating Custom Reusable React Components Library.Involved in writing application-level code to interact with APIs, RESTful Web Services using AJAX, JSON.Knowledge of utilizing cloud technologies including Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure Blob and Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF).Expertise in RESTful services to integrate between Application to ApplicationExperience with front-end development with back-end system integration.Proficient in using JEST framework for unit testingGood Experience in Bug tracking tools like JIRA, HP Quality CenterAbility to work effectively while working as a team member as well as individually.Excellent communication and Inter-Personal Skills, well organized, goal oriented.Your Key ResponsibilitiesParticipate in the estimation of work product in order to provide right information to TL/PM for overall project estimationUnderstand the requirements both functional and non-functional by going through the specifications and with inputs from business analysts and participate in creating high level estimate as well as translating the same to systems requirements in order to create a systems requirements document and participate effectively in the design, development and testing phases of the projectDevelop and review artifacts (Code, Documentation, Unit test scripts) conduct reviews for self and peers, conduct unit test and document unit test results for complex programs in order to build the application and make it ready for validation/deliveryRequired QualificationsBachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. title: Frontend Engineer
description:
Bare is focused on bringing end-of-life planning into the digital age and, along the way, making a real impact on people at a time in their lives that really matters.A brief overviewSince launching in 2019 we've grown exponentially. Bare started out as a direct-to-consumer funeral home offering a digitally enabled, low cost funeral service. We've since expanded to become Australia's leading provider of prepaid funerals, online wills, online estate planning and pet funerals. Our vision is to become the end-of-life CRM, supporting individuals and families deal with a difficult topic in an empathic, affordable and sustainable way.The exciting part? The journey has only just started. We are backed by some of Australia's highest profile investors, are currently one of the fastest growing companies in Australia, and we're committed to making a difference. Join us on the ground floor, and be intimately involved in the creation and development of a product that is category-leading.Bare Frontend EngineerWe are looking for a Frontend Engineer with 3+ years experience building web-based applications with technologies like Javascript, React, Ruby on Rails and AWS. You'll be working in a cross functional product team and focused on designing and developing products that are flexible, scalable, and reusable. We put in place a best-practice modern software engineering environment (end-to-end automated testing, automated infrastructure provisioning) and look forward to your help to make sure we are an engineering group as performant as the best ones out there.What you can expect in a Frontend Engineer role at Bare:Develop features and shape the Bare product in a secure, well-tested, and performant wayWork with Product Management and other stakeholders (Backend, Design, etc.) to iterate on new features within the Bare productCollaborate with other frontend engineers and help define our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale web environment. Maintain and advocate for these standards through code reviewConfidently ship features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projectsWork within a 100% remote, cross functional product team to make a real difference - our customers are incredibly grateful for the service we provideRequirementsProfessional experience with modern JavaScript web frameworks (React, Vue, Angular, Ember, etc) and static site generatorsA solid understanding of semantic HTML, CSS, and core JavaScript conceptsComfort working in a highly agile, intensely iterative software development processPositive and solution-oriented mindsetAn inclination towards communication, inclusion, and visibilitySelf-motivated and self-managing, with strong organisational skillsDemonstrated ability to work closely with other parts of the organisationAbility to thrive in a fully remote organisationCaring about high-engineering quality, and how to marry that with a high and sustainable development speed.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
Why join MagicBrief?At MagicBrief our mission is to become the tool makers for a generation of businesses, enabling creative teams and entrepreneurs to scale their brands. We’re looking for a skilled Frontend Engineer to help us deliver product that businesses are relying on to grow.We’re backed by the best, including Blackbird, Archangel and a talented group of individuals, including the founders of Vimeo, UsTwo, Eucalyptus, Spriggy & Halter.About The RoleWe’re still early in the MagicBrief journey, but our customer base is growing rapidly, and our product roadmap is substantial. If you want to get in on the ground floor and make a significant impact on the development of the product, this is the role for you.You'll be an integral part of our engineering team, working directly with our founding team. You'll have a significant impact on our product and help shape our future.We're an engineering-led organisation and offer an excellent work environment with a modern tech stack that includes full CI/CD, a fully supported local development environment (frontend and back), in-depth code reviews and mentorship.We use a modern stack for design and development, including Notion, Linear and Figma.We also dedicate 10% of our Engineering time to internal itches, including improving pipeline performance, building developer tools, improving infrastructure and paying down technical debt before it becomes a drag on the organisation and contributing back to open source.We use TypeScript and build scalable systems so we can continuously make progress on a solid foundation. We don’t expect you to have a background in everything we use, but we do expect strong JavaScript fundamentals and a background working with React, and, ideally, TypeScript.What You’ll DoWork closely with founders and design to implement fast new feature conceptsBuilding new user-facing features with beautiful and scalable UI componentsImproving application performance by profilingDesign and develop the frontend of the company's software products using modern technologies such as React,Collaborate with other engineers, designers, and stakeholders to build highly-performant, scalable, and responsive user interfacesImplement and maintain test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery processesAct as a technical expert and mentor to other team membersParticipate in code reviews and ensure that the code is maintainable, scalable, and follows best practicesStay up-to-date with the latest web development technologies, trends and best practicesWork with the product team to identify and implement new features and improvements to the softwareTechTypescriptNodeExpressDockerPostgresRedisPrismatRPC (if you don’t know this, you’ll learn to love it quickly)ReactTailwind (& Tailwind UI)RequirementsStrong experience with JavaScript and web development best practices. A minimum of 3 years of experience in web development, with at least 2 years of experience building user interfaces using modern frontend frameworks such as React,Strong experience with HTML, CSS and modern web technologies such as Webpack, etc. Experience with implementing and maintaining test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery processes. Strong problem-solving skills, ability to think creatively, and ability to adapt to new technologiesStrong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work well in a teamStrong attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentWhat We OfferInteresting and challenging workA super supportive teamCompetitive salary and equityDirect involvement with the founders, gives you a chance to have a tangible impact on the company's futureCentral city officeFantastic opportunities for personal and professional growthA chance to work on a product that helps people’s businesses grow and succeedAn engineering-led culture where you will be a core part of the teamWe believe that as an early-stage company, working together in person gives us a competitive edge by letting us move faster and make decisions together on the fly. We also appreciate the importance of deep work, and we are set on building a culture that facilitates it.If you’ve gotten this far in the job ad and think this is for you, come make some magic. We want someone who reads the whole brief and sweats the details for this role.

title: Web Developer
description:
Dabble is an online sports and racing bookmaker (licensed by the NTRC), formed in 2020 and embracing the scaleup journey. Our aim is to disrupt the game with a truly immersive socialized betting experience designed to provide evolutionary entertainment to our punters via genuine interaction and engagement. Our brand ethos, “share the experience”, means we believe in community and celebration - both in the app and in the office!We have office hubs in Darwin, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide and Albury - and expansion is in our sights. We believe in remote-first work, though in the spirit of our community encourage our people to take advantage of our national network, with cross-office sponsored flights on offer all year round. We are a team of highly driven enthusiasts, and we are looking for our next Dabbler to join us as we continue in our journey.Dabble CultureDress for your day so you can focus on what mattersSwitch up your office, work from home, work from wherever helps you to deliverGenuine, like-minded team of visionaries. We welcome ideas big and small!Scheduled focus time to encourage deep thoughtOur annual convention, DabbleCon, brings us all together to celebrate our successes and plan continued evolution over the coming yearEach day is led through upholding our core Values: Fun, Celebratory, Community, EvolutionaryDabble PerksA minimum of five weeks of paid annual leave for all DabblersPaid parental leave for both primary and secondary caregiverWe encourage you to visit our network of offices: sponsored flights available to staff and spouse/immediate familyFlexibility with working hours to accommodate our cross-country employee base: you are free to manage your own timeYour mental health is our genuine concern: we keep a dedicated psychologist on the booksUp to 10% annual cash bonus based on Company performance metricsDabble Day Dividend: all Dabblers split the day’s revenue evenly on our birthday each year. You share the workload, why shouldn’t you share the reward?Safety first: your ride home from company sponsored events and your flu jab is on usOverviewThe Web Developer will maintain, develop and implement all website-related requirements for Dabble’s marketing department. Reporting to the General Manager Digital Marketing, this full-time position will be responsible for maintaining and developing Dabble-owned websites, acting as Technical Lead during MarTech procurement, and collaborating with the Technology and Product departments on MarTech projects. This is an exciting role that will allow the successful candidate to expand their MarTech and Mobile App Development skills and knowledge.Primary LocationThis role is currently open to all locations within Australia, however candidates based in Melbourne may be preferred.Responsibilities: Web Development Maintain and develop Dabble’s Content Management System (CMS);Implement design revisions to Dabble-owned websites;Maintain and integrate all website scripts, tags, and pixels;Manage tag manager tool, including creating new tags and triggers;Manage web analytics tool, including creating new events and conversions;Maintain Register of relevant SDKs and APIs and coordinate updates with Tech department;Implement technical SEO fixes discovered in weekly SEO audits.MarTech Project Management Scope and document potential projects;Sit in on meetings with potential MarTech vendors, acting as Technical Lead;Collaborate with the Product team to write and rank tickets;Liaise with MarTech vendors and Product team to coordinate MarTech implementations.Skills & QualificationsExperience with headless CMS;Experience using static site generators such as Gatsby and Hydrogen;Fluent in JavaScript, CSS, HTML, and Webpack;Experience working with React.js;Experience working with Node.js;Experience working with AWS;Experience working with GraphQLExperience with Google Marketing Platform;Understanding of basic marketing principles;Ability to prioritise and execute tasks in a dynamic (and fun) environment;Strong multi-tasking and organisational skills, with excellent attention to detail;Enjoys working in a team and collaborating with others.Are you a Dabbler?A Dabbler’s attitude is paramount, as the right person will be able to learn quickly and adapt to any skill gaps. A Dabbler is always a team player, with a willingness to share with and learn from others. Being a remote-first workplace, collaborative working styles are crucial to empower and grow each individual member (eg we prefer openness via public channels to problem solve or ideate on Slack).A Dabbler uses their freedom of autonomy to its absolute potential and enjoys contributing to the Dabble community. We hold respect for our peers very highly – there is no such thing as a bad idea. We encourage you to think differently, be brave and strive to always raise the bar. Dabble was born out of thought sharing and should tackle growth in the same way. Dabble embraces empowerment of all people at any level of seniority and experience to ‘own their work’ and ‘talk their book’ wherever they can.RemunerationThe advertised salary for this position is $100, 000 - $120, 000 + Super + Benefits with room to be flexible.

title: Back-end Developer
description:
At Neota, we are pioneers in no-code automation. Our technology empowers customers to fundamentally transform how they work and how they deliver services, with the result being business automation solutions delivering outcomes of much better quality, far greater consistency, and of astronomical scale compared to traditional or otherwise manual ways of working.We believe that our greatest asset is the people behind our platform. That technology is most powerful when driven by purpose. Our no-code platform is a game-changer for legal, procurement, risk and compliance professionals and we are always looking for curious minds and results-oriented professionals to join us.What you will be doing: Making daily contributions to the server components of Neota Logic’s SaaS platform, using Scala, Play, SQL, and a variety of server-side tools. Working with the front end team to design and implement flexible, secure, high-performance, highly-available RESTful/GraphQL API’s. Working with the product team to ensure that your software is delivered on time and as expected. Focusing on quality, by writing unit tests and collaborating with QA to develop robust test plans.What we are looking for: 3+ years of hands-on object oriented design and development using proven architectural patterns (in any major language; Java, Scala preferred). Proficiency in relational database design, architecture, scalability, performance, and tuning. Experience designing and building scalable & secure RESTful/GraphQL API’s. Experience with cloud infrastructure & services (AWS, Azure). Experience writing unit tests and collaborating with QA engineers to develop test plans. Experience with front-end web technologies such as JavaScript/JQuery, HTML5, CSS (a plus). The ability to come up to speed quickly and thrive in an environment rich in complexity. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present ideas and solutions in a clear and organized manner. The ability to work independently and achieve established goals with minimal supervision.Strong attention to detail, but with a solid grasp of the bigger picture.RequirementsRequired Skills: Object Oriented programming (Java or Scala preferred), API design, Performance analysis, RDBMS/SQLSupporting Skills: GraphQL, Git, Security, AWS/AzureEducation: BSCS (MSCS/PhD a strong plus)Professional Experience: 5+ years (3+ years with MSCS)BenefitsWe value our employees’ time and efforts. We work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, with flexible working conditions and an encouraging environment where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture.

description:
Company DescriptionGumtree, together with Carsguide and Autotrader, have joined The Market Herald (ASX:TMH) to create Australia’s leading multi-category classifieds marketplace, business and finance community forum, and editorial lifestyle network reaching more than 1 in 3 Australian adults every month.Job DescriptionWorking as part of a cross functional agile team you will be creating new features that engage and delight our customers. title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
Bright is building an aggregated food ordering app with health tracking. It’s like Google search for venues/menus with Apple health integrated throughout. We’ve raised ~$2mil so far and are planning to start a ~$10m seed round in mid-2023.Users can order from pre-existing food/delivery platforms like UberEats, Menulog, DoorDash, Dan Murphy’s, Coles, and Woolworths at no extra cost. We use machine learning to generate nutrition profiles for all menu items, and these insights are passed onto our health-tracking system which is deeply integrated throughout the app. Our health tracking features are like an operating system for health and wellness because users can manage their micros/macros, track vitamin and nutrients, set dietary and allergen filters, alongside calculate their energy expenditure.RoleWe are seeking a Software Engineer to join our team and support the development/maintenance of our order-forwarding systems. Our codebase is mostly in Python3 and is hosted on Google Cloud Platform across GAE, Cloud Functions, and Compute Engine. We also use MongoDB and Google Firebase.Essential ResponsibilitiesDeveloping Flask APIs that interface with public-facing APIs of major food delivery platforms like UberEats, Menulog, and DoorDash.Using Selenium to create ordering scripts via Chrome Webdriver.Reporting defects and working with the team to resolve themDebugging existing APIs through automated test scripts.Deploying applications and working with instance scaling to Google Cloud Platform.Collaborate to clarify requirements, especially in terms of testability, consistency, and completeness.Qualifications:Background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related degree.2+ years of experience in a similar field.Fluency in Python3 is a must.Awareness and/or experience with GCP and/or AWS and its various tools, such as GAE, Cloud Functions, Compute Engine, and VPC Network.Experience with Flask, Django, or FastAPI Frameworks.Experience with Bitbucket/GitHub/Gitlab versioning control tools.Experience writing documentation using Swagger in OpenAPI 2/3 standard.Would be nice to have:Experience with MongoDB and Google Firestore NoSQL frameworks.Experience with Node.js and Typescript.Experience in web scraping using Selenium or similar libraries.Familiarity with API testing tools like Postman
