title: Backend Developer (Node.JS)
description:
Easygo is a well-established tech scale-up and we pride ourselves on being early adopters, progressive in our approach and remain agile in the ever-changing technology landscape.Our core focus is in the online gaming space — building well-designed casino games, crypto platforms and sportsbooks. The products we build are used by millions around the world and you'll see their logos across the EPL, UFC, F1 advocated by e-gamers and in a number of other sporting spaces.The last three years have been huge for us, growing from 20 to 150+ team members. Whilst the products that we have built are global, the majority of the team sits in our Australian headquarters which is in the heart of Melbourne's CBD. We value company culture and team collaboration, and currently have a hybrid working model in place, with three days in the office and two days working from home. However, majority of teams do enjoy coming in almost every day, and could we blame them? We've got all the bells and whistles you could want, including an in-house barista, table tennis and pool tables, PS5 and Nintendo Switches, a meditation room, free weekly massages, catered breakfast daily, free Friday weekly company pub lunches alongside with a Friday cocktail hour and all you can help yourself to drinks fridge and snack wall. The Role:We are constantly on the lookout for Backend developers to join our team and you'll be responsible for the server-side of our web applications. Ultimately, we would like you to be able to develop, maintain and create functional web applications to a high level of standard. Thus, if you have excellent programming skills and a passion for developing applications or improving existing ones, we would like to meet you! We also do offer a competitive salary depending on experience, with a broad range starting from $90,000 - $160,000 + Super. Main duties and responsibilities:   Development of our exciting innovative games and features Developing Microservices Produce readable and reusable code Doing API integrations  Increase efficiency through automation, workflow streamlining, and system optimization Promote high code standards within the team Optimisation of the game for best performance Code and debug core platform components Work at all stages of the product lifecycle from requirements capture, through design and implementation to testing and integration Keeping up with current and emerging technologies, and making recommendations to the team Dedicate care and responsibility for the final quality of the product Promote high code standards within the team Requirements Proven work experience as a Back-end developer with over 2+ years of experience  In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment) Comprehensive understanding of our development stack, languages and frameworks, specifically: NodeJS (TypeScript), GraphQL, API Integrations, Relational Databases, Kubernetes & Docker. Excellent analytical and time management skills Teamwork skills with a problem-solving attitude It would be a bonus if you also had (Desirable skills): Postgres or ElasticSearch expertise Big Data / analytics experience (i.e AWS Redshift, ETL tools, Tableau, MicroStrategy) Benefits Flexible working hours Team socials and adhoc get-togethers, and events for you to get involved in (if you wish) $750 per annum to spend on upskilling/training Optional flu shot (for the entire office) and paid time off to get your Covid vaccine Daily catered breakfast Massage Wednesdays - we get professionals to do this! Friday parmas/pub lunch, plus happy hour in the office from 4PM Table tennis and pool tables, plus a games room with PS5 and dartboards Company retreats each year One (1) paid volunteer day per year A full-time barista/kitchen manager who will make you coffee, tea and fresh juices Help yourself to the fully stocked drinks fridge and snack shelf Our amazing Workplace Experience Manager Renae will get you the snacks you desire! We have many many more initiatives that we will roll out over the next 12 months."We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant"We believe that the unique contributions of everyone at Easygo are the driver of our success.To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.We are passionate about providing a workplace that encourages great participation and an equal playing field, where merit and accomplishment are the only criteria for success.

title: Back End Developer
description:
Team: Product and DevelopmentWho we are:Picklebet is a next generation esports, sports and racing betting platform and media brand. Australian owned & operated, we are set to become a major player, both in Australia and internationally.The Picklebet team is dedicated to building remarkable products for the betting community; designed to entertain and deliver fun, engaging experiences.After significant growth in 2022, we are looking to expand our development capabilities, for our in house technology stack. Joining as part of a growing team, we need smart, and self-motivated people to come along for the ride, to take us to the next level, and deliver on our mission.Purpose of this role: We are looking for a senior back end developer to work on our live, multi-platform, multi-user entertainment platform. You’ll work closely with our CTO, developers and other stakeholders in a highly collaborative and technical environment.Below are some of the traits and experience that will make you successful in this role:API Development Experience - The primary focus of this role is developing the HTTP APIs and business logic to power the Picklebet platform. We need someone with experience in this area. They will have a history of delivering several projects under their belt. Picklebet is built using Kotlin, experience with other JVM languages is valuable but Kotlin will be the language you use day to day. Proven ability to get things done - We are a small team that build and operate a complex and rapidly scaling betting platform. We are proud of the amount and quality of work we get out the door each week and are looking for someone with a similar attitude and ability. If you want to work somewhere where the code you write today is being used by tens of thousands of customers next week then Picklebet might be for you. This means you're willing to get stuck in and get things done even if it is something outside your day to day role.End to end view of software development - You will be working closely with colleagues to deliver features from inception, design, implementation, QA to deployment and operation. Once live you will be monitoring, iterating and improving your solutions based on customer feedback. Self managed - We are not big on micromanagement at Picklebet, instead giving you the freedom to operate however you choose to perform at your best; this will require a level of ability to manage your own day to day tasks and communicate effectively.Scalable and Performant Solutions - Picklebet is in an exciting transition phase, as our user base grows we are encountering those 'Nice to have' scaling problems start ups have. Experience and interest in solving those kinds of problems is a valuable asset in this role.Databases - We lean heavily on our PostgreSQL database so strong SQL, database design and RDBMS knowledge is a must.Remote working - Ability to work remotely. We work remotely by default but there is an opportunity to work in the Newstead office if that suits you. We try to get into the office once a week because some things are just better face to face.Cloud experience - Experience building applications that run in a cloud environment is essential. Experience configuring and maintaining cloud environments is also valuable.Ability to work in a team - You need to be able to communicate and collaborate effectively in a team environment. As a team we are continually trying to improve, so we are looking for people that want to contribute to that process with new ideas, technologies and approaches that drive our team and product forward.Gambling Industry - Must be willing to work in the gambling industry, we understand that isn't for everyone. Knowledge and background in gambling would be a plus.Front End Web Development - Experience in this area is a bonus. There are opportunities to work on the UI side of the platform but primarily this is a back end role.Education - A Bachelor's Degree or equivalent commercial experience.Qualifications3+ years experience in a similar role.  If you don’t have 3+ years experience but can point to relevant work that impresses this will be acceptable. University qualifications would be desirable but not essential.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
description:
Company DescriptionWho we are:FinClear was established in 2015, with offices now in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We are an independent, Australian owned and developed technology and financial services business, specializing in providing trading, execution, clearing and technology solutions to wholesale intermediaries, FinTech’s, wealth managers and financial planners.At FinClear - Technology and progress are in our DNA. Our Financial Markets infrastructure deals with massive amounts of data and huge volumes of transactions that are executed in real-time to a vast audience. But unlike others, we own our core regulatory and technology infrastructure enabling us to move quickly and build solutions to give our clients the competitive advantage.We’ve tripled in size since mid-2021 and plan to continue growing with more platforms and services being rapidly developed. That’s where you come in.Job DescriptionAbout the role:FinClear is looking for a Software Engineer to join us on our journey as we continue to build functionalities across our FCX platform that leverages the power of Distributed Ledger Technology. This role will be working within a team of 4 in Sydney that collaborates with other squads across Perth & Melbourne. These squads form part of a larger cross functional technology team of 60 and growing.At FinClear, the team of Software Engineers come from diverse backgrounds and have a passion for their craft. With feedback from both internal and external users, our Software Engineers are equipped to make better decisions on how to enhance, build and optimize a suite of products that delights our customers. You will work alongside industry experts and talented senior engineers, building a new financial platform with modern technology and tools, where your contributions will have a strong impact on the success of the platform.Based on the current composition of the squad, we believe a passionate Software Engineer who enjoys working with a team of seniors across the Full Stack would really enjoy the opportunity.Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:Contributing to product features that reach beyond the UI, into our ecosystem of Microservices. Producing code that is well written, maintainable, security conscious and performant. Developing stunning, professional User Interfaces with React, Next.JS and MUI. Maintaining the platform and resolving issues as they arise. Collaborating with other specialists in the team as you work together on Epics and Sprints. Working with other squads on business objectives as opportunities ariseCode reviewsMentor and share your knowledge with other Software EngineersParticipate in learning and development sessionsThe Tech Stack:React, Next.JS, MUI, JavaScript, TypescriptDAML Smart Contracts & Ledger TechnologyMicroservice Architecture, Consul, VaultGRPC MessagingJava EE, JPA, GuicePostgreSQLGit, Maven, Jira, Confluence QualificationsRequired:Minimum of 3+ years working experience in React3+ years experience working within a Java environmentBonus points for:Proven experience working with Next.JSAdditional InformationWhat are the ingredients to our secret sauce?That’s our people and the technology solutions we create, as the business grows, we are also evolving our benefits to one that our people love!Benefits:A team that is invested in the success of FinClear and a generous ESOP for all our employees16 Weeks of gender neutral paid parental leaveA flexible work environment - we have fantastic new offices where we come to collaborate and have those face-to-face meetings with some days at home An inclusive and diverse working environment for allPrioritise mental health with all our staff having free access to our EAP programme including 1:1 session with qualified coaches and psychologistsE-Vehicles – Salary SacrificeReady to apply?If this sounds like something you might be interested in, submit your application by selecting “I'm Interested” or "Apply".Alternatively :To refer a friend, select "Refer a friend"For More information about FinClear, visit our Careers page https://finclear.com.au/careersAny additional queries Email : careers@finclear.com.au Please note :Applications will be reviewed w/c 13/03/2023Rights to legally work in Australia is a must to be considered for the immediate opportunities at FinClear, (sponsorship options are currently not an option)

title: Software Engineer, Full Stack (Australia)
description:
Equal Access to High-Quality Education Moves Our World ForwardMeet Cadmus!At Cadmus, we believe every student should have equal opportunity to achieve academic excellence; that’s why we’re changing how the world learns!Cadmus is a global EdTech company purposefully built for the higher education sector to break down global learning barriers by providing educators and diverse student cohorts with access to high-quality learning and assessment. Built on rich, student-centric values, Cadmus empowers individuals to achieve their highest potential and graduate with the critical skills and knowledge to profoundly impact our workforces, communities, and evolving world.A Bold Plan for Global ImpactAt Cadmus, we’re working hard in pursuit of an ambitious, world-shaping goal: to provide 1 billion students with access to high-quality education by 2050.That’s why we need a Full Stack Development superstar to join our team and help us maintain a high-quality experience for our users worldwide — ensuring our cloud infrastructure is reliable, performant and set up to scale. We want to do everything we can to ensure our users enjoy their experience and love our platform. With countless opportunities to make an impact, you’ll help us solve exciting engineering challenges and deliver improved functionality to take Cadmus even further.About The RoleAs a Full Stack Developer, you'll work across multiple codebases with a small team of cross-functional developers to solve a wide range of product engineering and architectural design challenges. You'll apply your software engineering skills to build performant, modern front-end applications with functional paradigms in React and Typescript. You'll also implement the backend GraphQL APIs (Elixir) and the micro-services which furnish the product features.You will have strong ownership across the development cycle and in addition to implementing new features, you'll focus on improving performance and reliability, and polish existing features. This is a truly unique opportunity to help shape our technology stack, processes, and contribute to the culture of the engineering team.About Our TechReact (Typescript) front-end web applications (SPA)Elixir backend with GraphQL APIsHaskell web services and Typescript (NodeJS) lambda functionsAWS cloud infrastructureWe also use and love to experiment with other languages for various tooling to ensure we find the best tool for the job. If you want to know more about what it’s like to be a developer at Cadmus, check out our blog post.RequirementsWe want to hear from developers with a passion for building modern web applications. You love exploring new technologies in order to solve problems and want to make constant improvements to our users’ experience. You have an eye for UI design and an interest in applying product development methodologies to boost the user experience. You thrive working in a team, love end-to-end ownership, obsess over details, and use data to help make the best choices for the wider business.In this role you'll:Develop complex front-end applications in React, in Typescript, and the GraphQL and REST APIs servicing themImplement features for our web-based rich-text Editor and the surrounding architecture for a complete online editing environmentWrite code and services for the backend systems in Elixir, Haskell, and other languages to implement business logicImplement the testing, performance, and telemetry processes for the product features to ensure a high-quality experience for our usersPlay an active role in designing and improving the overall product architecture to support massive growth in users and productsCollaborate with product designers and other developers to scope and plan new features, translating requirements for a feature into technical designWe’d love to hear from you if you have:2-4 years industry experience in software developmentExperience developing rich front-end applications in React and using the frameworks in the React ecosystemExperience with Typescript and Browser DOM APIsExperience in creating and working with front-end design systems, CSS-in-JS and CSS layouts with Flexbox and Grid systemsBack-end programming experience with languages like Elixir, Typescript (NodeJS), Ruby, Haskell, or similar in building web serversKnowledge of computer science fundamentals, data structures and design patterns, and an ability to use them practically when implementing solutionsWe'd really love to hear from you if you have:Startup DNA; you’re flexible, comfortable with ambiguity, and have experience scaling systems to support rapid growthExperience with Functional Programming languagesBenefitsA remote-friendly, flexible working culture; where you can work from any global locationLearning allowances; because we don’t just have words on a website, we genuinely do what we say and provide educational opportunities to all (including the Cadmus team)A diverse and inclusive workplace where there are no barriers to anyone succeedingA surrounding team of mission-driven individuals who genuinely love what they doEquity incentives; that way, we all share in the success of CadmusMentoring and succession planning for your careerVirtual pats from Homer, our resident (and super cute) dog!We're a remote-friendly company, and this role is open to candidates based in Melbourne or remote from anywhere in Australia.Hiring ProcessApply online with your resume only.Instead of a cover letter, we’d love for you to answer a few questions alongside your application.Our interview process is normally a recruiter interview, a hiring manager interview, a programming task, and 2-3 hours of onsite interviews that will be held via Zoom.While we review your application, get to know us by visiting cadmus.io or following our social channels.Inclusivity at CadmusAt Cadmus, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds because it makes our company stronger. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital, or disability status. If you share our values and enthusiasm for education, you will find a home at Cadmus.If you need assistance or accommodations made due to a disability, please let us know.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Why join MagicBrief?At MagicBrief our mission is to become the tool makers for a generation of businesses, enabling creative teams and entrepreneurs to scale their brands. We’re looking for a skilled Frontend Engineer to help us deliver product that businesses are relying on to grow.We’re backed by the best, including Blackbird, Archangel and a talented group of individuals, including the founders of Vimeo, UsTwo, Eucalyptus, Spriggy & Halter.About The RoleWe’re still early in the MagicBrief journey, but our customer base is growing rapidly, and our product roadmap is substantial. If you want to get in on the ground floor and make a significant impact on the development of the product, this is the role for you.You'll be an integral part of our engineering team, working directly with our founding team. You'll have a significant impact on our product and help shape our future.We're an engineering-led organisation and offer an excellent work environment with a modern tech stack that includes full CI/CD, a fully supported local development environment (frontend and back), in-depth code reviews and mentorship.We use a modern stack for design and development, including Notion, Linear and Figma.We also dedicate 10% of our Engineering time to internal itches, including improving pipeline performance, building developer tools, improving infrastructure and paying down technical debt before it becomes a drag on the organisation and contributing back to open source.We use TypeScript and build scalable systems so we can continuously make progress on a solid foundation. We don’t expect you to have a background in everything we use, but we do expect strong JavaScript fundamentals and a background working with React, and ideally TypeScript.What You’ll DoWork closely with founders and design to implement fast new feature conceptsBuilding new user-facing features with beautiful and scalable UI componentsImproving application performance by profilingDesign and develop the frontend of the company's software products using modern technologies such as ReactCollaborate with other engineers, designers, and stakeholders to build highly-performant, scalable, and responsive user interfacesImplement and maintain test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery processesAct as a technical expert and mentor to other team membersParticipate in code reviews and ensure that the code is maintainable, scalable, and follows best practicesStay up-to-date with the latest web development technologies, trends and best practicesWork with the product team to identify and implement new features and improvements to the softwareTechTypescriptNodeExpressDockerPostgresRedisPrismatRPC (if you don’t know this, you’ll learn to love it quickly)ReactTailwind (& Tailwind UI)RequirementsStrong experience with JavaScript and web development best practices. A minimum of 3 years of experience in web development, with at least 2 years of experience building user interfaces using modern frontend frameworks such as React,Strong experience with HTML, CSS and modern web technologies such as Webpack, etc. Experience with implementing and maintaining test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery processes. Strong problem-solving skills, ability to think creatively, and ability to adapt to new technologiesStrong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work well in a teamStrong attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentWhat We OfferInteresting and challenging workA super supportive teamCompetitive salary and equityDirect involvement with the founders gives you a chance to have a real impact on the company's futureCentral city officeFantastic opportunities for personal and professional growthA chance to work on a product that helps people’s businesses grow and succeedAn engineering-led culture where you will be a core part of the teamWe believe that as an early-stage company, working together in person gives us a competitive edge by letting us move faster and make decisions together on the fly. We also appreciate the importance of deep work, and we are set on building a culture that facilitates it.If you’ve gotten this far in the job ad and think this is for you, come make some magic. We want someone who reads the whole brief and sweats the details for this role.

title: Fullstack Engineer - SRE
description:
Upflowy was founded on the core belief that growth plays a vital role in our everyday life, at every level, personal and company. Upflowy is here to help growth leaders build and AB test their lead and signup flows without the engineering burden. We’re solving for up to 60% of marketing resources being wasted on non-optimized first interactions with their users. Beyond that, we’re here to define a new category of best-in-class experiences throughout the whole online journey, leveraging fast iterations and advanced personalization.This is the perfect opportunity to join an innovative business that challenges the status quo and sets the benchmark for others to follow. You'll be part of an open, team-oriented, and results-based culture where your input is encouraged and your success is rewarded.You can see more details about our launch on Product Hunt here. We’re excited to say we were the No.1 product for that week.And you can read more about our Seed funding round on Tech Crunch here.DiversityAt Upflow we know that diverse teams are better performing teams. Statistics show that certain parts of the job seeking demographic won’t apply if they feel they aren’t a 100% match to the requirements, but we want to change that. So even if you think you don’t meet all of the skills listed, or tick all the boxes, please still apply as we’d love to hear from you.Fullstack Software Engineer / SREYour work will be instrumental in how we set up and run our Dev, Integration, Test, Staging and Production environments and processes. Within these cycles, you can help build a key pillar of Upflowy’s growing Engineering culture, and ensure our Engineers have the best environment possible to deliver a world class product to our customers.Our product is growing quickly, 1,000 accounts to 20,000+ in 2022 alone. Being at the front of this engineering challenge, you can add tremendous value to how we set up CI/CD pipelines, how our product scales, how we monitor our infrastructure and how our developers write, test and deploy code.You will find solutions and bring ideas and opinions to our Engineering discussions. The role straddles both Engineering and SRE disciplines and you’ll need to be comfortable and enjoy both.RequirementsWe’d love someone to bring as many of these as possible, but it’s rare to have all of them so please apply if you don’t have 100% of the skills listed.Development experience with JavaScript, Node.JS, React.JS, Typescript and associated librariesServerless Architecture SRE experience, with a focus on “The 4 Golden Signals of SRE”Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)Maintenance, monitoring and improvement of CI/CD pipelines (Gitlab & Kubernetes)Automation experience, ideally at scaleB2B SaaS product experienceExperience mentoring other Engineers and contributing to best practice discussionsTriage, diagnosis and root cause resolutionBenefitsAttractive salary & ESOPSalary Sacrifice for EquipmentRemote first working cultureChoice of equipment and hardware when startingTeam social eventsCareer path development program2 Team Offsites per year (pending Covid)Tailored Health & Wellness AllowanceEducation Allowance

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
DescriptionWho are we?Lyka is an Australian founded pet wellness company that’s shaking up an outdated industry and paving the way for happier, healthier pets. Sadly, statistics have shown us that approximately eighty percent of pets are suffering from dental disease, with one in every three being diagnosed with cancer, and forty-one percent overweight. As humans we are acutely aware of the positive impact fresh wholefoods can have on our health and wellbeing, however the same hasn’t always been said for our furry friends. We're on a mission to change that, starting with nutritionally balanced, wholefood meals delivered direct to doors around Australia. As the world’s most sustainable pet wellness company, we’re putting pets and our planet first.Today, we are proud to share we’ve served and fed over 10 million meals to puppers and their parents across Australia, and this is just the beginning. Our vision is to create multiple nutritional products, adding disease prevention meals and supplements, and take Lyka into new markets.Currently, we have a team of 140 pet-obsessed people on our team who share our vision. These carefully selected people are dedicated to building the next generation of technology and products to help empower pet parents to take control over their pet’s wellbeing. To date, we have raised over $40M in funding from our venture fund investments and pet industry insiders, who believe in our mission and ability to drive change in an outdated industry, providing nutrition that nourishes puppers from the inside out.Are you ready to shake things up and give pets the life they deserve? Come join your people.Engineering and Digital Product at LykaOur technology, systems and processes have allowed us to scale from zero and find product market fit in a few short years. We are now taking our digital product and engineering function to the next level. We are creating the foundations for a global scale, servicing millions of pets in multiple countries. Our aspiration is to become Australia's most respected engineering team for scale and innovation! Our roadmap brings exciting innovative technologies to life, such a wearables for pets, genetic data, and blood sampling – our technology will enable us to re-invent pet care and pet health. We are looking for smart, driven engineers who want to be a part of this incredible journey and really shape your career while redefining what good looks like for Australian engineering.RequirementsAsses our current backend architecture and technology (PHP, Laravel) and find ways to scale and innovate for future projects Work with product and design teams to understand the product roadmap and work in agile delivery to accelerate our roadmap delivery Work with other engineers help to drive our technology transition from a single monolith to a best-in class serverless and microservices architecture Work in conjunction with our Test Automation lead to integrate quality automation practices across our front-end technology stacksSkills you have?5+ years as a software engineer – you are a problem solver and are passionate about collaborating with others and building for scale Experience shipping products written in PHP or Javascript programming languages or a desire to learn Experience with other languages and frameworks Extensive experience in designing, building and running high performance PHP backend systems, plus experience migrating to a new technology stack, preferably Javascript/Node.js or Go. Excellent problem-solving skillsPractical experience with continuous delivery and deployment pipelinesLots of experience writing tests at different levels of the stack (preferable using TDD). Experience with one major cloud provider (AWS, Google Cloud or Azure). Experience working in a cross-functional environment, where you’re comfortable working closely with product and design stakeholders, plus also non-technical stakeholders. BenefitsWork in a fast-growing start-up, experiencing what goes behind the scenes to sustain hyper-growth for a start-up with a physical product!Growth and Development – Lyka is growing extremely quickly, which means you will have the opportunity to experience different challenges every day and progressively acquire more responsibilities as our facility and team expands. We provide an annual L&D budget for you to continue your personal development. Work for a sustainability focused company – we care about the health of our dogs & our planet. Not only are we the only Australian carbon-negative pet food company, but we’re also working on offsetting all our staff's plastic use & carbon emissions, too!Be part of a diverse top talent team, coming from widely different backgrounds and geographies12 weeks of paid parental leave for primary carers and 6 weeks for secondary carers, alongside 2 weeks of miscarriage leave in the first twenty weeks. We also offer 18 paid weeks to both primary & secondary carers if you have been at Lyka for over two years. Wellbeing assistance & tools to take care of your mental & physical wellbeing so you can do your best work. Flexible working: work from where you get your best work done. We have pet-friendly offices in Sydney and Melbourne offer a WFH allowance for your home setup. Pupper parent support to care for your furry friends – flexible arrangements for new pets, pet-friendly offices, discounts & a financial allowance for dog training & care to help them live their best life! We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teamsLyka is an equal opportunity employer devoted to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We celebrate diversity, are devoted to creating an inclusive environment for all staff and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

title: Full Stack Engineer - Python and Django
description:
Company DescriptionXref is a global, best in class, HR and recruitment technology company that empowers organisations with people-focused feedback to make great decisions. Recruit, retain and remember your people with Xref’s automated reference, pulse and exit surveys.We are a global, ASX-listed company with users in 195 countries. When you work with Xref, you work with a vast array of clients of all sizes and industry backgrounds. Our users love and trust us - we have a 4.7 star rating out of 5 on Google, G2 and Capterra.With a passionate team behind everything that we do, Xref's vision is to make it easier for the world to hire and track talent throughout their journey by changing the way organisations collect and action feedback from their people. We're growing rapidly with plenty of exciting new developments and opportunities in play.Job DescriptionAt Xref (XF1) we use a modern tech stack including:Angular | Python | Node.js | REST API’s (Django) | PostgreSQL | MySQL | NoSQL | Elasticsearch | Docker | AWS Lambda | Github | JIRA | Travis CIIt's an exciting time for us as we have several brand new positions for talented software engineers to join our Australian based Development team.You will help drive, design and launch industry disruptive products, maintain the highest quality coding as well as troubleshooting and debugging across the Xref platforms.You can enjoy working remotely (within Australia ) and if you're Sydney based you'll love catching up with your teammates in the office every second weeQualificationsWe’re an enthusiastic, engaged and talented team who work hard and have fun along the way. If you can say yes to the following we'd love to hear from you:At least 3 years in a mid-level or senior role across the full development lifecycleA strong working knowledge of Angular, Python and DjangoExperience working with AWS servicesPassionate about building industry leading productsEnjoy working as part of a collaborative teamHands-on experience using relational databases like mySQL or PostgreSQLHigh attention to detail with a problem-solving aptitudeCompleted a degree in software engineering or computer scienceTo enjoy working in a startup culture.Additional InformationWhat is in for you?Competitive salary package - $100k - $120k base plus enjoy our attractive share options package.People focused - We put people first, both with our technology solution and in our workplace. We inspire and empower through innovation and welcome all ideas and contributions. We have a big heart and are positively charged.Flexible working - We are remote-first and value an outcome driven approach to work by offering a full flexible work approach.An individual Learning and Development budget of $2000 per employee per annum.The option to work from anywhere in the world for two weeks per annum.Recognition and reward for your work - We work hard, collaborate effectively and together we celebrate every individual and company success. We run various company-wide rewards initiatives throughout the year such as, EOFY and Christmas. Additionally, our sales teams run their own incentives to inspire playful competition!Loyalty leave - To thank you for your ongoing commitment to our business, we will give you additional annual leave days depending on your tenure.Birthday Leave - Let’s celebrate you with an extra day’s leave!Career Development - Whether you're taking on new responsibilities, following your passion to a new area of the business or starting an adventure in any of our other global offices - we're proud to offer tailored development opportunities.Employee assistance program - Our EAP is a confidential resource, offering referral and counselling services available to all employees and their household members — 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.Events - We’re a social bunch and we know how to have a good time! From fancy dress to axe throwing to team BBQs, we put a huge effort into keeping our people connected.Sponsorship - We can sponsor highly skilled workers to live and work in Australia if the nominee meets specific requirements. Check out our careers page here to listen to employee testimonials and to get a glimpse of what it's like to work at Xref.No agencies please.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer | Sydney | Hybrid | Hiring due to growth
description:
About UsAt Displayr, our mission is to make it easier for everyone to find and share the stories in their data. We do this by creating software that makes it easy to do all aspects of data analysis and reporting, from simple tables through to machine learning, PowerPoint automation to online dashboards.We're a bootstrapped and profitable company - no debt, no external investors. In the last 5 years, we've grown from 11 to 78 people, and we have 1,400+ great clients, from small businesses through to Amazon, Facebook, and Google.We are proud to be certified as a Great Place to Work ANZ 2022, with a score of 97% from our employees. We are also in 6th place on the Best Places to Work 2022 list for small employers.We are also supported and endorsed by Work 180, where we are trying to close the diversity gaps in the tech spaceWe are on an exciting scale-up journey and we are expanding our engineering team. We are looking for Mid-level and Senior full-stack Software Engineers.With our Head Office in Sydney, Australia, we are looking for exceptional talent to join our team remotely from anywhere in New Zealand.What you'll be doingJoin our core engineering team developing new components and contributing to design decisions.Use your technical experience to help kick off major product enhancements.Work on front-end and back-end projects.Convert ideas to products and features in a highly collaborative environment.Help scale the platform and make it more stable.Code review the work of your peers.Mentor your teammates, encouraging them to grow technically and professionally.Participate in the evaluation of new candidates for the engineering teamAbout YouYou have at least 5 years of solid development experience.Previous experience working with data or on a SaaS platform is preferred.You have a Degree in Computer Science or Computer Software.You deeply understand the platforms and libraries you use.Your CV is full of achievements you are proud of.You are concise, clear, and courteous in your communication.You are curious and innovative.You take calculated risks and are not afraid of failure.Our tech stackFront-end: TypeScript/JavaScript/React.Back-end: C#, SQL.Supporting systems: C#, Python, R, Rust, Node.js.Platforms: Azure, AWS, Kubernetes.Why Displayr?At Displayr you are not just a cog in a large engine. title: Software Engineer - Java
description:
About The JobCome shape the future of education with us.We are Compass - a smart school management in one connected platform. We believe that time spent in the classroom should be for learning and teaching.Our two co-founders John and Lucas met over a team lunch and while chowing down on their cafeteria sandwiches they bonded over their unapologetically nerdy love for education technology. After months of white-boarding and long days spent writing thousands of lines of code, Compass 1.0 came to life in 2009 in Lucas’ parents' garage.Fast forward a decade - it’s no longer just John and Lucas eating sandwiches at the lunch table. Our school management ecosystem is now used in more than 2,000 schools across Australia and beyond. We’re joined by over 200 members of the Compass team, delivering smart school management solutions around the world.Our ValuesRemember how important values were for your school? It’s the same at Compass. Our values guide how and why we work.Work to Wow - Dynamic, enthusiastic, motivated: we aspire to break new ground. Guided by research, we constantly iterate and improve to deliver the best solution to meet the needs of our customers.Conquer the impossible - When we face challenges together, few problems are unsolvable. We play to each other’s strengths and work collaboratively to achieve our shared objectives.Be the School - Teachers and students, principals and admin staff, parents, and guardians: school communities make Compass. They are the reason we work tirelessly to make their lives easier and help them bring their school’s vision to life.Are Prepared, and Do it Yesterday - We plan and we prioritise but we are still agile and responsive. We work with passion and urgency, but we measure and consider variables, to deliver a high-quality solution. ‘Be Prepared’ is being ready, not reactive.About The Role & TeamWe’re looking for someone to join our Griddle (Timetabling) team as a Software Engineer. Reporting to the Development Team Lead, this role will be working on our new timetabling module, Griddle, where you'll focus on features including; Course Selection, Class List Management, Timetable Generation and much more.Software Engineers work within our Product teams, where they collaborate with other Engineers, Product Owners, Designers & other stakeholders. We have 13 Engineering teams that champion the many core modules & features across the Compass platform.What you’ll do:Design, develop and maintain secure, scalable software that’s used by thousands of students, parents and teachers throughout the worldInspire quality and best practices by championing software craftsmanship, clean code and pair programmingBuild great relationships with your team, be generous with your thoughts and feedback (and open to receiving it!)Grow, learn, lead and thrive in a team of humans who are committed to supporting you and helping you succeedMentor your fellow colleagues and drive the architectural strategy by employing industry best practices and following Compass software engineering guidelinesCommunicate with our customers to understand their needs, and collaborate with product owners and designers to shape products to solve their problemsContribute to our diverse and inclusive culture and take pride in doing work that makes a real difference for school communities from Melbourne to DublinRequirementsWhat you'll bring:A keen interest in developing a high-quality product while meeting company objectives with other talented developers.Passion about software development - actively keep up to date with new tech.Extensive experience troubleshooting complex software systems and can identify when a problem is worth solving for the customer and the business.Pride and ownership over the software you build.Tech Stack:In terms of the tech, we've got Java (11), React, Typescript, Kubernetes, GraphQL, AWS & a whole heap of other cool words. We're not looking for someone who knows all of that - because we recruit first and foremost for passion & a love for learning. We learn, together, every day, and we build cool things for schools while we're doing itBenefitsWhat’s in it for you?Meaningful work in a rewarding industry that allows you to contribute to a mission that you believe inFlexible working culture - flexi-hours, hybrid working environmentProfessional development opportunities & fundingParental Leave Program for both primary and secondary carers24/7 access to our Employment Assistance Program (EAP) through the means of face-to-face, livechat and phone supportTeam monthly social events and weekly free lunches (Melbourne)It is a really exciting time to join Compass. We are growing fast and need people who want to grow with us. Compass is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Prior To Commencing Employment, You Require:a valid Employee Working With Children Checkverification of unrestricted work rights in Australia, eg citizenship, passport, or birth certificate

title: Back End Developer
description:
Senior Back-End Developer with Dev OpsAbout Miroma Project Factory:We have a flat company structure with a very open and welcoming culture. We wholly believe that diverse teams make better products, and strive for diversity and inclusion across the whole company. We're seeking people of all ages, genders, and backgrounds to join us! Our current team is a mix of introverted and extroverted folk who all love to learn, share, grow together, and are all equally heard. As a technology company, we are proud to have a female founder, current female CEO and 48% female staff. We were also recently listed as one of the 11 companies creating amazing workplaces for their employees by Women Love Tech! If you like working with a group of highly diverse people, who are passionate about what you do and want to have equal input into the company's future - please apply to grow with us!The job description:We are currently looking for a senior level back-end developer with at least 5+ years in development. The successful candidate will join the back end development team to lead and support on several projects. You will be second to the team lead and have an enviable position in the company to influence and help shape and mould the technology choices that our team utilise.You will help drive the evolution of practices and methodologies within our multidisciplinary tech team. The right candidate will have a strong drive to improve both themselves and those around them, balancing processes and freedom to bring out the best work in themselves and the wider team. You will have developed strong ideals on development, but also are aware and capable of adjusting those ideals to fit the requirements and needs of different projects. There is a portion of DevOps involved with this role, the split being roughly 70% Program Development and 30% DevOps Management. We have a huge drive for Test-Driven development, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, and Pull Requests, but desire to keep our methodologies and processes agile and appropriate for each project.This position is 5 days permanent full time, but we are happy to offer a 3-4 day week if our person requires flexibility. We work both from home and our delightful office in Surry Hills, Sydney. The right person for us is someone who has:Has NodeJS and/or NestJS experience of at least 4 years, preferably using Typescript.Worked with one of the following for at least 1 year: .Net, Python or Java.Has at least 1 years’ DevOps experience and is interested in staying across these tasks such as writing CI/CD scripts, working with Containerisation, or setting up AWS hosting.Has worked on the agency side and knows how to handle working on multiple projects in a high-paced environment.Is confident in their skills to manage server applications solo.Is flexible enough to work in a friendly and collaborative environment with a fun, multidisciplinary team.Has a familiarity with deployment environments and procedures in services such as AWS, Heroku, Docker, or Capistrano.Has a strong interest in test-driven development.Has a "can do", or at least a "would love to give it a go" attitude when it comes to their problem-solving skills and resilience.The candidate will be even more ideal if you optionally have:Experience with other backend languages and frameworks.Experience in other server-side languages, such as ASP.NET, PHP, Ruby.You can show that you've built some killer server-side features in NestJS or in another language. Maybe you wrote a CMS, an image processor, a game or a video streaming platform in NodeJS? And finally, the candidate will be able to show off their soft skills such as:A developed interest in test-driven developmentA keen interest in security best practices, both in your code and in the security of the office environmentHave a keen eye for detail, and the ability to critically analyse their own workEnjoy working in a team-friendly and collaborative environment with a fun, multi-disciplinary teamHave strong problem-solving skills and the resilience to champion their work and idealsStrongly champion our ideals: diversity, equality, and transparency

title: Software Engineer, Backend - DeFi
description:
Design and build backend systems that power the company authentication experience while maintaining empathy towards our customers developers and usersThe company is an early stage, fast-growing contender to transform the antiquated user identity space by eliminating the need for passwords, with backing from top investors such as Tiger Global, Lightspeed Ventures, SV Angel, Social Capital, Northzone, Placeholder, Naval Ravikant, Alexis Ohanian, Ryan Hoover, and Balaji Srinivasan.Our mission is to safeguard the trust between users and Internet services by establishing a secure and authentic digital identity. The company's vision is to build the passport of the internet. We are looking for team members who are not afraid to push beyond the status quo and create the most straightforward, most secure, and most long-term sustainable identity solution for app developers and end-users. This is a unique opportunity to help us disrupt the world of authentication.We are looking for a Backend Engineer that is able to implement software solutions that are tested, maintainable, reliable, and scalable. They’ll be alternating between building out high performant, scalable APIs and improving deployment processes, operations procedures, and systems metrics.RequirementsIn this role, you will:Design and build backend systems that power the company's authentication experience, while maintaining empathy towards our customers, developers, and usersBuild and improve our APIs so that they are as scalable, performant, intuitive as they can beOwn the architecture and development of system components to improve monitoring, alerting, and stability with compliance, with security in mindBuild upon the foundation of the existing systems to support and enhance the productivity of the entire engineering team across the globeDevelop internal SLOs and SLIs to drive service reliability and to support external SLAsCollaborate with other engineers to optimize our software engineering processesWe Are Looking For Someone Who HasIdeally 2+ years of experience working as a backend engineer in a cross-functional team (design, frontend, backend, and operations) with strong communication skillProficient in Python (Go/Ruby is a plus)Strong foundation in API design, distributed system design, and backend implementationHave experience in containerization technologies. Ex: Docker, Kubernetes, ECS, etc.Production experience in SQL and database design using MySQL, PostgreSQL, or similarBonusExpertise working with Amazon Web ServicesProduction experience in networking and virtual cloud implementationHave used/implemented SDL at your previous workplacesHave worked with serverless stack (FaaS)Have a startup mentality: team player, self-motivated, high-integrity, pragmatic, resourceful, can execute under pressureThe company is fully remote, though we would prefer this role specifically to be in a timezone where we can have more hours overlap with the North American team members due to the need for frequent communication and collaboration.At the company, we're looking for team players with passion, empathy, perseverance, and integrity. You're encouraged to apply to this position, even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your talent and merits will stand out. At the company, we welcome diverse perspectives and people who aren't afraid to challenge assumptions and the status quo.To Hear More About This Role You Can email - neil@cryptorecruit.comCryptorecruit are the worlds leading specialist recruiter for the blockchain/Cryptocurrency industry. We recruit positions from CEO,CTO, Project Manager, Solidity developer, frontend and Backend Blockchain developers to marketing/sales and customer service roles. Please browse our website and at www.cryptorecruit.com to search all our job vacancies.

title: Back End Developer
description:
Senior Back End .NET Engineer – $130-170K+ Super + Shares – Market Leading Global Gaming Products BusinessThe Company.We are working with an exciting global sports betting brand that is part of a well-known group of global gaming companies redefining the way people play for entertainment.They offer 30 million-plus customers an unforgettable, finely-tuned experience that is leagues ahead of their competitors from a user experience and technology perspective. The last few years have been BIG years for innovation, new technology and the launch of a new platform; despite the recent global events, they are doing better than ever expected! The team is keen to continue the Microservice reengineering work to push the platform further and faster than it has by massively increasing player traffic! The Role. You'll be working on a global racing product, a microservice-based distributed system that is in use around the clock, all over the world! You don’t need to have a background in real-time transactional software, however an interest in the highly-transactional tech domain, wagering/betting or gambling is important to enjoy the role and the unique challenges you/your team will face. • Design and build new C# RESTful Web APIs and microservices• Maintain and enhance existing C# RESTful Web APIs and microservices• Continuously add to the suite of unit, integration and acceptance tests Essential skills. Strong C# with IoC/DIWeb API, REST (.Net framework, ASP.Net Core, Microservices)Unit Testing & mocking frameworks (nunit, Moq, NSubstitute or similar)Working knowledge of SQL (SQL Server 2012+/ Oracle / Postgres) Desirable skills. Event-Driven Architecture & messaging (Solace, Kafka, RabbitMQ, ZeroMQ, MSMQ)Distributed caching (Redis, Memcached, Couchbase)ORM experience (EF6, EF Core, NHibernate or similar)CI/CD - Continuous Delivery (Git, Jira, Jenkins, Teamcity, Octopus)Exposure to high-traffic / distributed software systemsDocker, Kubernetes or similarC# with .NET CoreExposure to SOA design and maintenanceAWS or Azure (nice to have)Benefits & Perks. They are in a fantastic new office near Barangaroo, close to Wynyard station.Office with a sports hub, if you want to challenge fellow mates for table tennis, golf putt or playing darts!Like a good cup of coffee? have an in-house barista to get you that perfect cup!Many social events to take part in (Melbourne Cup is just one of them).Betting competitions – Hello wagering!Continued commitment to employee development.Employee share program.Emplyee wellness benefits.Life insurance and Income protection plan.

description:

Since, we have become a leader in retail execution services in the APAC region, providing the #1 mystery shopping and survey app for Android and iOS. We solve problems for retail customers by providing platforms, analytics, advice, and tools to address core questions about their product and in-store execution. Since joining Wiser Solutions, Inc. in August 2022, we are part of a global leader with 500 employees in locations world-wide and provide an even broader suite of tools for our customers. As the global leader in Commerce Execution SaaS products, we are on an exciting journey to build a globally oriented, fully comprehensive commercial SaaS suite of platforms that provides unique and universal insights for our customers. We invite you to join us on this journey!The ideal candidate is an analytical, structured, yet creative problem solver who shows an understanding of software design and the desire to work across the stack. They have a passion for delivering clean, readable, concise code, as well as user experience and continuous learning. They have an open mind to constructive feedback from both engineering leadership and team members.Objectives of this roleWork across full stack from front end, back end, web and mobile application, and infrastructureUnderstand, follow, and execute on the technological strategy, applying synchronous and asynchronous design patterns in code, architecture, and infrastructure. Participate in our agile process and estimate, plan, develop new features for all existing and new platforms, and improve them for scalability, stability, performance, and cost objectives.Deliver clean, well-considered, well-tested code, and continually re-factor the existing code bases and delivery pipelines, following standards, best practices, guidelines, and conventions. title: Junior Software Engineer | JavaScript & Python
description:
Want to join a small and supportive scaleup team, where you’ll work on a biiiiig and well established product + code base? Then have a looksee at this one from Fillr! This is an opportunity for someone to come in & learn -- we aren’t looking for an expert here, it’s *the* perfect environment to walk into with lots of support right there from the get-go. Fillr simply wants their team to be happy while producing products that make other people’s lives that little bit easier. Who is Fillr?Fillr is the world’s most accurate autofill technology, an ultra intelligent data exchange platform with a 95% + accuracy that is proven to be more accurate than Google/Apple’s autofill offerings. Pretty impressive for a small local Melbourne team, huh?It’s an exciting time to be joining Fillr as they are embarking on a new journey after merging with Rakuten Americas whose business portfolio includes market leaders in e-commerce, digital marketing, advertising, business intelligence, logistics, communications, and entertainment. The product They’ve rolled their auto-fill-as-a-service into a suite of mobile apps that are used by thousands of users daily in every country of the world. Fillr provides online shoppers with a fast means to transact anywhere instantly by removing the tedium of typing personal details every time a website requires ecommerce details such as name, address and credit cards.Then there’s Rakuten’s Rewards cash back product. To date, their 17 million members in the U.S. alone have earned over $3.7 billion in cash back at their favorite stores. How cool is that? It’s a fascinatingly complex system, with millions of users and that is at the very heart of their business.Rakuten Rewards directly puts money back into the pockets of users, which is pretty damn cool to think about. A product like this is all about driving greater accuracy within the product pipeline, ensuring users receive the rewards they deserve. Ways of working📍Hybrid, with a mix of remote & in person collaboration at their shiny new offices in South Yarra. You’ll find engineers, designers, sales and company directors all working tightly together and having a bit of fun while they’re at it. Expect regular team lunches and outings, and lots of cake (yum)! ❤️Families (and life) come first. Flexible working is at the very heart of Fillr’s ways of working, and you’ll find folks who work a variety of ways (part time, flex start & finish times + more) that suit their unique needs. 🧠Lots of opportunities for career growth -- with a training/conference budget, the space + support to actually do your L&D within business hours, and supportive mentors who want to you see you shine. 🎨They have an open culture of sharing knowledge, ideas and laughs from all parts of the business. Everyone is encouraged to share their creativity on all aspects of the business, including product, and they ensure all ideas are treated equally.🤙Most importantly, the folks at Fillr are curious minds who love to try their hand at things. There’s is a supportive environment where learning through failure is a badge of honor! Your future impact as a Junior Software Engineer💻TechYou will be writing elegant (think: clean & easy to understand by other people) and functional code for Rakuten’s most business critical product -- Rakuten Rewards. You’ll be shipping code and scripting in JavaScript and Python (Django).🔎Detective (accuracy) workDue to the nature of cash back, a lot of product work will involve investigating + understanding how their customers' websites work, extracting ecommerce and purchase data from order information of large merchant sites and ensuring that the data is correct + matches the data from networks (like VISA or MasterCard). 🌱Looooots of personal growthYou’ll gain experience at handling business critical systems, understand how they integrate into one another, while also being trusted (and encouraged) to make mistakes, celebrate your failures & learnings, and grow into an awesome engineer.The techy bitsThe Rakuten Rewards tech stack is across JavaScript and Python, running on AWS. Your first 6 months will look like… learning the Rakuten Rewards system, understanding the tech stack & all of the edge cases within there. You’ll have the opportunity to learn AWS and lots of monitoring tooling throughout this time too. After that, once you’ve found your feet, you’ll have the opportunity to also jump into some of Fillr’s other apps & products too, and get ever deeper into the world of accuracy engineering! Next stepsLet's face it, changing jobs can be nerve-wracking, exhausting, or even a pain in the a***.That's where affix comes in.If becoming a Junior Software Engineer at an incredible scaleup sounds like your jam, here's how you can find us to connect:Kushla Egankushla.egan@affix.com.auMitch Lawrencemitch.lawrence@affix.com.au

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
Come join the team that’s transforming financial services!Fenergo is a global team of 850+ professionals who are delivering seamless digital experiences to financial institutions.We are already the No. 1 provider of Digital Client Lifecycle Management (CLM) technologies and count 32 of the world’s top 50 banks as clients, we want more!French and UK private equity firms recently acquired a majority stake and are looking to scale the business globally.We collaborate and partner with some of the biggest firms in the world including DxC Technologies, Capgemini, PwC, Accenture, Salesforce, and IBM to name but a few.With operations across 12 global offices (Sydney, Melbourne, Tokyo, Singapore, London, Dublin, Madrid, Wroclaw, Dubai, New York, Boston, Toronto) we deliver world-class technologies locally.Whether your career is just starting, or you are looking to progress to a new challenge, Fenergo is a place you can grow personally and professionally.RequirementsAs a Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be part of Fenergo’s product team. This is a unique opportunity to be part of Fen-X which is our SaaS product offering and a growing team. You will have a chance to influence the direction of the product front to back and grow with the product as we expand the team in the region. We are building the platform using the latest technologies and cloud-based architecture, utilizing the power of platform services. The team is transforming the way we design and build software so that value is delivered quickly to our users. This role gives you an opportunity to have an impact on defining the services, software principles and tools that we use to engineer a global FinTech product.In this role, you will get the chance to:Solve new and existing business problems in a truly customer centric teamApply the latest technology to transform a leading FinTech platform for clients globallyCollaborate with global, cross-functional teams to revolutionize how we develop and deliverWork on a global FinTech product that is transforming every part of digital customer journeysBuild new products and services as part of our SaaS product platform- 1. Using DDD, CQRS and event-driven architectures. 2.Harness the power of cloud native servicesBe a member of an agile team who builds, tests, automates, deploys, and runs their own software all the way to production.Drive continuous improvement through the platform by debugging production issues across services.Opportunity to use several latest technologies and design patterns, including CQRS, Event-driven architecture, Micro-frontend architecture, Event sourcing, AWS services (DynamoDB, Lambda, S3, SQS, Step functions, EventBridge), IaC using Pulumi, .NET 6 and API-first principles About You2+ years’ experience in a professional Engineering role or equivalent.Experience developing full stack applications - design, build, test, deliver and support.Experience developing multi-layer systems using C#/.Net Core/Java. Experience developing web-based applications with React, Angular, vue.js or similar frontend frameworksExperience working using Agile methodology. Successful delivery into production environments. Effective communicator across all levels of the organization.You may be required to participate in on-call duties rotation for out of hours Support.Willingness to occasionally travel domestically and internationally.Nice To Have (but Not Essential)Experience working on a SaaS applicationExperience working with Serverless architectures and frameworks. Experience in data solutions design and development. Experience of AWS & Azure or similar cloud development.Continuous Delivery and Continuous Integration experience through Azure Devops or similar.Any certifications are a bonus.BenefitsExtensive training programmes, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University’Buddy system for all new startersActive sports and social clubCompany benefits/perks like 23 days of annual leave, private health insurance, flexible working hours, hybrid working environment, a one-off work from home allowance etc.

title: Software Engineer (Backend) - DeFi
description:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and product managers to design and develop TypeScript-based applications using Node.js.We at the company aspire to transform and decentralize finance with tomorrow’s technology, with a globally distributed and close-knit team of doers and getters. Here’s an opportunity to join a movement to break the mold. Join the company and help us shape the future of personal finance.About Birthday Research- Blockchain R&D wing of the company DeFiBirthday Research (BDR) is the Blockchain Research and Development wing of the company DeFi, a Singapore-based blockchain, and fintech company. Fuelled by the best minds in the industry, BDR seeks to develop best-in-class blockchain innovations with the mission of enabling the next bound of Web3.As a pioneering force, our work spans cryptographic research, deep blockchain consensus development, and smart contracts development — with a laser-sharp focus on driving the industry frontier while tackling the most demanding DeFi challenges of today. To date, one of our core contributions, DeFiChain, has garnered over 1 billion USD in total value locked on the layer-1 protocol.We are a fast-growing, globally distributed, close-knit team of multi-disciplinary doers and getters. Join Birthday Research today to be a part of the driving force shaping the future of decentralization.What You’ll DoCollaborate with cross-functional teams and product managers to design and develop TypeScript-based applications using Node.js.Write highly performant codes that are clean, simple, maintainable, and battle-tested with test-driven development (TDD) for maximum test coverage automated from pull request all the way to release.Design and develop highly distributed backend micro-services with the ability to scale to thousands of requests per second using cloud-native solutions. What you’ll need:Experience working in a fast pace tech-driven startup as a Software Engineer with at least 2 years of experience or in a similar capacity.Strong proficiency in TypeScript or JavaScript software stack with experience developing highly scalable systems.Familiar with distributed systems, database optimization, performance tuning, concurrency handling, and caching mechanisms.Ability to take full ownership and work independently while collaborating with others in a fast-paced agile and async team.A collaborative and resourceful individual with excellent communication skills able to make radical decisions while being empathetic and respectful.Willingness to pick up new and emerging bleeding edge blockchain technologies.Experience participating or maintaining in open source software development is highly preferred.A deep technical understanding of blockchain technologies, cryptography, BIPs, DeFi, UTXO, EVM, or Nakamoto Consensus is highly preferred. Why Work With The CompanyDo something with purpose; Be a part of the future that will shape how people are dealing with their finances in Crypto and BlockchainFast-moving, challenging, and unique business problemsInternational, diverse work environment and flat hierarchyGreat career development opportunities in a growing company The company is a Singapore-based blockchain and fintech company that empowers users to be in control of their finances by creating cash flow and harnessing the potential of Decentralized Finance. Founded in 2019, we currently have more than ~100 employees of various backgrounds and nationalities and growing.To Hear More About This Role You CanEmail - simon@cryptorecruit.comCryptorecruit are the worlds leading specialist recruiter for the blockchain/Cryptocurrency industry. We recruit positions from CEO,CTO, Project Manager, Solidity developer, frontend and Backend Blockchain developers to marketing/sales and customer service roles. Please browse our website and at www.cryptorecruit.com to search all our job vacancies.

title: Graduate Software Engineer
description:
Join our best-in-class development team, and become a part of a revolutionary, state of the art start-up company with a globally recognised footprintGraduate Software Engineering ProgramOur Graduate Software Engineers will join our Product Development team to work across all areas our large web-based application. You will be coached and mentored by all members of the engineering team (software engineers, software architects, testers, system administrators, data scientists, project leads) to learn how to scope, design, document, develop, integrate and test software to address end-user needs.Training & DevelopmentAll new juniors will be allocated a 6 month mentor, an Engineering Manager and a variety of buddies & technical trainers to help support your orientation and career development.We run training programs to ensure you develop your technical skills in our code base, learn new techniques and understand our processes and ways of working. We offer a variety of lunch and learn topics, and you will join our Fivecast training program focussed on created future leaders and connected teams.We further support individual development plans and encourage requests for additional training and development, including conferences, programs, subscriptions, books and any other ideas!Application ProcessOur recruitment team will start reviewing application in March for our April & May interview days.About FivecastFivecast is a world-leading provider of cutting-edge digital intelligence solutions. We enable the world’s most important public and private organizations to explore masses of data and uncover actionable insights, critical to protecting global communities.As a growing start-up with over 100 people globally, all team members are provided with the opportunity to directly contribute to our success, participate in the development of new and emerging technologies and grow their career in a challenging and dynamic high-tech environment. We are headquartered in Adelaide, Australia with teams in Canberra, Virginia USA, and London UK.Our Work Environment and CultureOur Adelaide based headquarters is a purpose-built tech hub centrally based in vibrant Hutt Street. We moved into this brand-new space in early 2023 to allow for continued collaboration, innovation & growth.Our space has been specifically engineered for brainstorming, idea generation, random encounters across teams and to suit our casual, relaxed culture. This has been achieved through amazing features, including an arcade room, pool table, fully equipped kitchens with fruit and snacks, barista quality coffee machine, end of trip facilities (showers, lockers, bike storage, etc), as well as comfortable breakout spaces.Fivecast has a connected work culture with team members taking advantage of our social clubs, local cafes, bars, pubs and sporting facilities for team activities. At Fivecast we understand the importance of a good work-life balance and support flexible work arrangements.Requirements To ApplyAustralian citizenship- due to eligibility for NV1 defence clearance requirement for the roleBachelor’s Degree in systems or software engineering/ computer science or related degrees. Either already completed or finishing in 2023Coding skills to design, implement and test software components, with experience in one or more languages. Ideally Java, Javascript, PythonStrong communication skills, confidence in asking questions and a drive to learnGood organisational skills, detail oriented, and a pro-active team playerAbility to work under pressure and meet deadlinesAdditional Things We Suggest You Include In Your Resume Awards, prizes or scholarshipsCoding challenges (such as Leetcode), Hackeranks or personal tech projectsThis is not required, though please do let us know if you have any experience using:data storage technologies or designing data storage models e.g. Postgres, Elasticcloud environments e.g. AWSweb front-end technologies e.g. HTML, CSSsoftware frameworks e.g. React, Angular and Springmachine learning Fivecast is an inclusive employer, we value diversity of thought and experience and believe our inclusive culture contributes to our success. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the communities in which we live and work.

You also have:Openness to learn new technologies, languages and approachesA desire to provide constructive feedback for continual improvement of systems and individuals' developmentStrong customer empathy, curiosity, persistence, and results drivenPayment acceptance technology and products experience desirableTech Talk 5+ years development on multiple languages and platforms.A strong understanding of application design and object-oriented programming.Experience and confidence in modern .NET/ C# OR C/C++ OR Android (Java/Kotlin) requiredExperience in payments and security standards (AS2805, EMV, PCI DSS) highly desirableWe're in the enviable position of being an established technology solution in a large market that is still looking to grow and innovate like a start-up. If you're interested, get in touch!
