title: Full Stack Software Engineer
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
description:
Company DescriptionWho we are:FinClear was established in 2015, with offices now in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We are an independent, Australian owned and developed technology and financial services business, specializing in providing trading, execution, clearing and technology solutions to wholesale intermediaries, FinTech’s, wealth managers and financial planners.At FinClear - Technology and progress are in our DNA. Our Financial Markets infrastructure deals with massive amounts of data and huge volumes of transactions that are executed in real-time to a vast audience. But unlike others, we own our core regulatory and technology infrastructure enabling us to move quickly and build solutions to give our clients the competitive advantage.We’ve tripled in size since mid-2021 and plan to continue growing with more platforms and services being rapidly developed. That’s where you come in.Job DescriptionAbout the role:FinClear is looking for a Software Engineer to join us on our journey as we continue to build functionalities across our FCX platform that leverages the power of Distributed Ledger Technology. This role will be working within a team of 4 in Sydney that collaborates with other squads across Perth & Melbourne. These squads form part of a larger cross functional technology team of 60 and growing.At FinClear, the team of Software Engineers come from diverse backgrounds and have a passion for their craft. With feedback from both internal and external users, our Software Engineers are equipped to make better decisions on how to enhance, build and optimize a suite of products that delights our customers. You will work alongside industry experts and talented senior engineers, building a new financial platform with modern technology and tools, where your contributions will have a strong impact on the success of the platform.Based on the current composition of the squad, we believe a passionate Software Engineer who enjoys working with a team of seniors across the Full Stack would really enjoy the opportunity.Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:Contributing to product features that reach beyond the UI, into our ecosystem of Microservices. Producing code that is well written, maintainable, security conscious and performant. Developing stunning, professional User Interfaces with React, Next.JS and MUI. Maintaining the platform and resolving issues as they arise. Collaborating with other specialists in the team as you work together on Epics and Sprints. Working with other squads on business objectives as opportunities ariseCode reviewsMentor and share your knowledge with other Software EngineersParticipate in learning and development sessionsThe Tech Stack:React, Next.JS, MUI, JavaScript, TypescriptDAML Smart Contracts & Ledger TechnologyMicroservice Architecture, Consul, VaultGRPC MessagingJava EE, JPA, GuicePostgreSQLGit, Maven, Jira, Confluence QualificationsRequired:Minimum of 3+ years working experience in React3+ years experience working within a Java environmentBonus points for:Proven experience working with Next.JSAdditional InformationWhat are the ingredients to our secret sauce?That’s our people and the technology solutions we create, as the business grows, we are also evolving our benefits to one that our people love!Benefits:A team that is invested in the success of FinClear and a generous ESOP for all our employees16 Weeks of gender neutral paid parental leaveA flexible work environment - we have fantastic new offices where we come to collaborate and have those face-to-face meetings with some days at home An inclusive and diverse working environment for allPrioritise mental health with all our staff having free access to our EAP programme including 1:1 session with qualified coaches and psychologistsE-Vehicles – Salary SacrificeReady to apply?If this sounds like something you might be interested in, submit your application by selecting “I'm Interested” or "Apply".Alternatively :To refer a friend, select "Refer a friend"For More information about FinClear, visit our Careers page https://finclear.com.au/careersAny additional queries Email : careers@finclear.com.au Please note :Applications will be reviewed w/c 13/03/2023Rights to legally work in Australia is a must to be considered for the immediate opportunities at FinClear, (sponsorship options are currently not an option)

title: Software Engineer
description:
Company DescriptionEvery person at Leidos plays an important and valued role bringing science, engineering and technology together to produce practical solutions for our customers’ most complex problems. It’s how we help to make the world safer, healthier and more efficient - work that matters and a mission, like those of our customers, we are passionate about. We’re open minded, ambitious and committed to enabling our people to do their best work, to be inspired by what they can achieve and the impact they can have.Here in Australia, we’re agile and growing fast. Our 1,600 employees are busy building an enviable reputation for innovation and delivery. And, as part of a US-based organisation with 37,000 people and a 50 year history, we are able to draw upon world-leading technical expertise to help us provide the best solutions to our customers.Job DescriptionYour New RoleWe have multiple opportunities available for Software Engineers to join our Melbourne based team working on exciting and nationally significant bespoke software engineering projects. The roles are multi-faceted as we are looking for unique individuals with varying experience levels whom are able to contribute broadly across the software development lifecycle in a range of ways, including but not limited to: Agile Software Development; DevOps; Real-Time Data Processing; User Interface Design; Full-Stack Development; Testing and Release Management; Mission Support and Sustainment.Successful candidates will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, solid software engineering fundamentals, multiple programming language experience, clear communication skills and a desire to tackle complex problems in a unique environment.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringThe individuals we are looking for are highly motivated software engineers with a passion to make a difference to the security of Australia. You will excel working in a dynamic on-site team environment, with a desire to be part of a long term mission solution. Ideal candidates would have previous experience of working on Defence projects and already hold an NV-1 or higher security clearance.You will also have:A Bachelor Degree (or higher) in Software Engineering, Computer Science or Electrical Engineering (with software engineering experience)Strong ability to problem solve and troubleshootGood knowledge and application of a broad range of skills involved in the software engineering lifecycleDemonstrated ability in supporting the delivery of software products on time, and to a high standard of quality and focusWillingness to document and improve software development processesAptitude and values that align with the requirements of holding a national security clearanceThis role does require the successful applicant to be an Australian Citizen and be willing to obtain and hold a NV-1 or greater security clearance. Additionally the successful candidate may need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements applicable to this role, which may place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1Additional InformationWhat You'll LoveAt Leidos we look after our staff. Flexible working practices, great team building initiatives, consistent learning and development opportunities, employee discounts and excellent exposure to a variety of technologies and projects are just some of the perks. We are growing and evolving, so it’s an exciting place to be.Our diverse employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Leidos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

title: Software Engineer - Java
description:
About The JobCome shape the future of education with us.We are Compass - a smart school management in one connected platform. We believe that time spent in the classroom should be for learning and teaching.Our two co-founders John and Lucas met over a team lunch and while chowing down on their cafeteria sandwiches they bonded over their unapologetically nerdy love for education technology. After months of white-boarding and long days spent writing thousands of lines of code, Compass 1.0 came to life in 2009 in Lucas’ parents' garage.Fast forward a decade - it’s no longer just John and Lucas eating sandwiches at the lunch table. Our school management ecosystem is now used in more than 2,000 schools across Australia and beyond. We’re joined by over 200 members of the Compass team, delivering smart school management solutions around the world.Our ValuesRemember how important values were for your school? It’s the same at Compass. Our values guide how and why we work.Work to Wow - Dynamic, enthusiastic, motivated: we aspire to break new ground. Guided by research, we constantly iterate and improve to deliver the best solution to meet the needs of our customers.Conquer the impossible - When we face challenges together, few problems are unsolvable. We play to each other’s strengths and work collaboratively to achieve our shared objectives.Be the School - Teachers and students, principals and admin staff, parents, and guardians: school communities make Compass. They are the reason we work tirelessly to make their lives easier and help them bring their school’s vision to life.Are Prepared, and Do it Yesterday - We plan and we prioritise but we are still agile and responsive. We work with passion and urgency, but we measure and consider variables, to deliver a high-quality solution. ‘Be Prepared’ is being ready, not reactive.About The Role & TeamWe’re looking for someone to join our Griddle (Timetabling) team as a Software Engineer. Reporting to the Development Team Lead, this role will be working on our new timetabling module, Griddle, where you'll focus on features including; Course Selection, Class List Management, Timetable Generation and much more.Software Engineers work within our Product teams, where they collaborate with other Engineers, Product Owners, Designers & other stakeholders. We have 13 Engineering teams that champion the many core modules & features across the Compass platform.What you’ll do:Design, develop and maintain secure, scalable software that’s used by thousands of students, parents and teachers throughout the worldInspire quality and best practices by championing software craftsmanship, clean code and pair programmingBuild great relationships with your team, be generous with your thoughts and feedback (and open to receiving it!)Grow, learn, lead and thrive in a team of humans who are committed to supporting you and helping you succeedMentor your fellow colleagues and drive the architectural strategy by employing industry best practices and following Compass software engineering guidelinesCommunicate with our customers to understand their needs, and collaborate with product owners and designers to shape products to solve their problemsContribute to our diverse and inclusive culture and take pride in doing work that makes a real difference for school communities from Melbourne to DublinRequirementsWhat you'll bring:A keen interest in developing a high-quality product while meeting company objectives with other talented developers.Passion about software development - actively keep up to date with new tech.Extensive experience troubleshooting complex software systems and can identify when a problem is worth solving for the customer and the business.Pride and ownership over the software you build.Tech Stack:In terms of the tech, we've got Java (11), React, Typescript, Kubernetes, GraphQL, AWS & a whole heap of other cool words. We're not looking for someone who knows all of that - because we recruit first and foremost for passion & a love for learning. We learn, together, every day, and we build cool things for schools while we're doing itBenefitsWhat’s in it for you?Meaningful work in a rewarding industry that allows you to contribute to a mission that you believe inFlexible working culture - flexi-hours, hybrid working environmentProfessional development opportunities & fundingParental Leave Program for both primary and secondary carers24/7 access to our Employment Assistance Program (EAP) through the means of face-to-face, livechat and phone supportTeam monthly social events and weekly free lunches (Melbourne)It is a really exciting time to join Compass. We are growing fast and need people who want to grow with us. Compass is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.Prior To Commencing Employment, You Require:a valid Employee Working With Children Checkverification of unrestricted work rights in Australia, eg citizenship, passport, or birth certificate

title: Software Engineer, Full Stack (Australia)
description:
Equal Access to High-Quality Education Moves Our World ForwardMeet Cadmus!At Cadmus, we believe every student should have equal opportunity to achieve academic excellence; that’s why we’re changing how the world learns!Cadmus is a global EdTech company purposefully built for the higher education sector to break down global learning barriers by providing educators and diverse student cohorts with access to high-quality learning and assessment. Built on rich, student-centric values, Cadmus empowers individuals to achieve their highest potential and graduate with the critical skills and knowledge to profoundly impact our workforces, communities, and evolving world.A Bold Plan for Global ImpactAt Cadmus, we’re working hard in pursuit of an ambitious, world-shaping goal: to provide 1 billion students with access to high-quality education by 2050.That’s why we need a Full Stack Development superstar to join our team and help us maintain a high-quality experience for our users worldwide — ensuring our cloud infrastructure is reliable, performant and set up to scale. We want to do everything we can to ensure our users enjoy their experience and love our platform. With countless opportunities to make an impact, you’ll help us solve exciting engineering challenges and deliver improved functionality to take Cadmus even further.About The RoleAs a Full Stack Developer, you'll work across multiple codebases with a small team of cross-functional developers to solve a wide range of product engineering and architectural design challenges. You'll apply your software engineering skills to build performant, modern front-end applications with functional paradigms in React and Typescript. You'll also implement the backend GraphQL APIs (Elixir) and the micro-services which furnish the product features.You will have strong ownership across the development cycle and in addition to implementing new features, you'll focus on improving performance and reliability, and polish existing features. This is a truly unique opportunity to help shape our technology stack, processes, and contribute to the culture of the engineering team.About Our TechReact (Typescript) front-end web applications (SPA)Elixir backend with GraphQL APIsHaskell web services and Typescript (NodeJS) lambda functionsAWS cloud infrastructureWe also use and love to experiment with other languages for various tooling to ensure we find the best tool for the job. If you want to know more about what it’s like to be a developer at Cadmus, check out our blog post.RequirementsWe want to hear from developers with a passion for building modern web applications. You love exploring new technologies in order to solve problems and want to make constant improvements to our users’ experience. You have an eye for UI design and an interest in applying product development methodologies to boost the user experience. You thrive working in a team, love end-to-end ownership, obsess over details, and use data to help make the best choices for the wider business.In this role you'll:Develop complex front-end applications in React, in Typescript, and the GraphQL and REST APIs servicing themImplement features for our web-based rich-text Editor and the surrounding architecture for a complete online editing environmentWrite code and services for the backend systems in Elixir, Haskell, and other languages to implement business logicImplement the testing, performance, and telemetry processes for the product features to ensure a high-quality experience for our usersPlay an active role in designing and improving the overall product architecture to support massive growth in users and productsCollaborate with product designers and other developers to scope and plan new features, translating requirements for a feature into technical designWe’d love to hear from you if you have:2-4 years industry experience in software developmentExperience developing rich front-end applications in React and using the frameworks in the React ecosystemExperience with Typescript and Browser DOM APIsExperience in creating and working with front-end design systems, CSS-in-JS and CSS layouts with Flexbox and Grid systemsBack-end programming experience with languages like Elixir, Typescript (NodeJS), Ruby, Haskell, or similar in building web serversKnowledge of computer science fundamentals, data structures and design patterns, and an ability to use them practically when implementing solutionsWe'd really love to hear from you if you have:Startup DNA; you’re flexible, comfortable with ambiguity, and have experience scaling systems to support rapid growthExperience with Functional Programming languagesBenefitsA remote-friendly, flexible working culture; where you can work from any global locationLearning allowances; because we don’t just have words on a website, we genuinely do what we say and provide educational opportunities to all (including the Cadmus team)A diverse and inclusive workplace where there are no barriers to anyone succeedingA surrounding team of mission-driven individuals who genuinely love what they doEquity incentives; that way, we all share in the success of CadmusMentoring and succession planning for your careerVirtual pats from Homer, our resident (and super cute) dog!We're a remote-friendly company, and this role is open to candidates based in Melbourne or remote from anywhere in Australia.Hiring ProcessApply online with your resume only.Instead of a cover letter, we’d love for you to answer a few questions alongside your application.Our interview process is normally a recruiter interview, a hiring manager interview, a programming task, and 2-3 hours of onsite interviews that will be held via Zoom.While we review your application, get to know us by visiting cadmus.io or following our social channels.Inclusivity at CadmusAt Cadmus, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds because it makes our company stronger. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital, or disability status. If you share our values and enthusiasm for education, you will find a home at Cadmus.If you need assistance or accommodations made due to a disability, please let us know.

title: 2024 Graduate Software Engineer – Scoresby
description:
Company DescriptionAward winning Graduate ProgramLeidos has been identified as #1 Top Graduate Employer in the Defence and Aerospace sector by GradAustralia and has been recognised as a Top 75 Graduate Employer for three years in a row by the AAGE - So what makes our graduate program award winning?As a graduate you are employed on a permanent basis working on real projects as an embedded team member, and will spend the first 12 months on the graduate programYou will be allocated a ‘Leidos Purple Buddy’ to help get you settled inYou will attend a graduate specific induction along with monthly graduate catch ups as an opportunity to build connections internally and to learn more about the businessYou will be offered a formal mentoring program to help grow your careerand will undertake a number of professional development and training courses to get you upskilled. Leidos BenefitsAccess to over 100,000 online training and development courses through our the technical training portal PercipioSupport of advocacy groups including; The Young Professionals, Women and Allies Network, Allies & Action for Accessibility and Abilities and the Defence & Emergency ServicesEntitlement to one day a year of volunteer leave to support a cause you’re passionate aboutLeidos is a family friendly certified organisation and we provide flexible work arrangements that are outcomes focused and may consist of; flexible work hours, Life Days (formally RDOs), Switch Days where you can switch a public holiday for an alternative days that means more to you, and a career break of between 3 months and 2 years to take time out from Leidos to explore other interestsAccess to Reward Gateway to give upfront discounts or cashback rewards with over 400 Australian and International retailersWhat makes Leidos stand out?As a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services company, Leidos works to solve the world’s most complex challenges through the integration and application of information and technology and systems to deliver unique, practical and usable solutions to our customers’ most complex challenges.In Australia we have over 2,000 employees mostly based in Melbourne and Canberra. Globally we number 45,000 employees and are located in 35 countries. Our Mission is to make the world safer, healthier and more efficient through information technology, engineering and science. It’s work that we can all be proud of.Leidos is a trusted partner of the Australian Government and we deliver software applications for a wide range of missions in the Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance domain as well as health solutions. We provide critical projects to the Department of Defence whilst supporting the IT environment for the Australian Taxation Office. We also maintain legislative websites for a number of governments.Job DescriptionYour New RoleAn average week for a Graduate Software Engineer could include a wide range of activities including:Liaising with system users to document a requirement or specification and understand their needs, goals, and any issues or limitations;Using your skills to undertake software analysis, design, development and testing of software;Solving complex problems using software related methodologies, processes, standards and tools;Translating and implementing simple development project requirements into physical database structures and code;Applying data analysis and data modelling techniques to establish, modify or maintain a data structure and its associated components;Analysing code and systems for potential security vulnerabilities and code to avoid accidental introduction of such vulnerabilities;Assisting in the investigation and resolution of issues relating to applications by correcting program errors, preparing instructions, analysing system capabilities and output requirements, in order to meet software standards;Working as part of a team in an Agile environment to contribute to the overall success of program delivery by working on individual activities and collaborating to come together using configuration and version control;Undertaking independent learning to improve your knowledge of software development. At Leidos we work with a number of different tools and technologies to deliver complex solutions to our customers from project to project. Your role could include exposure to some of the following, noting previous experience is not requiredInfrastructure as Code (IaC) – Terraform, Ansible Cloud Technologies – AWS, Azure On Prem – OpenShift, VMWare Kubernetes/Containers – Docker/Containerd, Rancher, Tanzu, Helm, Skaffold Web – ReactDB – Oracle, Postgres, SQLServer, MongoDB, Redis,DevSecOps – GitLab, Jenkins, GitOps Agile – Scrum, Kanban, XP Graduates will be supported to develop their skills and knowledge specific to this role, to ensure they are able to contribute and reach their highest potential. As a Leidos graduate, you will be working on interesting and challenging projects and will take part in a range of training and development opportunities.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringThis role is ideal for someone who is completing or has recently completed a Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution in a related discipline:Bachelor of Software EngineeringBachelor of Software DevelopmentBachelor of Information TechnologyBachelor of Computer ScienceBachelor of Systems EngineeringAlong with your education and any practical experience, Leidos values individuals who use their initiative and seek to understand the business and develop relationships based on respect.Additional InformationSuccessful candidates must be Australian Citizens at the time of application to be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Government Security Clearance.At Leidos, we proudly embrace diversity and support our people at every stage of their Leidos journey in terms of inclusion, accessibility and flexibility. We have a strong track record of internal promotion and career transitions. And at Leidos you’ll enjoy flexible work practices, discounted health insurance, novated leasing, 12 weeks paid parental leave as a primary carer and more. We look forward to welcoming you.

title: Software Engineer
description:
About usKeyframe is an Architectural, Engineering and Construction (AEC) software company. Our platform integrates BIM, GIS and LiDAR into a 3D geospatial environment enabling team collaboration, information retrieval and decision making in a visual medium.About the opportunityWe are seeking a full-stack/front-end software developer to join our team to build the Keyframe geospatial application. You will be working on our cloud-hosted web platform developed with React.js and .NET Core. The technology includes containerised applications in service-oriented and microservice architectures with a variety of database and storage technologies.What you will be doingKey responsibilities include:Writing well structured, clean, secure code and supporting testsApplying modern frameworks and libraries to maximise quality and productivityCreate and maintain automation pipelines to continuously build and deploy codeWorking in a team context supporting others when requiredWhat you will needExcellent candidates will have:Experience building web applications using frameworks (React.js, Vue.js, etc)Proficient with multiple programming languages and an established understanding of how and when they are appliedStrong understanding of modern web markup including HTML5, CSS3, associated technologies, and frameworks to support them.Proficient with source control best practicesFamiliarity with cloud architectures and containerised applicationsWhat we offerAn innovative problem domain with a wide array of complex problems to solveA vibrant, fast-paced, supportive workplace cultureA great learning and development environmentFlexible working options including working remotelyThe team you’ll be joiningKeyframe is a young dynamic company with a team located around the globe.  We’re driven to redefine how 3D geospatial technology can be applied in construction projects.  We look for people who are self-motivated and engaged, and we take the time to recognise great work and celebrate our achievements together.If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Company DescriptionSince we opened our doors in 2009, the world of commerce has evolved immensely, and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale, we saw sellers stymied by disparate, outmoded products and tools that wouldn’t work together.To solve this problem, we expanded into software and built integrated solutions to help sellers sell online, manage inventory, book appointments, engage loyal buyers, and hire and pay staff. Across it all, we’ve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale, so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth, enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper, increase order sizes, and compete at a larger scale.Today, we are a partner to sellers of all sizes – large, enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations, sellers just starting, as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow, so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We’re building a significant, meaningful, and lasting business, and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.Job DescriptionAs a Software Engineer in the Afterpay Registration team, you’ll be responsible for the development of our Registration and Sign Up Products. This is a perfect opportunity for a Software Engineer that enjoys working in a global team and with product, creating new experiences for major retailers and businesses alike!What You’ll Be DoingScope, build and maintain/enhance systems & services using Java, Kotlin, React.js and related open source technologiesParticipate in critical technical design and product discussionsOwn features and functions throughout their lifecycle from inception, rollout, launch, scale and iterationPractice eXtreme Programming (XP) engineering techniques of Software DevelopmentFostering the use of agile practices for Software DeliveryWork in cross-functional Product teams responsible for the discovery, delivery and validation of product features via microservices, APIs, web-appsWork with the software engineering team following our software development principles, guided by the Staff Engineers and Engineering ManagersPeer review design decisions, code, automated tests and documentationParticipate in the ongoing design and architecture of our evolving core platforms and servicesQualificationsA demonstrable track record of building highly scalable, performant and resilient systems/softwareProven experience in preferably Kotlin, Java and JavaScript (React/Redux)Experience mentoring & coaching junior developers within teamsStrong understanding of Full stack engineering in a complex development environmentSolid understanding of how to build testable, decoupled, maintainable code and other engineering best practices such as XP techniques (TDD, pair-programming, CI, etc)Experience working within an agile, cloud-based environment, we use AWSSome working knowledge of backend technologies including but not limited to: Dropwizard, Spring/Guice, ORM/Hibernate, SQL and relational databasesUnderstanding of integration technologies: microservices, RESTful APIs, gRPC, JSON/XML Structured LoggingExperience with version control, preferably GitUses of Serverless technologies will be a bonusThe ability to build scalable and maintainable software-as-a-service applications using modern JVM languagesWillingness to learn and apply new methodologies and techniques as requiredBachelors’ degree in Computer Science or relevant fieldGreat communication skills, able to discuss engineering issues and trade-offs without hesitation. Additional InformationWe’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, based solely on the core competencies required of the role at hand, and without regard to any legally protected class.We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page. PerksWe want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:Healthcare coverageRetirement PlansEmployee Stock Purchase ProgramWellness perksPaid parental leavePaid time offLearning and Development resourcesBlock, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

title: Graduate Software Developer
description:
Calling 2023 graduates interested in computers, software, computing systems and all things IT!Keen to put your Computer Science or Engineering degree to work in our Software Development team? As a Graduate Software Developer, you'll be part of a team where you'll contribute to building the next generation of our applications. As you rotate your way through the software development lifecycle over the course of 12 months,you'll work with some of the best in the industry to build your STEM career.What will you do?You'll be joining our Software Development team whichdesign, engineer and support our business critical applications which help deliver our value proposition to our customers.Leading an established and growing team, you will help accelerate our growth and speed to market by delivery marketing leading and robust business systems.You'll be equipped with the knowledge and skills of an entry-level Software Developer with the ability to do the following, and more:Understand the software development lifecycle Participate in general development workflowsBecome proficient in software development tooling including version control, CI/CD and managingreleasesDiagnose application and database issuesWrite code and participate in code review processesAbout youWe're looking for students with the following qualities and/or qualifications:Final-year student set to graduate by the end of 2023 for a 2024 start with usStudying a degree in Science (majoring in Computer Science) or Engineering (majoring in Software)Credit or distinction averageFull Australian working rightsAbility to work in a team environment and collaborate with othersExcellent communication skills, both verbal and writtenDesire for continuous learning and adaptability to stay up to date with emerging technologiesWhat can we do for you?We’re easy-going. We pride ourselves on creating a fun, casual and relaxed environment. Ditch the corporate attire if you want to - embrace it if that’s your thing! What matters most is that you’re comfortable when you come to work.We give back. Get free internet for your home and a free 4G mobile SIM plan just for being a Superlooper. Now that's a super work perk!We’re progressive. We understand that life exists outside of work which is why we provide flexible WFH options.We win together. Everything is more fun when you’re part of a team. And we have a pretty good one here at Superloop! We know that when we encourage every voice and act as a unified unit, we can achieve anything.We welcome diversity. Graduate or fully fledged worker, we encourage and seek out diverse backgrounds and opinions because we know differences challenge us and help us grow.Whilst this role is being advertised in Brisbane, we are also accepting applications from Sydney.

title: Developer
description:
We celebrate diversity and unite on the elements of our company DNA, starting every customer conversation with “why?” to understand their needs, working hard to find a way to overcome every challenge, and fighting for better outcomes with the work we do; all while checking our egos at door, not taking ourselves too seriously and having fun along the wayWe’re location-flexible! This role is open to all candidates in Australia and New Zealand!Who we are: Squiz helps organisations thrive amidst change and uncertainty by creating great experiences online that improve lives offline. As a digital experience platform, we bring your teams, content, applications and customer data together in one place, so customers can easily create a seamless customer experience across every channel.Founded in 1998, Squiz is headquartered in Australia, with teams and customers across the globe. We have offices in New Zealand, the United States, the United Kingdom and Poland.Right now, we are in the midst of a very exciting point in our journey. We are transforming into a SaaS digital experience platform organisation, and we’re looking for people like you to be a part of this journey of reinvention.Who you are: Squiz is for everyone. If you’re smart and good at what you do, come as you are. For a Developer, we require the following: :You have 3-5 years web development experience with HTML, CSS, and JSExperience in building JavaScript applicationsExperience with JS frameworks, preferably ReactExperience with web service integrations and working with APIs (REST, SOAP)Experience with Matrix Implementation (including REST and API advanced features)You have the ability to adapt and thrive in an evolving environment with a company/team first approachClient-centric problem solving approach Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and collaborative approach; ability to work effectively with the team, internal and external stakeholdersA desire to learn new thingsWhat you would be doing: Work closely with clients to understand their problems and advise them on the best solutionsCollaboratively work with your squad cutting up designs and reviewing codeParticipate in agile ceremonies including stand-ups, sprint refinements, planning, reviews, and showcases Develop robust code which meets all technical requirementsApplying development best practices across all levels of your work Contribute to the team’s (and your own) continuous growth and improvement by bringing new ideas to the table, and contributing to discussions Why work for Squiz? You’ll work with some of the most intelligent and down to earth people you’ll ever meet. We are made up of a diverse range of passionate people who love challenging the status quo. Every day is different, but what is constant is we enjoy what we do.We have a lived commitment to flexibility....we know it’s key to our longevity and success is a balanced life. You will have flexibility as to where and how you work every day. We want you to be able to work in a way that drives productivity, efficiency and outcomes; along with connection and collaboration.

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
Quick Release (QR_) is a subsidiary of Alten Group located in Australia. Alten Group is a worldwide leader in Engineering services (42,300 employees) with operations in 30 different countries.We work in key areas such as Aerospace and Defense, Automotive, Rail, Energy and Life Science.We currently are looking for a permanent Java developer to join our Melbourne team.As a company, we are looking to develop our Engineer skills, and allow their personal development. The diversity of our projects and customers will allow you to develop your career path in Australia or abroad.Is your skillset transferrable? Do you have a long-term goal of becoming a Project Manager? Joining QR_ and Alten will allow you to grow as an Engineer.Your roleAs a Software Developer (m/f/d) you will develop Java codes for modern, scalable services and other backend components using modern development tools.You will make changes to existing software and support the qualification of development stagesDue to the required high-quality assurance, you will document your progress and also perform software analysesFurthermore, you identify the potential for improvement of the software as well as tools and processesWho are we looking for?The ideal candidate will possess a passion for Engineering, with a result-oriented and proactive mind-set.The successful candidate will have the chance to work on several exciting projects throughout their career with QR_, developing their engineering knowledge as a Java Software Engineer and a Consultant.RequirementsExperience required:7+ years Java development experience, supported by strong design principles Strong Algorithm skills Knowledge of the IDE/CICD Tools: GIT, Bitbucket, Gradle, Cucumber, Jenkins, Eclipse, JIRA Previous experience of undertaking a senior role within a software development team, or have an aspiration to undertake a senior role within a software development team, with a proven ability to deliver successful software Experience with Agile methodologies, i.e. SCRUM, SAFE Experience of Aerospace software development and relational databases would be advantageous (DO-278)Qualifications required:Degree in a relevant engineering discipline with demonstrable experience.BenefitsJoin a team that listens to your inputA light-hearted cultureJoin a fast-paced team with opportunities to build your careerYearly away and team bonding trips

title: Front-End/Web Developer
description:
At Neota, we are pioneers in no-code automation. Our technology empowers customers to fundamentally transform how they work and how they deliver services, with the result being business automation solutions delivering outcomes of much better quality, far greater consistency, and of astronomical scale compared to traditional or otherwise manual ways of working.We believe that our greatest asset is the people behind our platform. That technology is most powerful when driven by purpose. Our no-code platform is a game-changer for legal, procurement, risk and compliance professionals and we are always looking for curious minds and results-oriented professionals to join us.We are looking for a front-end developer that will help us implement major advancements to Neota's platform. As a front-end developer, you will be responsible for creating tools for developing beautiful, cross-browser, and responsive interfaces using modern web technologies. Among other things, you will collaborate in development using TypeScript and React, among other technologies, for creation of innovative no-code web tools.Responsibilities:Implementing major advancements to Neota's no-code platform for creating intelligent, expert system and automation. applications,Creating tools for developing beautiful, cross-browser, and responsive interfaces using modern web technologies,Maintaining internal and external facing web infrastructure.RequirementsQualifications:3+ years of professional experience working with modern web technologies (React, TypeScript, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, AJAX, and the like),Experience building tools for website development,Knowledge of Object Oriented development and functional languagesUnderstanding of relational databases and data modelsExperience in mobile development and responsive design (preferred),The ability to come up to speed quickly and thrive in an environment rich in complexity,Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present ideas and solutions in a clear and organized manner,The ability to work independently and achieve established goals with minimal supervision,Attention to detail and penchant for neat architectures,Passion for designing excellent user experiences!Requirements:React,TypeScript/JavaScript,HTML5,CSS3,AJAX,Responsive DesignFluency in Git.Knowledge of the following skills and technologies is a plus:GraphQL,WordPress,eslint,Nx/webpack/Snowpack,CKEditor.BenefitsWe value our employees’ time and efforts. We work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, with flexible working conditions and an encouraging environment where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture.

title: Software Developers
description:
Company DescriptionEvery person at Leidos plays an important and valued role bringing science, engineering and technology together to produce practical solutions for our customers’ most complex problems. It’s how we help to make the world safer, healthier and more efficient - work that matters and a mission, like those of our customers, we are passionate about. We’re open minded, ambitious and committed to enabling our people to do their best work, to be inspired by what they can achieve and the impact they can have.Here in Australia, we’re agile and growing fast. Our 1,600 employees are busy building an enviable reputation for innovation and delivery. And, as part of a US-based organisation with 37,000 people and a 50 year history, we are able to draw upon world-leading technical expertise to help us provide the best solutions to our customers.Job DescriptionWe have multiple opportunities available for Software Engineers to join our high performing Command, Control, Communications & Computers, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) line of business, working on an exciting, highly visible federal government customer. The project is focussed on developing the data processing platform that drives one of the most visited websites in Australia. The roles are multi-faceted as we are looking for unique individuals whom are able to contribute broadly across the software development lifecycle in a range of ways, including but not limited to: agile software development; DevOps; Data Integration; Release Management; Software Management; Sustainment; and Database administration.The individuals we are looking for are highly motivated software engineers and able to work flexibly as either a domain specialist, focussed on expertise within a narrow field of view, or with broad experience across the lifecycle.The individuals we are looking for will also be experienced in and appreciate the ins and outs of system development methodologies, tools, practices and approaches such that best practices and novel concepts can be thoughtfully devised and experimented with in our endless search for optimal development and delivery performance.The successful candidate(s) will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, experience in integrating multi-technology platforms, solid communication skills and a desire to tackle complex problems in a unique environment. We are looking for hands-on and experienced people that love everything about building software, solving engineering problems, and leveraging innovative ideas and technologies.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll Bring Attributes, attitudes and behaviours that will be highly desirable include and of the following:A love of all things software and a desire to solve interesting problems through coding;Being adaptable to change and pivoting where required;Significant hands-on experience in delivering a variety of software solutions;Experience in the design and implementation of DevOps approaches to software development;Being familiar with a range of relevant technologies including but not limited to: Java, NiFi, Ansible, Spring, Python, PostgreSQL;Being familiar with a range of relevant technical domains including but not limited to: geospatial technologies; data management; automated build and deployments; cloud technologies;Hand-on experience in setting up software development tool-chains including but not limited to configuration management tools, artefact management tools, code quality and security analysis tools, automated testing tools, integrated software development environments, continuous integration tools, collaboration tools, and software and architecture modelling tools. Understand and uses appropriate modelling approaches, including logical models of components, modules and interfaces, to contribute to the development of systems and software architectures in specific business or functional areas; Provides advice on technical aspects of system development and integration (including requests for changes, deviations from specifications, etc.) and ensures that relevant technical strategies, policies, standards and practices (including security) are applied correctly;A hands-on preference to approaching your work with a strong desire to solve problems by doing;A strong level of familiarity with software development lifecycles and related best practices such as those related to human engineering, user experience engineering, software safety, and others;Real end-to-end experience with the delivery of an software development program from cradle to grave;A Strong desire to tackle and solve problems, including problems that are challenging and complex;A love of immersion in a field or discipline of interest that enables deep operational and business insights to be learned and superior conclusions to be drawn;A lack of satisfaction if you see a process or procedure or methodology that is sub-optimal, that you have not improved, enhanced or in some way made better;A curiosity for novel and new ideas and problems that you are then able to use your experience and knowledge to help solve;Either or both of: a keen attention to detail or an ability to understand the big picture in the context of problem solving, analysis and design;Comfort in working as an individual contributor and as a part of a team depending on the task at hand;Experience within an agile development team will be very useful including SCRUM or Kanban;Excellent English written and verbal communication skills;QualificationsA Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or a related discipline, or equivalent experience/combined education, with substantial relevant professional experience and specialised training that commensurate with the assignment.We understand that there are many paths to becoming a software engineer, so if your journey is unique, don’t let that stop you from applying for this position!Additional InformationWhat You'll LoveAt Leidos we look after our staff. Flexible working practices, great team building initiatives, consistent learning and development opportunities, employee discounts and excellent exposure to a variety of technologies and projects are just some of the perks. We are growing and evolving, so it’s an exciting place to be.Our diverse employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Leidos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

title: 2024 Graduate Software Engineer – Melbourne CBD
description:
Company DescriptionAward winning Graduate ProgramLeidos has been identified as #1 Top Graduate Employer in the Defence and Aerospace sector by GradAustralia and has been recognised as a Top 75 Graduate Employer for three years in a row by the AAGE - So what makes our graduate program award winning?As a graduate you are employed on a permanent basis working on real projects as an embedded team member, and will spend the first 12 months on the graduate programYou will be allocated a ‘Leidos Purple Buddy’ to help get you settled inYou will attend a graduate specific induction along with monthly graduate catch ups as an opportunity to build connections internally and to learn more about the businessYou will be offered a formal mentoring program to help grow your careerand will undertake a number of professional development and training courses to get you upskilled. Leidos BenefitsAccess to over 100,000 online training and development courses through our the technical training portal PercipioSupport of advocacy groups including; The Young Professionals, Women and Allies Network, Allies & Action for Accessibility and Abilities and the Defence & Emergency ServicesEntitlement to one day a year of volunteer leave to support a cause you’re passionate aboutLeidos is a family friendly certified organisation and we provide flexible work arrangements that are outcomes focused and may consist of; flexible work hours, Life Days (formally RDOs), Switch Days where you can switch a public holiday for an alternative days that means more to you, and a career break of between 3 months and 2 years to take time out from Leidos to explore other interestsAccess to Reward Gateway to give upfront discounts or cashback rewards with over 400 Australian and International retailersWhat makes Leidos stand out?As a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services company, Leidos works to solve the world’s most complex challenges through the integration and application of information and technology and systems to deliver unique, practical and usable solutions to our customers’ most complex challenges.In Australia we have over 2,000 employees mostly based in Melbourne and Canberra. Globally we number 45,000 employees and are located in 35 countries. Our Mission is to make the world safer, healthier and more efficient through information technology, engineering and science. It’s work that we can all be proud of.Leidos is a trusted partner of the Australian Government and we deliver software applications for a wide range of missions in the Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance domain as well as health solutions. We provide critical projects to the Department of Defence whilst supporting the IT environment for the Australian Taxation Office. We also maintain legislative websites for a number of governments.Job DescriptionYour New RoleAn average week for a Graduate Software Engineer could include a wide range of activities including:Liaising with system users to document a requirement or specification and understand their needs, goals, and any issues or limitations;Using your skills to undertake software analysis, design, development and testing of software;Solving complex problems using software related methodologies, processes, standards and tools;Translating and implementing simple development project requirements into physical database structures and code;Applying data analysis and data modelling techniques to establish, modify or maintain a data structure and its associated components;Analysing code and systems for potential security vulnerabilities and code to avoid accidental introduction of such vulnerabilities;Assisting in the investigation and resolution of issues relating to applications by correcting program errors, preparing instructions, analysing system capabilities and output requirements, in order to meet software standards;Working as part of a team in an Agile environment to contribute to the overall success of program delivery by working on individual activities and collaborating to come together using configuration and version control;Undertaking independent learning to improve your knowledge of software development. At Leidos we work with a number of different tools and technologies to deliver complex solutions to our customers from project to project. Your role could include exposure to some of the following, noting previous experience is not requiredInfrastructure as Code (IaC) – Terraform, Ansible Cloud Technologies – AWS, Azure On Prem – OpenShift, VMWare Kubernetes/Containers – Docker/Containerd, Rancher, Tanzu, Helm, Skaffold Web – ReactDB – Oracle, Postgres, SQLServer, MongoDB, Redis,DevSecOps – GitLab, Jenkins, GitOps Agile – Scrum, Kanban, XP Graduates will be supported to develop their skills and knowledge specific to this role, to ensure they are able to contribute and reach their highest potential. As a Leidos graduate, you will be working on interesting and challenging projects and will take part in a range of training and development opportunities.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringThis role is ideal for someone who is completing or has recently completed a Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution in a related discipline:Bachelor of Software EngineeringBachelor of Software DevelopmentBachelor of Information TechnologyBachelor of Computer ScienceBachelor of Systems EngineeringAlong with your education and any practical experience, Leidos values individuals who use their initiative and seek to understand the business and develop relationships based on respect.Additional InformationSuccessful candidates must be Australian Citizens at the time of application to be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Government Security Clearance.At Leidos, we proudly embrace diversity and support our people at every stage of their Leidos journey in terms of inclusion, accessibility and flexibility. We have a strong track record of internal promotion and career transitions. And at Leidos you’ll enjoy flexible work practices, discounted health insurance, novated leasing, 12 weeks paid parental leave as a primary carer and more. We look forward to welcoming you.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Who are we?We are a group of founders looking to disrupt the large and rapidly-growing global cybersecurity industry with world first technology.We are driven, dynamic and passionate about changing our industry on a big scale. We have deep understanding of our industry and our customers. We are looking for a junior software engineer to join our team of gifted engineers. You will be heavily involved in developing our products. We are a tight-knit, high-achieving team that values trust and respect for one another.Who are you?- You are a grad or early in your career and looking to work with a team who can help accelerate your learning. - You are proactive and hard working. - You will have strong coding skills and are open to an agile development program.- You love designing software and designing/building solutions to complex problems. - You love software and you have a number of weird home tech projects on the go. - You are a Star Wars and/or Star Trek fan (we don't discriminate). - You are obsessive about memes.You’ll get to:- Write code that thousands of industry participants will use every day. - Work collaboratively to arrive at architecturally-sound engineering decisions. - Help architect complex cyber security software at a high level, and play a role in crafting how they work.- Hone your craft through engineering best practices like code review, collaborative learning, and mentoring.- Collaborate with clients and client facing teams to help shape product specifications.- Have a say in how we do software engineering - we’re always looking to do better.- Hang out with an awesome team of like minded people and have all kinds of fun.What you bring:- Robust experience in Front-end and/or Back-end development, and a desire to expand your skill set.- Experience in developing applications and working with programming languages (Examples include: Python, C#, Java, Javascript). Being able to program in C and/or Swift is a big plus!- Working knowledge of databasing systems (SQL or NoSQL).- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.- A reasoned and pragmatic approach to software development and testing.- A love of problem-solving, investigating problems and determining the appropriate fix.- Open to working in an agile development environment.- A willingness to contribute and help others on the team improve in their craft.- A strong interest in software engineering and software design.- Experience with Amazon Web Services and Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform would be a big plus but not required.Why will you like working with us?- We do meaningful work every day - we move fast and focus on what matters- We are empowered to make decisions - we don’t let processes and approval hierarchies get in the way; we trust our team to use their judgement- We are obsessed about solving customer problems - we are always testing, learning and improving what we’ve done before- We have fun - we celebrate our successes & don’t take ourselves too seriously.Location:We are seeking a Perth-based candidate to work full time in the Perth CBD. This is nota work from home position.What should you send us?If you're interested, please send us your CV, a cover letter, a link to at least onepersonal project you've worked on on Github (or in tar.gz form if you don't use Github),and a half pager talking about why you're proud of that project and what you likedmost about working on it.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Join a global proptech front-runner and work with some of Australia’s leading property companiesFull-time permanent role with great potential for growthHybrid working arrangements are the normABOUT USWe’re Equiem - a global leader in property technology (‘proptech’). We launched the world’s first tenant experience app for office buildings - a key innovation that helps commercial landlords digitize their buildings and make them exciting, productive and vibrant places to work. Imagine your dream work environment - that is what we help deliver.Equiem started with two employees and one building in 2011. Today, we have 150+ staff and our app is live in 600+ buildings across Australia, the UK, the US, Ireland and Canada - including many of the world’s most recognisable skyscrapers and campuses.Nothing like our product previously existed. It helped revolutionize how landlords engaged with their customers - the people in the building, creating a new category of technology called ‘tenant experience’. Today, ‘TenX’ is a key component of a modern landlord’s strategy.We’re established, but we’ve worked hard to retain the best aspects of our start-up culture. This means everyone has a voice, enjoys great self-rule, and is able to make a genuine impact on our business.We are looking out for an exceptional Senior DevOps Engineer and given our Global growth, this is the right time to come on board and be part of something great!THE ROLEBased in Melbourne, you will be part of the DevOps team which is a cross-functional agile infrastructure development team. The team’s goal is to provide platform solutions leveraging AWS to the Equiem product development team, enabling them to deliver products quickly and easily. You will write infrastructure as code to deploy, monitor, and maintain Equiem’s core platform. Where You’ll Spend Your time:Building and monitoring our scalable and secure cloud infrastructure. Automating to help our teams move quicklyCoaching and mentoring other members of the development team on cloud best practices, emerging frameworks, services and trends. Building features with one of our teams YOUR NEW TEAMHighly collaborative and agileModern technology stack, architecture and practicesFlexible working culture - remote/office mix that won’t change, everCultivate and encourage a culture of agility, autonomy and transparency through the implementation of agile and lean best practicesFriendly, fun & motivated culture.WHO ARE YOU?A collaborative, curious and motivated problem solver. You relate well to all kinds of people, up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organisation. You build constructive and effective relationships with your teammates and those who interact with your team.You will need to be comfortable working within an extremely dynamic environment and with people who are driven by their passion for the business and to succeed.Have a strong sense of ownership and pride in the work you doPossess a deep understanding of modern cloud architecture and web application developmentHungry for knowledge and continuous learningCollaborative, use your initiative, are outcome-focused and able to work comfortably in a fast-paced environment. The Essentials:3+ years hands-on experience automating infrastructure in a cloud environment, preferably Amazon Web Services Solid experience with infrastructure-as-code tools (e.g. Cloudformation, AWS CDK Terraform, Ansible, etc.) Strong experience developing and maintaining CI/CD tools (e.g. CircleCI, Jenkins etc) Experience with programming languages (e.g. Node, TypeScript, Python, Java, etc.) and scripting languages (e.g. Bash, PowerShell) Understanding of GraphQL APIs Knowledge of different types of database systems (PostgreSQL, Elastic Search etc.) WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?In return, we offer a fun, cohesive and flexible working environment with a team that thrives on achieving the ambitions we aim for, plus:Chance to join an experienced SaaS team who are respected and empowered to initiate change Grow your career in a world-class, progressive business, with a product that is second to noneStartup mentality in a global business. Own your role and make it what you wantFlexible work arrangements for any roles that allow. We are about outcomes, not clock-watching We think the day you were born is a special day, so celebrate and take the day off...and still get paid! If you don’t celebrate your birthday, then let’s agree on a day you’d like to celebrate that is special to youAbility to purchase additional leave - after 12 months of serviceFrequent team social events - we do hang out outside of work!Access to support from our Employee Assistance ProgramDIVERSITY & INCLUSIONAs a company, we truly embrace diversity and inclusion on a day-to-day basis. So much so that to us, this goes without saying. For our hiring process, this means that all candidates are accessed based on role requirements, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin or on the basis of disability. If you require any assistance to be included in our process, please contact people@getequiem.com, quoting the job title and reference number. COVID-19 & EMPLOYMENT CHECKSAt Equiem, the health and safety of our people and the broader community are our highest priority. We strongly encourage all employees to be fully vaccinated for Covid-19, plus you will be required to complete an Australian Criminal History Check which we’ll take care of. We have chosen to share this information early in the process so candidates can make an informed decision.HOW TO APPLYWe move quickly and applications close upon discretion, so if you don’t want to miss out, apply today!We respect the time that applying to roles takes, appreciate your interest in Equiem and will respond as a matter of priority to all applications.  Please note that we do not accept CVs from recruitment agencies.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Company DescriptionAbout UsOur name isn’t the only thing that’s unique about Leidos Australia. We’re a complex systems integration company building world-class solutions across government and defence that ensure peace of mind for the entire nation. Supported by global backing from our US network, we’re trusted by our customers to deliver the most innovative, effective, efficient and sustainable answers to their most complex challenges. Seriously interesting work that benefits and safeguards every Australian – that’s where you come in.Job DescriptionWe have an opportunity for an experienced DevOps Engineer to support a multi-year Defence program to deliver an enterprise Health Knowledge Management System. This capability will enable better clinical decision making for the ADF and providing market leading healthcare to ADF personnel.In joining the team you will be an active contributor to the projects overall success. You will work closely with and participate in design and implementation reviews with the security, engineering and development teams to ensure the system infrastructure components meet requirements.Working in a cross-functional team, leading in the area of software and system release packaging activities during delivery you will contribute to a successful program by:Following or devising new approaches to package and test deployment of packaged COTS products, and deploy to AWS and Defence environments. Automating build and deployment of COTS products in AWS and bespoke Defence environments. Maintaining Software and Release baseline version control in source code and image repositories. Preparing System Release documentation such as installation instructions, release notes, software version description. Performing system administration duties such as environment configuration, network configuration, software and O/S patching. Troubleshooting and problem solving deployment and environment issues. Driving and/or contributing to release process improvements. Potentially contributing to software coding, unit testing, and integration testing. Building and maintaining effective working relationships across all levels.  QualificationsEssential Experience5+ years’ experience as a DevOps Engineer, Release Engineer, Application Packaging Engineer, or Systems Administrator or Software Engineer majoring in software and system releases. Demonstrated experience in working with Software and System Releases in large scale projects. Demonstrated experience in understanding cloud and on premise environment configuration settings. Hand on experience with the following technologies:Linux (RHEL), Kubernetes, Rancher, Terraform, Helm chart, AWS, Git, Artifactory, CI/CD pipeline,Scripting languages such as JavaScript, Ansible, and PowerShell. Qualifications in, or demonstrated experience of development within a systems engineering lifecycle environment and standard Agile methodologies. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Self-starter; demonstrates initiative and can take accountability to deliver on-time outcomes. Baseline cleared (NV1 preferred), or willing to obtain and maintain Defence Security Clearance. DesirableKnowledge of RESTful APIs and SOAP-based Web Services. Knowledge in Object Oriented languages, e.g. Java. Experience and knowledge in Health Industry. Additional InformationWhat You'll LoveAt Leidos, we support your career development and have a strong track record of internal promotion. We have a highly flexible workplace culture and work life balance is respected and encouraged. Our benefits include 12 weeks' paid leave for primary careers, novated leasing, an RDO program and health insurance discount.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
460degrees are a boutique business & technology transformation consultancy across Australia.Our DevOps team are looking for a DevOps Engineer to work on a current engagement with a large University client in Melbourne. Our team on this project are currently working on a hybrid model (2 days in the office). We are looking for an Engineer who is passionate about good engineering practices and taking our clients on their DevOps journey.Key Responsibilities:Providing leadership and support Development Tools/Systems, CI/CD, infrastructure automation and toolingWorking directly with other devs and team members for our client to ensure that CI/CD, Infrastructure As Code, Security, Compliance and TDD are embedded within the systems and cultureEnsuring Reliability, Security, Compliance, Resilience and Scalability for Production systemsIntroducing a test-first approach to configuration management and infrastructure-as-codeIdentifying inefficiencies in architecture as well as providing advice on a layered cost saving strategy, pursuing cost savings for AWS Cloud workloadsTechnical Requirements:Experience working on at least one Cloud platform (Azure/GCP/Azure)Experience with CI/CD and Infrastructure As Code toolingSome programming experience would be goodApply directly, or drop me a message for a confidential discussion. Happy to discuss the project in more detail.

title: DevOps Engineer
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
description:
Company DescriptionDiscover the UnexpectedExperian is the world’s leading global information services company. We are listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN) and are a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index. We’re passionate about unlocking the power of data in order to transform lives and create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. For more than 125 years, we’ve helped businesses grow, consumers and small businesses gain access to financial services, and economies and communities flourish – and we’re not done.Our 18k amazing employees in 40+ countries believe the possibilities for you, and the world, are growing. We’re investing in the future, through new technologies, talented people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow.To do this we employ the greatest and brightest minds that share our purpose and want to make a difference. Experian Asia Pacific's culture, people and environments are key differentiators. We focus on what truly matters; diversity and inclusion, work/life balance, flexible working, development, equity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. We’re committed to fostering a strong sense of belonging and a place where you can bring your true self to work.We’re an award winning organisation due to our strong people first focus. This includes Top Employer™ and Great Place To Work™ accreditations.Learn more at www.experianplc.comJob DescriptionThis exciting role is responsible for scaling, developing, and monitoring the high-volume low-latency bank transaction enrichment systems developed by Look Who’s Charging business unit of Experian. Together, you will assist with development and implementation of best practices to monitor and scale LWC services supporting 40 million bank transactions enrichment per day. With a growing list of 40+ banks and other financial institutions are our clients; we are looking to eliminate all tasks that are automatable or repetitive.You will have a good knowledge and experience using cloud tools, infrastructure as a code, and DevOps practices. The hybrid role will work alongside the Senior SRE in supporting and maintaining our solutions, as well with the Head of Development in developing the Look Who’s Charging solution. It is an excellent opportunity for someone to hone their skills in both Devops and Development and explore their potential in each discipline.What You’ll Be DoingDevelop CI/CD pipelines to build, containerise, test & deploy application components to cloud services such as Kubernetes, web apps, serverless functions etc.Incorporate quality checks into pipelines for code, security, performance, and test coverage for the committed codeAutomate operational tasks by writing scripts and scheduled jobs.Assist in the development and troubleshooting of infrastructure deployment process via Infrastructure as Code.Implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying software components in the cloud.Write secure, performant, and scalable code to support Look Who's Charging high-volume low-latency APIs.Improve monitoring and alerting of our cloud infrastructure and applications.QualificationsMore about youYou hate repetitive tasks and always look for automation opportunitiesHave experience in Software Engineering and System Engineering in a Cloud based environment Experience in Microservices Architecture and .NET Ecosystem from a DevOps standpointExperience with SQL and NoSQL Databases.Full software lifecycle automation experience (design, development, test, deployment), including deployment to a production environment.Strong experience with Unit testing, integration testing, and code coverage.Understand standard cloud networking & security concepts or a curiosity to learn.Familiar with logging and monitoring tools (or equivalent) such as ELK stack, Grafana, Prometheus, CloudWatch, application insights etc. would be a plusAdditional InformationCulture at ExperianOur uniqueness is that we truly value yours. Experian Asia Pacific's culture, people and environments are key differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously. We focus on what truly matters; diversity and inclusion, work/life balance, development, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on.We’re an award winning organisation due to our strong people focus.Experian Asia Pacific isn't just growing, we're leveraging cutting edge data science, inclusion and start-up mindsets to build tomorrow's credit solutions. Innovation is a critical part of Experian's DNA and culture.Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow togetherFind out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here
