title: DevOps Engineer
description:
About the CompanyThere has never been a better time to join illion. Our business is transforming and we are transforming the way we work with a strong focus on the value of our people and our customers. Our business leaders are modernising our culture and empowering our team to reach their full potential. There is a bright future ahead for illion and we are seeking innovative and passionate individuals to be a part of it!We currently have an exciting full time permanent opportunity for a DevOps Engineer to join our Technology team.About the RoleYou will be primarily accountable for the design, development, implementation and maintenance of our AWS Cloud Platform and Infrastructure solutions. You will work closely with the development team to ensure that code deployments are completed in an automated and timely manner – maintaining and improving our DevOps pipelines.Functional Tasks & Responsibilities: Implement, monitor and improve security configurations using best practice industry and AWS technologies, tools and processesMaintain AWS cloud infrastructure in optimal configuration from both technical and budgetary perspectives.Make effective use of Cloud Watch to monitor EC2 performance and setup trigger-based alerts.Provision EC2 instances end-to-end. This requires knowledge of instance families, EBS, VPC, security groups, and tags.Make appropriate use of AWS operational best practices.Identify issues and inconsistencies through the AWS console and proactively work to correct them.Manage full application stacks from the O/S through custom applications using Amazon cloud-based computing environments.Implement new cloud environmentsContribute to the implementation and maintenance of our DevOps CI/CD pipelineDeploy releases to all environments and constantly look to optimise the release and deployment process.Experience3-4 years professional experienceExperience with AWS Core Services including VPC, EC2, S3, Route 53, RDSExperience with AWS Security, Monitoring and Logging services – WAF, CloudWatch, Guard Duty, VPC Flow Logs, CloudTrailKnowledge of networking fundamentalsExperience with Linux (preferably Ubuntu and/or AWS Linux)Experience with MySQL databases and with RDS.DevOps knowledge related to CD/CIExperience of PHP environments running under Apache / Nginx and configuration of web server environments for performance and security.Highly organized with excellent verbal and written Communication skillsCultureThere has never been a better time to join illion. Our business is transforming and we are transforming the way we work with a strong focus on the value of our people and our customers. Our business leaders are modernising our culture and empowering our team to reach their full potential. There is a bright future ahead for illion and we are seeking innovative and passionate individuals to be a part of it!BenefitsVery flexible working culture – we are hybrid, of course!DEAL Time – Drop Everything and Learn – an hour of ‘tools down’ professional or personal development every week!Social Club - Quarterly calendar of events allowing team member to network and socialized in a fun and relaxed environmentHow to ApplyTo apply, please click "Apply Now" button and we will be in touch shortly.Here at illion, we value diversity and inclusion and believe that we are able to grow and learn better together with a diverse team of employees. By joining illion you'll be part of an inclusive culture that celebrates a diversity of cultures, skill sets, educations and opinions. People from all culturally diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply

title: Cloud DevOps Engineer
description:
About Us-: We are Wipro (NYSE: WIT), a rapidly expanding and leading global Information Technology, Consulting and Business Process Services company with over 225,000 employees worldwide, servicing clients in 175+ cities and 69 countries across 6 continents. For more information, please visit www.wipro.comJob Description-:The primary purpose of the role is to assist senior engineers with tasks in relation to the design and development of cloud infrastructure solutions primarily built upon cloud computing services and open source frameworks. Working in a cross-functional team, the role will support developers in the delivery of technology solutions using continuous delivery methodologies, with a focus on test driven development and automation.Demonstrated experience working with cloud infrastructure.Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of infrastructure as code, DevOps and CI/CD methodologies.Demonstrated experience with a range of build automation tools, software repositories and scripting languages. .Demonstrated strong understanding of secure coding practices and website security.If you only meet some of the requirements for this role, that's ok!!!So, if you have the curiosity to learn and the willingness to teach what you know, we'd love to hear from you.Benefits @ WiproFlexible/remote working culture – location is not a limitation of success at Wipro.Global Travel & Relocation opportunities – COVID permitting.Paid Parental Leave – 1st & 2ndExcellent Remuneration Package.Quarterly bonus/variable pay.Quarterly Career Progression Reviews – we do not limited our employees to the usual once per year reviews!Novated Lease & Salary Sacrifice.Reduced Corporate Healthcare Rates.Fringe, Concession + Membership & Subscription Tax Benefits.Financial Advisory & Banking Benefits.Free Ongoing training and development to help you reach your full potential.Collaborative team - positive and empathetic people who love to laugh either through social distancing in the office or virtually from home!Team building, fun activities and social events – COVID permitting.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Motorsport Games, a Motorsport Network company, combines innovative and engaging video games with exciting esports competitions and content for racing fans and gamers around the globe. The Company is the officially licensed video game developer and publisher for iconic motorsport racing series including NASCAR, INDYCAR, 24 Hours of Le Mans and the British Touring Car Championship (“BTCC”). Motorsport Games is an award-winning esports partner of choice for 24 Hours of Le Mans, Formula E, BTCC, the FIA World Rallycross Championship and the eNASCAR Heat Pro League among others.A publicly listed company on the NASDAQ, Motorsport Games is headquartered in Miami, Florida, with additional offices located in the United Kingdom, Netherlands, Australia, and Russia.ResponsibilitiesImplement, maintain and consolidate development, testing, automation tools and IT infrastructureEffectively deploy, manage and monitor Cloud infrastructure in a LiveOps environmentDefining and setting development, test, release, update, and support processes for DevOps operationEncouraging and building automated processes wherever possibleIdentifying and deploying cybersecurity measures by continuously performing vulnerability assessment and risk managementIncident management and root cause analysisManage and oversee source control infrastructure Managing and deploying various CI/CD tools and striving for continuous improvement of our processesRequirementsVersion control systems like Perforce and Github and BitBucket.CI / CD systems like Team City and Bamboo.Google Cloud, AWS and AzureMigration of Confluence instancesContainerization and Orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)Infrastructure as Code technologies (Terraform)scripting languages (Python, Powershell)Logging, monitoring and incident response technologies (Stackdriver, CloudWatch, PagerDuty)Unix based Systems AdministrationScoping, design and implementation of cloud architectureBenefitsCompetitive salary, corporate benefits and the opportunity to define the future of racing from within an exciting, growing and friendly international games companyMotorsport Games is a division of Motorsport Network; it is the home for a team that believes in the power of interactive virtual motor racing and putting people in control of their own motorsports story. We are the destination for the world’s major motorsport series and brands from NASCAR to Le Mans and Formula E. We operate along the entire vertical of development, publishing and competitive esports ecosystem.We’re more than just a developer or publisher – we’re the people delivering tomorrow’s virtual racing dreams today.

title: Senior Devops Engineer
description:
Changing communities for the better starts with youCivica is a global organisation of over 5,000 employees, providing smart software to deliver the public services of the future and improve outcomes for citizens.We do this by collaborating with a large number of organisations including schools, libraries, local councils, state governments, and healthcare and community organisations, applying innovation and creative thinking.What does it take to become a Civican?Civica has a great opportunity for an experienced Senior Devops Engineer to come and join the team within our Local Government Business Unit.As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you are in the frontline team, keeping our new fleet of Azure Kubernetes clusters up and running. Every day, you will diagnose and solve challenging and interesting technical problems providing a service in a highly automated environment.Our service is relied on by Local Government Organizations all over Australia and New Zealand to deliver for millions of end users.As a Senior Devops Engineer, you will have a lot of experience working with API's along with establishing and maintaining CI/CD and Release Pipelines for infrastructure as code and software development.About YouAs a Senior Devops Engineer, you will provide an expert operational support to our nodes running in the cloud, using technologies such as Linux (Debian, Ubuntu), Docker, and languages including Java and .net.You are required to develop and continually improve our suite of internal automation tools, applications, and processes.We welcome your unique talentsYou will also come with some Essential Competencies mentioned below:PowershellC# (Basic level)Knowledge of application development & deployment with .net framework (including asp.net)Azure cloud (managing resources, deploying apps, configuration scripts, monitoring etc)Experience with at least one of the following tools: terraform/chef/puppet/ansible/vagrantWindows Server and IIS administrationBasic SQL Server admin skillsNetwork configuration and certificate management, identity management (especially AD and Azure AD)Basic Linux skillsSource control (git)Why you’ll love working with usHere at Civica, we look after you. Here’s what you can expect:Career opportunities – we take great satisfaction in seeing you grow and share your knowledge to other parts of our large businessFlexible work – we have the technology and tools to support you to work from that tropical paradise you’ve dreamed of… or even if you just prefer to work from home and come into our offices now and then to catch up and socialise with colleaguesWe’re all different – and we love this about us. We provide an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment to all Civicans, new and oldFocus on learning– there are heaps of opportunities to enable you to grow and be your best.Giving culture - we encourage you to “give back” with benefits such as our Donate a Day leave where you can volunteer for a charity of your choicePlease note these roles are Australia/New Zealand based.We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.In fact, we strongly believe that diversity of experience contributes to a broader collective perspective that will consistently lead to a better company and better outcomes. We are working hard to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it. We are especially keen to receive applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples of Australia and welcomes applications from all sections of the community.

title: DevOps Engineer (AUS)
description:
Mission – Why We Exist, What We Do, and Why We Need YouProfisee exists to empower the possibilities of the data-enabled future. In a world where data drives decisions, opportunity, and innovation, the importance of trusted data simply cannot be overstated. Because when data matters, you must be able to trust your data, and Master Data Management (MDM) is the path that forward-thinking organizations take to ensure a trusted data foundation.The DevOps Engineer has a unique opportunity to be a key contributor in the development, support, and maintenance of a multi-tenant SaaS MDM platform, carrying forward our achievement of being the first MDM vendor to deliver a container-based PaaS architecture in 2020. With collaboration across engineering, QA, support, and cybersecurity, this is an exciting opportunity to drive a key component of Profisee’s future technology strategy.Relocation is not available for this role, we are looking for candidates currently residing in Australia.Your Performance Objectives – What You Will AccomplishIn your first 3 months:Work with Profisee’s Architecture and Engineering teams to learn the current state of Profisee’s multi-tenant SaaS infrastructure. Continually improve our code and infrastructure to automate further the deployment of the Profisee Platform into Azure and other cloud platforms. Establish and maintain DevOps automation as Profisee evolves toward a more frequent product release cadence to upgrade the customer’s environment with each new Profisee release. Create and update the tooling and processes for monitoring deployed customer solutions and coordinate with Profisee Support to meet uptime SLAs. Collaborate with Profisee’s cybersecurity team to implement security processes and procedures to support corporate security policies. Take over ownership and support of Profisee’s PaaS deployment artifacts, which customers use to deploy Profisee into their own cloud tenant (an alternative to SaaS). Evolve them to take advantage of the investments made in SaaS. In your first 6 months:Deploy newly licensed customers, working with customer IT teams to configure network access to deployed solutions. Monitor application uptime and performance to ensure the satisfaction of customer SLAs. Monitor and manage Profisee’s SaaS infrastructure for performance and reliability, maximizing customer experience while optimizing operational costs. Support Profisee’s cybersecurity team in achieving initial security and compliance certifications. Assist the DevOps team in deploying IaC patches, feature releases, and improvements based in various regions and time zones. After 1 year: Collaborate with Profisee engineering to identify and implement product improvements to streamline the SaaS experience, including a shift towards more frequent upgrades and increases in efficiency to minimize run-time costs. Expand Profisee SaaS offerings to a broader set of global regions and/or additional cloud providers. Support Profisee’s cybersecurity team in acquiring additional security and compliance certifications.Competencies – What We Are Looking ForDevOps Technical Competency: Our key technical objective is an understanding of the technologies and processes for deploying, monitoring, and managing cloud-native solutions. You should possess knowledge and experience with Kubernetes (Helm, Containers, AKS, EKS, etc.), Infrastructure as code (Terraform), and general cloud platforms (Azure/AWS/GCP).Creative: Finds a way to solve hard problems. Able to identify solutions quickly and apply them. While Profisee is not the first to offer a SaaS solution via Kubernetes and containers, we will be increasingly pushing the capabilities of these technologies which are evolving quickly. You will need to be able to leverage the community to find creative ways to solve unforeseen challenges and unknowns as we build out this solution.Collaborative: Improves the knowledge and capabilities of those around them. Profisee is building a team for delivering our SaaS solution. We need you, the DevOps Engineer, to be a cornerstone of this team. You need to not just bring new knowledge into the company, but also spread that knowledge to others on the team helping us build a dynamic and capable organization.Proactive: Acts without being told what to do. Brings new ideas to the team. Identifies what needs to be done and moves quickly to achieve it. You are joining Profisee to help lead the creation of our DevOps processes and create our SaaS offering. While we will have a team working with you, you know better than anyone how to do your job. You should be a self-starter who predicts and plans for things to come and thrives in a self-directed work environment.Persistence: Demonstrates tenacity. SaaS is a key facet of Profisee’s overall strategy, but it won’t be simple or easy. You should be excited about the challenge and effort necessary to solve complex problems.BenefitsWhy we think YOU should come work with usYou will grow here more than you would anywhere else. That is a promise.You will experience joining at a high-growth/high-traction inflection pointYou will be a part of an amazing culture with a supportive and engaged CEO and Leadership TeamYou will join a team of experienced, passionate employees401K, full health care coverage, life insurance, vacation time, and more. . .How We Work – Our Core ValuesGrowth Mindset – We can learn and get better at anything. We embrace and accept mistakes as an essential part of the learning process. Growing, accomplishing new things, and helping others learn are some of the most rewarding experiences of being human!Constructive Candor – Enables us to get to the meat of issues quickly and is the foundation of trust. We hopefully disagree at times which means we enjoy the fruits of diverse perspectives. We always know how each other feels when we leave a room so we can feel comfortable voicing our opinions. This leads to more growth and an environment we love to be in every day.Helpful - Strives to assist, mentor, coach and assist your fellow Profisors to their highest potential and for them to be successful in every endeavor. Always has time to lend a hand, answer a question or share knowledge with your fellow employees as a matter of normal business and not as an exception.We Get Stuff Done! – Strategy without execution is just an idea. We deliver results, not reasons.Fun is where Fun is Made – Professional life is as enjoyable and rewarding as we make it. We covet the journey as much as the destination and strive to make each other laugh along the way.About ProfiseeLet’s find your somewhere new. Where your ideas are heard, no matter how long you’ve been at the company, or what your position is, or who you’re talking to. Where you can always tackle new challenges because the industry’s surface has barely been scratched. Where you can continue to grow because growth is in the company’s DNA. Where the driving question is, “Great, what’s next?”We’re looking for people who can help solve the biggest data problems for the biggest names – organizations like MD Anderson, Intel, Under Armour, and more – so they can achieve their most important strategic initiatives.So if you’re ready for a new adventure, get in touch.Profisee | Now you can make it happen™Equal Employment OpportunityQualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Profisee is an equal employment opportunity employer. Alternative methods of applying for employment are available to individuals unable to submit an application through this site because of a disability. Contact Jayson Cabrera at 678-551-6747, jayson.cabrera@profisee.com or 3655 Brookside Parkway, Suite 175, Alpharetta, GA 30022 to discuss reasonable accommodation.

title: Talent Pool - Devops
description:
Changing communities for the better starts with youJoin us on our mission to change the world.Civica is a global organisation of over 5,000 employees, providing smart software to deliver the public services of the future and improve outcomes for citizens.We do this by collaborating with a large number of organisations including schools, libraries, local councils, state governments, and healthcare and community organisations, applying innovation and creative thinking.We are problem solvers and experts in our field. And we love what we do because it makes a difference to those who really need it.In our team we have some truly amazing people - smart, passionate, fun. And there’s plenty of room for you to join our current talent pool for position in Devops Engineer that may come up in the near future.What does it take to become a Civican?Exceptional opportunity for an experienced and dynamic DevOps Developer to join Civica based in Australia. As part of our high performing Local Government business unit, you will be an integral hands-on addition to the already established team. Supported by senior leadership this permanent role will see you focus on script development and process automation. Collaborating with various stakeholders you will display exceptional communication skills with the ability to translate technical requirements and bridge the gap between development and our customers. You will bring your solid experience with various tools and design artefacts and in particular, you will have strong scripting and Linux experience. This is a great opportunity to join a growing organisation and be part of a great team.ResponsibilitiesBuilding and automating on application build, release, configuration management and deployment over both on-prem and cloud based infrastructure.Work as DevOps Engineer as a part of scrum teams on software delivery projects.Act as a technical escalation and provide L2/L3 for customer support requests.Monitor, respond and report on environment (application, platform & infrastructure) metrics in accordance with agreed customer SLAs for availability, performance and capacity.Be part of the on-call support team to perform releases, ad-hoc service requests and incident recovery during out of hours and public holidays.Developing infrastructure as a code (IaC) via scripting, automation, CI/CD pipelines, orchestration.About YouWe are looking for a highly capable and technically hands on experience DevOps Developer. You will also have:Hands-on experience on AWS and/or Azure design, implementation, optimization, and support of cloud infrastructure.Linux and Windows sysadmin skills, scripting with Perl / Python / PowerShell, integration with IaC.Demonstrable advanced application debugging (Microsoft IIS .NET technology stack) and troubleshooting skills.Experience in incident, problem, capacity and change management (ITIL desirable) and ability to maintain technical documentation and CI records in accordance with changes made.Good communication, coordination and interpersonal skills, and ability to work with internal / external stakeholders spreading in different time zones and geographical locations.Your BenefitsWe welcome your unique talentsCome be part of our Talent Pool and stay updated with new vacancies, news about Civica and what our Civicans have been up to!Why you’ll love working with usWe know that when our people are happy they will work better and have greater work satisfaction. We are an Australian Business Awards Employer of Choice and a UK Financial Times Diversity leader for the second year in 2021, rising 400 places and ranking 10th overall in the IT and software sector. We work with leading organisations such as the Tech Talent Charter and White RibbonSo here at Civica, we look after you. Here’s what you can expect:Career opportunities – we take great satisfaction in seeing you grow and share your knowledge to other parts of our large businessFlexible work – we have the technology and tools to support you to work from that tropical paradise you’ve dreamed of… or even if you just prefer to work from home and come into our offices now and then to catch up and socialise with colleaguesWe’re all different – and we love this about us. We provide an inclusive, safe and welcoming environment to all Civicans, new and oldFocus on learning– there are heaps of opportunities to enable you to grow and be your best.Giving culture - we encourage you to “give back” with benefits such as our Donate a Day leave where you can volunteer for a charity of your choiceApply to be a part of our Talent Pool - Become part of something specialPlease note these roles are Australia/New Zealand based.We are an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.In fact, we strongly believe that diversity of experience contributes to a broader collective perspective that will consistently lead to a better company and better outcomes. We are working hard to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it. We are especially keen to receive applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples of Australiaoyer and welcomes applications from all sections of the community.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
About Bridge SaaSBridge SaaS Limited (ASX: BGE) provides SaaS-based CRM and workflow solutions to the employment, care, and support industries. Its customers are third-party providers of human services programs operated by the Australian Government. The Bridge Software allows Providers to effectively manage large client caseloads and geographically distributed workforces, within a secure and compliant cloud-based platform. It is enterprise-grade and used by a range of organisations, from small and mid-size Providers to larger organisations. Bridge commenced operations in 2008 and has built an established, high-quality customer base within the Employment Services segment. The Company recently expanded into the adjacent disability segment, which has similar characteristics and an overlapping customer base. In total, Bridge manages more than 1 million client records and is accredited for 14 Australian Government programs.  About The Role We're looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team and help us optimise our development and deployment processes. What You'll DoManage and maintain our secure cloud infrastructure. We currently use a secure Open Stack Cloud provider and AWS. Our product is deployed in a multi-tenant architecture to keep our clients' data secure and separate from each otherAutomate and optimise our CI/CD pipeline in GitLabEnsure high availability and scalability of our systemsMonitor and troubleshoot infrastructure and application performance issuesCollaborate with development teams to implement infrastructure as code using Terraform/AnsibleEnsure the correct and secure configuration of the systemEnsure that security solutions match the criticality and confidential nature of the systemsDevelop practices and procedures to support and ensure compliance with Bridge’s ISMS PoliciesIdentify and report security concerns and incidents to management for investigation and review What We're Looking ForStrong experience in cloud infrastructure management (AWS, Open Stack based Cloud Provider)Proficient in scripting languages such as Python or Bash.Strong understanding of containerization and orchestration technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform)Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, and ElasticsearchCybersecurity awareness and training.Strong experience with understanding of firewalls, load-balancers, general networking concepts, components and processesHands-on experience with MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redis or similar servicesInfrastructure (Kubernetes, Ansible, Terraform, Docker, OpenStack);Strong experience with cloud and Linux/Unix.Strong communication and collaboration skills What You’ll LearnLearn how to design, implement, and maintain cloud infrastructure for a Gov Tech organisation.Gain experience in automating and optimising CI/CD pipelineGet a chance to work with a talented, diverse team delivering life-changing software for the NDISLearn how to troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure and application performance issuesGet a chance to work remotely in a flexible work environment Nice to HavesProven managerial skills in scaling up SaaS companies (e.g. self serving, onboarding, provisioning, automation)Experience with security best practices and compliance regulations e.g ISO27001 or ISMExperience with load balancer, DNS, and CDN servicesExperience working in a remote-friendly environmentExperience working with a Ruby on Rail stackExperience working for a highly regulated industry, GovTech, Finance, and Health.A sense of humor and a positive attitude Why Bridge? Build technology that helps people in need across multiple sectors. In the disability sector, our software helps people living with a disability manage their support plan under the NDIS (National Disability Insurance Scheme). In the employment services sector, our software is used to help unemployed people find jobs. In the future, we’re hoping to make a big impact in the aged care sector too. We’re well-funded and recently completed an IPO. Bridge is now listed on the ASX (BGE) and we are poised to accelerate our growth. Even though the economy is a bit shaky, our gov-tech business model is resistant to bumps and shocks, so our growth remains strong. Flexible and remote-friendly working. We’re moving into a brand new tech hub (with free lunch and drinks!) but offer flexible remote working. In fact, we have brilliant, talented team members from all around the world. Grow your career. We’re small, but rapidly growing and every new team member forms a key part of our DNA. You won’t be a cog in a big machine here. We’ll work on the nitty gritty together, celebrate the big wins together, and grow together. Enjoy work and have fun. We spend many hours a day together, so let’s make that time fun and enjoyable to make the most of. Our values include Respect, Reward, and Recognition -  What do people say about Bridge? You’ll never get over it - pun intended! OR Let’s build this Bridge - politely - because we’re civil engineers OR Come join us, there’s never a Bridge too far - or pun too terrible OR We’re such an awesome place to work even the Sydney Harbour Bridge was named after us. True fact.Bridge is a fun and enjoyable place to work, and our values include respect, reward, and recognition. If you are passionate about design and want to make a difference in people's lives, we want to hear from you!How to Apply We would love it if you could share something that helps us learn about you before we first meet. A webpage, GitHub profile, LinkedIn, cv. Maybe all of the above?With more information, we can be more respectful of your time and do the homework ahead of time.Please note that Bridge requires the completion of successful background and verification checks as a condition of employment.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
We’re Cowry, the digital experiences team within Australian Payments Plus. Given we’re relatively new here, let’s start by introducing ourselves. AP+ is a family of cornerstone businesses you’d know; BPAY, eftpos, NPP, and while you haven't heard of ‘Cowry’ you probably have heard of a little digital wallet with over 1.5M customers called Beem which is just one of the products powered by us.Our team love to explore new ground and challenge the status quo in the pursuit of fintech excellence. We live at the intersection of next-generation technology and traditional payments infrastructure, launching products from the ground up. Our mission is pretty simple; keep Australian payments open, keep businesses thriving and go beyond money.Role @ CowryWe’re adding a Devops Engineer to our already thriving team where you will get to make meaningful contributions to the function and the team and work closely with other engineers, QA and solution Architects.Key ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with developers to implement and maintain automated build, test, and deployment pipelinesMonitor and maintain infrastructure, including servers, storage, and networking, to ensure high availability, performance, and security.Develop and maintain automation scripts for tasks such as configuration management, monitoring, and backups.Troubleshoot issues with software applications and infrastructure and provide timely resolution.Stay current with emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices in DevOps and cloud computing.Skills, Qualifications & ExperienceKnowledge of software development principles, such as agile methodologies and version control.Knowledge of cloud computing platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.Knowledge of software development principles, such as agile methodologies and version control.Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.Strong communication and collaboration skills.Life @ CowryWe strive to create an environment where every member of the team feels empowered to make a decision for the benefit of our customers.At Cowry, a growth mindset is fundamental to success. We are obsessed with data. It’s how we learn, ask better questions and improve. It allows us to take small bets, learn quickly (often by failing) and dust ourselves off. We believe that to fully embrace experimentation and failure as part of learning, it requires a culture where everyone feels safe enough to push beyond their own fears.You’ll thrive in Cowry if:You have an agile, entrepreneurial mindset & thrive in an environment where you can reimagine your contribution each and every dayThe idea of working in a “start-up-esq” environment excites you (but you also sleep well at night knowing your job is secure)You love to test the boundaries of your abilities and champion your colleagues to do the sameYour job title is just a point of reference for your LinkedIn profile, it doesn’t define who you really areYou’re curious at heart, always asking questions and looking for ways to improveCowry may not be the place for you if:You thrive when working in a hierarchical “clunky” environmentYour job title means the world to you and defines who you areYou love to work in pre-defined silo’sTo you, team & company culture is two dimensionalWhat Next?For us, it’s more important that you are a genuinely decent human, as we believe people can pick up any skill with the right support & mindset.We consciously and intentionally hire from diverse professional and personal backgrounds. We work hard to build a wonderfully diverse team of individuals, measured not by numbers but by contribution and diversity of thinking.Submit your application for the role along with any other materials you’d want to share about yourself as a person or work you’re proud ofIf we like your vibe, you’ll get a call from our Talent rep to make sure we’re on the same page about salary and role expectationsOnce we get the admin out of the way, you’ll get a time booked in to meet the hiring manager so they can get to know you betterIf you’ve made it this far (congrats!) you’ll have a final informal chat with the head of department or CEOEither way, expect to get honest feedback from us along the way as we value it highly. The AP+ team values unique talents & we encourage applications from diverse community groups including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTIQ+, those with special needs and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Description:Experience in Devops CICD with jenkins & Python Knowledge about Continuous Integration & Continuous DeliveryExecute Docker cmds from JenkinsCreate a CI/CD Pipeline with JenkinsExecute shell cmds from Jenkins on remote serverBusiness Analysis: Undertakes analysis of user and business requirements, with particular regard to their impact on existing systems and environments, and produce an appropriate business and / or system design. Assists in the construction and implementation aspects of delivery.  Business Knowledge: Has a(deep) understanding of the business and business processes. Knows how business processes are integrated and their dependency upon/relations with ICT applications  Package Configuration: Configures additional software or sub-system components into an existing or proposed system. Complies with established processes and procedures (e.g. configuration management), taking into account the specification, capacity and compatibility of existing and new modules to ensure integrity and interoperability. Verifies system performance and ensures formal sign off and documentation of successful integration.  Testing: Analyzes business requirements, business processes, and technical architectures and designs. Uses them as the basis for the Testing solution. Defines and analyses Testing methods and advises on best fit solutions and techniques. Develops expertise in verification and validation at all stages of the delivery lifecycle. Develops expertise in Impacting and Estimation, Test Planning, Management, and Control. Speaks knowledgeably of relevant testing processes and management during client discussions.  Architecture Knowledge: Has a detailed understanding and knowledge of architecture. Understands the architecture process. Understands the role of stakeholders and requirements. Has knowledge of different methods and tools.  Technical Solution Design: Proposes technical solutions that meet or exceed client needs and expectations, and complements delivery of Capgemini’s SLAs. Synthesizes multiple requirements, ideas and solutions in order to manage complexity and deliver synergies. Articulates the proposed solution and benefits accurately and persuasively, reflecting the client’s interests or concerns. Experience and Qualifications: Minimum 4-8 years’ experience in respective domainDemonstrated understanding of underlying client or business problem and the ability to develop and support the solutions. Team leadership experience with small teamsExcellent communications skills to liaise with all levels of stakeholders. Be able to proactively work in a fast-paced environment, as a team Problem solver to help propose enterprise-wide solutions. Skills Attributes: Energy, enthusiasm, and attention to detail! A solid background as an analyst in enterprise organisations. The ability to walk into a client and confidently kick off the planning and delivery. You can capably demonstrate where you have used your initiative to help clarify and solve business problems with innovative ideas across a variety of project types and industries. Experience in Agile delivery model. Ideally you are degree qualified, enjoy learning and further enhancing your industry knowledge, and experience.  Personal Attributes: Committed to ethical practice, equity and diversity Ability to multi-task, work under pressure and to tight deadlines Excellent interpersonal, presentation, negotiation, and liaison skills Strong organisational, and planning skills Detail oriented, and diligent Entrepreneurial by nature with a strong sense of ownership. Extensive problem solving and excellent analytical skills Ability to listen and interpret requirements Customer focused, results driven Takes a proactive, self-reliant approach, identifying and seizing opportunities and taking decisive action Adjusts positively to situations that involve rapidly changing tasks, shifting priorities, simultaneous demands, or transitions into new assignments You focus on building solutions and on maintaining, optimizing and improving a client’s applications and systems. You contribute to a business and technical blueprint and customize the respective Software Package Core Module. You may also be responsible for unit testing, contribute to integration testing, and / or be responsible for the design and delivery of end-user training. Certification: Has or seeking SE level 1. Applications Consultants have expertise in a specific technology environment. They are responsible for software-specific design and realization, as well as testing, deployment and release management, or technical and functional application management of client-specific package based solutions (e.g. SAP, ORACLE). These roles also require functional and methodological capabilities in testing and training. Experience in Devops Cicid with Jenkins and python Knowledgeabout Continuous Integration & Continuous DeliveryExecute Docker cmds from JenkinsCreate a CI/CD Pipeline with JenkinsExecute shell cmds from Jenkins on remote server

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Company DescriptionAbout UsWe bring together science, engineering and technology to deliver smart solutions to our Government customers’ most complex problems – innovative, technically advanced and highly practical. For example, we deliver software applications for a wide range of missions in the Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance domain. We provide critical projects to the Department of Defence and also support the IT environment for the Australian Taxation Office. We also maintain legislative websites for a number of Governments.Job DescriptionYour New RoleYou will work with a team of DevOps Administrators to rapidly build and deploy enhancements to a DevSecOps Platform, while simultaneously supporting it. The development will take place in an iterative fashion using agile methodologies with inputs from multiple stakeholders.Primary Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited ToDevelops solutions to technical problems that require depth of technical knowledge, but are typically limited in complexityAddresses complex technical issues/problems using internal best practice and through collaboration with colleaguesExplains technical solutions, practices and procedures to others within the organisationWork with the Systems Engineering team designing, building, and supporting new Infrastructure technologies and services, with a focus towards automationImplement build and deploy workflow automation to support continuous integration and deploymentProvides support to DevSecOps Platform by following best practicesAssist in the development of routine reporting and development of ad-hoc reportsRun, maintain and upgrade different Product environments (Development, Test, Production)Provide security techniques and expertise to ensure the infrastructure and software services meet specific security standards.Please note the successful applicant must be an Australian citizen and hold a NV-1 or NV-2 level Australian Government Security Clearance.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringRequiredCoupled with your education and practical experience, you will demonstrate a pro-active approach with the ability to understand the business, identify issues and develop relationships to achieve the company’s objectives. You will also have:Demonstrated proficiency in Red Hat Linux and Windows Server Operating SystemsExperience deploying and maintaining a DevSecOps platformContainerised application deployment experienceStrong stakeholder management skillsSoftware development lifecycle knowledgeInfrastructure as Code experienceTroubleshooting and Coordinating skills to resolve identified issuesStrong team focus and willingness to learn new technologiesKnowledge in Incident and Change Management processDesirableDemonstrated proficiency in using Ansible for automationKubernetes cluster administration experienceExperience with source code and artefact managementExperience in administrating Elasticsearch clustersDemonstrated experience building Kibana visualizations and dashboardsAdditional InformationWhat You'll LoveAt Leidos we look after our staff. Flexible working practices, great team building initiatives, consistent learning and development opportunities, employee discounts and excellent exposure to a variety of technologies and projects are just some of the perks. We are growing and evolving, so it’s an exciting place to be.Our diverse employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Leidos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Company Description (About us)Fortiro is a growing fintech with a highly experienced team, backed by significant investment, and giving you the opportunity to create something great! Contribute to a platform that uses emerging technologies and AI to help prevent financial crime and enable automation – used by leading Banks and Government in Australia, New Zealand and (eventually) the globe!Our software product can be licensed as Software-as-a-Service and is at the forefront of next-generation document fraud detection and automation.About youYou are passionate about cloud and security, with cutting edge, hands-on technical skills and an unwavering commitment to quality.You also have2+ years experience in a DevOps Engineer role with a good record of hands-on accomplishments across the various areas of responsibilities outlined below.Experience working in a fully agile development environment, including good grasp of the common tools and ways of working including software release management via CI/CD pipelines and source repository management.A passion for DevOps processes and AWS Cloud services related to system administration, such as provisioning and managing servers, deploying databases, security monitoring, system patching, event logging and monitoring, and managing VPCs, security groups, firewall policies, etc.Qualifications or training in network and application security and/or a good understanding in best practice security frameworks (e.g. NIST, ISO27001, etc.)Understanding of reliability engineering, capacity planning, performance monitoring and load testing to ensure the availability of our SaaS solution and performance at scale. Hands-on experience working with Java and Python.In-depth understanding of microservice architecture, API management, distributed systems concepts and containerisation. Worked with tools such as Azure DevOps, AWS EC2, RDS, ECS, ELB, Route 53, S3, Step Functions, Lambdas, Cloudwatch and CloudFormation. Responsibilities – you will... Deliver sprint-based projects as part of a talented team of engineers using Agile and DevOps methodologies. Drive automation, standardisation and quality in delivery. Work closely with and incorporate feedback from product management, architects, system engineers, test engineers and customer success. Our expectation for a successful DevOps Engineer: Demonstrating passion and interest in our product and how our customers use it to solve their problems. Anticipating and resolving challenges by engaging with relevant team members to get input, and then making the necessary decisions to move forward with a sound resolution. Communicating with transparency, clarity, trust and honesty to manage and motivate junior developers, while managing expectations of the Head of Engineering, Product Manager and leadership team.  What we offer – and how we help you reach your best potential We encourage you to be you. We constantly seek and value different perspectives to ensure Fortiro is a place where everyone feels comfortable and can be successful. Our long-term employee retention rate agrees! We know that our people are the key to our success, so we empower everyone to make an impact. You will have the opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact to our top tier enterprise and government customers with the best fraud detection solution for financial documents in the world. You’ll be working in a young and growing business that is a spin-off from Australia’s largest professional services firm. So you’ll get to experience the best of both “corporate” and “start-up” worlds: professional ways of working with best-in-class tools and processes – just faster and more agile with flat decision-making hierarchies.  Our culture is a key cornerstone of our workplace - we’re open, inclusive, embrace differences and love to have fun. We offer flexible work options with both remote and in-person work environments.  Your salary will be competitive based on your experience, with defined career progression opportunities, learning & development, formal check-ins and annual plans to ensure you continue to grow and develop your skills and progress your career.

title: Product Manager at Fast Growing Start Up
description:
About UsBluethumb exist to connect art creators and collectors across the world. We're Australia's largest online art marketplace and one of Australia's most successful creative technology companies.We represent over 20,000 emerging and established artists from across Australia. With over 50,000 artworks sold, we have a fast-growing reputation for outstanding quality of service to homeowners across the country; from first-time buyers to collectors, as well as interior designers and architecture firms.Bluethumb envisions a world where creating and collecting art is open to all, we're now in our 10th year but that isn’t slowing us down! On average we’ve doubled in size every year for 10 years straight. Along the way we’ve helped more artists on their path to a sustainable career and sold more original artworks on the primary market than any other organisation in Australia’s history.The opportunityThis is an incredible opportunity for a product specialist to work in a high growth creative technology company. Our total team size has recently doubled to over 30 and we have an awesome pipeline of growth projects ahead. We want someone who can work alongside the Founders and CTO to build Bluethumb into the best online art platform in the world. We have succeeded so far by focusing on creating better technology for users. This won't change. Our next years are expanding our core market whilst launching expanding overseas. We will also enter the Secondary Art market and continue building out our NFT marketplace.RequirementsWhat You'll DoBe a staunch advocate for our users; our artists and art collectors. Speak up for the user at every point, dive deep on how they use Bluethumb, distill feature requests through a user-focussed lens. Alongside the CTO, help run the product team sprints. We currently have five full stack developers, a QA and a visual designer. We plan 3 week development sprints, with a code freeze week. Part of the role is roadmap planning ahead of each sprint to work out what we build next, and short retros afterwards. Manage and own the development board. This role is an intentional product team bottleneck. All new bugs, feature suggestions and epics are written into cards by the Product Owner. Ruthlessly prioritise what gets built and what doesn't. Wireframes are a bonus for briefing our designer, but not a must-have. Bring new product ideas to the team. Who We Are Looking ForA technology enthusiast. Someone who's curious about what's new. Minimum of 2 years experience in a product specialist/product owner-type role, building technology. A degree in Computer Science or similar. Someone with a growth mindset, motivated work ethic and accountability. An interest in design or art is a bonus. Our CultureWhy you might love working at Bluethumb: We always hire the best possible person we can for the job. This has meant great diversity and a talented group of people. We are mission driven. We exist to grow Australia’s art industry and help artists build a sustainable living. There’s high autonomy and licence to get the job done the best way possible. You appreciate receiving feedback, tough feedback more than praise.You want to get your hands dirty and would happily do a round of user testing with our customers and target market. You are happy to work from home or with team members. We’re a distributed startup and this means using many channels of communication. Why working at Bluethumb might not work for you:We’re startup / scale up and there is a lot going on. You’ll need to keep the core business on track, deal with unexpected growth problems whilst concurrently launching new projects. You need to speak up to be heard. People are in different positions and places and you’ll need to be confident and a strong communicator.You’ll need to process a lot of information and be driven to quickly learn this and help us expand. We put ourselves in situations where failing publicly is a possibility. We understand this is life at Bluethumb and work as hard as possible to succeed, and when there’s failure we learn from the experience and pick ourselves back up to charge on.BenefitsYou’ll receive a competitive salary with the potential to qualify for ESOP (employee share option plan).If you are Melbourne or Adelaide based, we have amazing gallery & office spaces which are Dog-friendly. We are a distributed company with a great balance between WFH and office life. You get 4 weeks paid vacation, flexibility to take extra unpaid leave, and flexible working hours. We’re all about getting the work done, not just clocking time.Staff discounts on Australia’s best art! Fun team activities, lunches and projects. We're excited and grateful for your interest and application. This role is life-changing because we do things that have a huge impact both personally and for Australia's art industry. Strap in and enjoy the ride!

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
We’re Slyp. And we’re on a mission to eliminate paper receipts for good. Founded by former PayPal executives in 2017 and now backed by the four major banks, Slyp is an award-winning retail-fintech transforming the world of receipts.In Australia alone, we are printing over 1 billion meters of non-recyclable paper receipts each year. But this is just the start of the problem – we believe receipts are also a missed opportunity to understand and engage shoppers’ post-purchase.Slyp automatically delivers a revolutionary smart receipt right inside your banking app to create a seamless customer experience. With Slyp, customers pay as normal and can immediately view and interact with their smart receipts in their mobile banking app, anytime.Our values (‘the Slyp six’) form the heart of everything we do and are apart of why Slyp is an award-winning Fintech backed by all four major banks.This is your chance to join as we shape the future of customer experience.PositionAs a Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for shaping, driving and executing on the product, working across consumer, merchant and bank experiences. You will interact with our customers to understand their needs, and partner with our internal stakeholders to articulate or identify opportunities for growth.Your ability to balance strategic thinking, stakeholder requirements and execution will be critical to success. You will be working in an agile environment with cross functional teams including sales, marketing, data, design and an exceptional engineering team to build large product initiatives from concept to delivery.We are looking for a passionate person with experience in taking complex and differentiated solutions to market in user centric products.What You Will Be Doing …Develop and deliver on product roadmaps that align with Slyp’s vision, product strategy and commercial targetsUnderstand customer needs through research, market analysis, data, and customer feedbackTranslate requirements into product specificationsPrioritise and coordinate delivery schedules and ensure consensusScope and manage planned, existing or ongoing major and minor product releasesCoordinate with internal teams to produce marketing materials that speak to Slyp’s unique product experiencesProvide support to the Sales/Business Development teams to respond to product-related feedback and improvement requestsBe responsible for engaging and delivering with our high performing Engineering teamRequirementsYour experience and knowledge …A minimum of 5+ years’ experience in product leadership, including experience in either B2BC or B2B SaaS Experience leading a diverse team in the Fintech space, including Designers and EngineersStrong communication skills and public speaker, with an ability to negotiate and engage diverse internal and external stakeholdersProven ability to manage changing priorities and working in a fast-paced growth environmentDemonstrated ability working with agile methodologies, requirements gathering, prioritisation, identifying and addressing constraints, dependencies and risksAn ability to balance customer satisfaction as well as commercial outcomeYou use analytics and data-driven measurement to inform decision makingYou are customer driven and have a passion for speaking directly to customersHighly desirable that you have experience in delivering data and insights-based productsProven experience working with new products or new categories and have had exposure to loyalty, payments, data, e-commerce or a unique combination of theseBenefitsCompetitive salary + equityWellbeing perksGenerous L&D programFlexible work life balance: work from our Sydney office, from home, or from anywhere (for a time)Regular team lunches and give back days (Slyp Gives)Sweet (pet friendly) officeAlways-on team fun

title: Product Manager
location: Surry Hills, New South Wales, Australia
description:
This is your chance to join a dynamic, collaborative team within one of Australia’s most innovative digital retail businesses. In this role you will be leading the development of our core customer products, including our ecommerce and mobile app platforms, as well as evaluating expansion opportunities across our interactions with our customers and vendor partners.You will be responsible for managing the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to launch, and will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, CX, marketing and operations, to ensure successful product delivery.ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and execute product strategy and roadmap in collaboration with cross-functional teams. Engage regularly with internal stakeholders, and conduct external research / analyse customer feedback to prioritise product opportunities.Translate captured requirements and feature requests into user stories.Work with design and engineering teams (both internal & external) to develop and launch new products and features.Define and track product metrics and KPIs, and use data to make informed decisions.Work with our marketing and operations teams to ensure successful product launches and ongoing product support.Use appropriate tools to manage the product discovery process through to execution.QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCEExperience in similar roles within a B2C e-Commerce environment.Experience with loyalty retention and multi-channel offerings desirable.Experience in creating digital experience and product strategies.Previous experience with e-Commerce development lifecycle.Comprehensive experience with collaboration and management tools such as Jira and Confluence.An entrepreneurial mindset is critical to succeed in this role. You are someone who is passionate about delivering great customer experiences, and you are an expert at communicating that with key stakeholders. You are someone who lives and breathes strategic thinking and are excited about transforming businesses to maximise the customer experience.WHAT WE OFFERStaff discount on the best and largest wine range in Australia. Opportunity to build a long-term career with strong support for continuous learning and professional development.Supportive and collaborative working environment with a team of like-minded individuals.We are remote first, so you can be anywhere in Australia.ABOUT USFor more than 75 years, we have pioneered, innovated and supported the Australian wine industry, connecting the world’s greatest winemakers with our customers' hearts and minds. With Australia’s largest range of wines, we showcase smaller independent producers and their stories by embracing leading digital technologies to create design solutions delivering new engaging content for our customers.

title: Product Manager (startups)
description:
Are you passionate about startups and entrepreneurship?We are seeking a passionate and results driven Product Manager to join the team in our Melbourne office.The ideal candidate is someone who’s worked the startup ecosystem before and loves working with others to creatively solve problems. You have an eye for design, love the freedom to work autonomously and the courage to push for the best outcome possible. Change is a natural part of your process and don’t mind taking risks to push the bar higher. You have a passion for technologyThe RoleYou’ll be working with 15 - 20 founders by taking them through our 3 month startup incubation program to help them get their idea off the ground. You’ll be actively involved in understanding the founder’s problem and working with the team on the best way to solve it. You’ll then manage the creation of the assets needed to validate the business and put them in the best position to raise the money needed to execute it correctly.You’ll be in control of the entire process and will get the chance to work on incredible ideas, quality founders and learn from our award winning team.You will have six main focuses:-Onboard new founders and provide an incredible experience with our brand.-Workshop the founder’s strategy with our team and pitch any pivots.-Manage the MVP product lifecycle of deliverables from concept, to designs and prototype-Develop the core positioning and messaging for the product.-Own the product strategy of each founders product idea-Work with our other product managers to continually improve our process.Skills, Knowledge and Experience-Familiarity with the Australian startup landscape.-Background with product discovery methodologies-Can easily build rapport and trust with a wide range of personalities.-Expert communicator, both visually, verbally and written.-Strong problem solving, analytical skills, and strategic thinking whilst continuing to see the big picture.-Experience in using data to make decisions.-Understands great design and knows how to motivate a team to produce quality work.-Experience working with designers, strategists, developers and business development.-A perfectionist for all of the things that matter (design, layout, formatting, spelling)-Knows how to take ownership of your projects to produce excellent results.-Can organise people, meetings and documents for a large number of projects.-Work with others on a shared resource pool to manage multiple priorities.-Motivated about learning, excited about the industry and quick to pick up new skills.-Demonstrated ability to be flexible and adaptable in the face of changing organisational priorities and ambiguous environments whilst continuing a strong focus on quality of work.BenefitsAnd let’s not forget the important part, what’s in it for you:-Connect with new tech founders, ideas and technologies before they become the next big thing-Opportunity to upskill and continuously learn in the role-Have a direct impact on the execution and direction of new startups-Build an incredible network within the Australian Startup ecosystem-Regular team outings and (hopefully) trips abroad-A competitive base rate, with a performance bonus-Clear career progression opportunity in the Product Management Team-A fun working environment!About HyperHyper is a global startup studio that provides you with the safest way to launch your startup. We believe that every idea should have the best possible chance of success. Guiding founders to validate, build and grow their technology businesses from ideation to investment. We’re your unfair advantage.900+ Founders & $300 Million raised to date.

title: Product Owner/Associate Product Manager
description:
About BountyMediaBountyMedia is a leading B2B2C AdTech SaaS platform. It is a unique GDPR compliant and globally scaled consent based customer acquisition model. We are a unique Zero Party Data platform working with leading Publishers and Advertisers globally in every media (Film, TV, News and Games) on a new platform. Venture funded. Headquartered in Singapore, operating remotely globally. Team are based in Bangkok, Singapore and Australia.Building a winning SaaS product team.The successful applicant for this role will be a key member of our product and technology team. As a start-up that is growing fast into global markets with leading corporate partners, the product development team at BountyMedia will be the driver for the success of our flagship product in the AdTech & Data space.Reporting to the Head of Product, this role will work alongside peer full-stack and front-end developers (in-house and external) as well as our DevOps, Infrastructure and UI/UX teams.The RoleThis is a full--time role that will be involved in several exciting projects and feature ownership and developments. As we’re a startup, our features and the nature of each project are widely varied - there’s nothing “normal” about any given week at BountyMedia! However, here are some of the things you would be working on regularly:Hands-on backlog and sprint management, making sure the backlog is well maintained and groomed based on broader product strategies and in collaboration with internal and external engineering teams.Being a story-teller, with high attention to details and can reflect those into well-defined, testable and deliverable user stories, epics and features.Being involved in Product Design /workflow design ensuring that our products remain cohesive, usable, and align with our overarching business and product strategy;Providing support and guidance to your peers - exemplifying best practice, processes and teamwork.Working alongside the Product leadership team and the management team exploring opportunities to improve on the product.Your main responsibilitiesPlanningParticipate in product planning, working with Head of Product to identify new opportunities to improve the product and commenting on feasibilityGuide the delivery of a product roadmap.Contribute to the development of Initiative summaries.Maintaining a prioritized backlog.Product DesignParticipate in product design activities such as discovery workshops and collaborative design sessions to identify new features or opportunities to improve the product and deliver customer valueActively participate in initiative processes such as initiative kick-off and epic kick-off sessions.Support the engineering and design teams in the translation of market and user requirements into exciting customer experiences.Document product requirements and design outcomes.Product DeliveryAct as the voice of the customer in the product delivery process.Participating in product delivery rituals such as initiative planning; sprint planning, showcases and retrospectives.Collaborating with team members on defining the narrative/context for deliverablesReview proposed requirements, and ensure that delivery is matches acceptance criteriaAssist in the prompt resolution of delivery risks.Escalating issues and impacts to the delivery to the management team.Determining whether the feature is complete based on the team’s definition of ‘Done’.Product LaunchEnsure all product documentation is current and accurate.Work with marketing to co-ordinate the internal launch of new features including running webinars and product showcases.What you’ll need for success.A minimum of 2 years’ proven product management or product ownership experience. Ideally in a SaaS and technology environment.A passion for delivering exceptional value to the partners and customers.Experience working in a similar role, where you have to take the ownership of multiple product streams.Experience in a product company or start-up, with extra credit for exposure to the AdTech or Data sector.Experience in working on browser-based web applications, working closely with UX/UI designers and engineering teams.Understanding of product management concepts and the product lifecycle from concept to launch in a commercial and sales-led environment.Good understanding of the role of the product owner in an agile development environment.Proven ability to learn new business concepts and translate this knowledge into new products and features.Degree in business; computing; design or marketing is looked on favorably, but not essential.The way we work and collaborateWe are a remote workplace, so you will be working from your home during your normal working hours. With teams spread across Australia, Thailand and Singapore, you will be working with different time zones and might be required to adjust your time occasionally so we can collaborate in a more effective and productive way.We are building a team of solid product and technology experts who can take the ownership of the project and task they do and defend it with having the user and customer in mind. You will have the opportunity to bring new ideas to the team, the way we work and to the product as well as helping the broader BountyMedia team to grow our existing products and platforms.Diversity means success.We welcome everybody to contribute to our success, regardless of identity, background, position, ability or lifestyle.A note on eligibility to applyIn order to apply for this position, you must have a valid working right in the country of the position. Unfortunately we will not be able to provide you with sponsorship or job application at this stage.

title: Product Manager
description:
PSG® is a global pump and dispensing solution expert and leading manufacturer of pumps, systems and related flow-control technology for the safe and efficient transfer of critical and valuable fluids and materials. Headquartered in Oakbrook Terrace, IL, USA, PSG is comprised of several world-class brands, including Abaque™, All-Flo, Almatec®, Blackmer®, Ebsray®, em-tec™, EnviroGear®, Griswold®, Hydro™, Malema™, Mouvex®, Neptune™, Quattroflow™ and Wilden®. PSG products are manufactured on three continents, North America, Europe, and Asia, in state-of-the-art facilities that practice lean manufacturing and are ISO-certified. PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of Dover Corporation. For additional information on PSG, please visit psgdover.com.We thrive on winning and being number one; and are always looking to add the best and brightest to our talented team of professionals. PSG offers a unique combination of the both small company atmosphere: with an ownership mindset that allows you to make close-to-the-customer decisions; an innovative approach in seeing beyond what is possible today and entrepreneurial spirit in the pursuit of new opportunities; combined with benefits of a large company’s scale, tools, expertise, and financial strength with Dover. Join PSG, a growing global company where your curiosity, hard work and ambition is rewarded with exceptional career opportunities in a friendly & fast paced environment.PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of the Dover Corporation® (NYSE: DOV). Dover is a diversified global manufacturer and solutions provider with annual revenue of approximately $7 billion. We deliver innovative equipment and components, consumable supplies, aftermarket parts, software and digital solutions, and support services through five operating segments. Recognized for our entrepreneurial approach for over 60 years, our team of over 23,000 employees takes an ownership mindset, collaborating with customers to redefine what's possible.Position Summary:The purpose of this role is to achieve sustained growth and profitability in the country for the following brands of our pumps and compressors’ portfolio: Abaque™, Blackmer®, Mouvex® and Wilden®. The Product Manager will report to the Business Development Director and will work closely with the Sales Managers acting as a proactive member of the sales force. The success in this role requires a comprehensive understanding of the market and customer needs, combined with a strong knowledge of the features, functions and benefits of the assigned product lines.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Product strategy Act as an ambassador and a proactive member of the sales team by identifying new business opportunities in your assigned region (Australia and New Zealand). Gather and analyze the market, customer, and competitor intelligence to identify and quantify opportunities for growth in new geographical areas or new industries. Conduct market research through trade associations, internet investigation and corporate services Identify, understand and communicate market trends and requirements Gather the voice of customers & insights of key stakeholders Investigate market needs for innovative products and communicate them to Product Management as opportunities for product development Develop and maintain comprehensive knowledge of competitive products and their activity in the marketplace and provide reports, on a regular basisCommercial and Technical Support Providing guidance to the sales team and channel partners for selection, configuration, and quotation of products Provide support in marketing activities such as: creation of market literature, preparing for and supporting trade shows, industry events and PSG product training and customer events Providing technical support and troubleshooting for channel partners and end users Reviews engineering specifications and generates proposals Management of specific channel partners as may be required Proficient in company processes and policies pertaining to roleProduct knowledge Knowledge of the assigned products in detail including the operating principles and performance characteristics Conduct training of internal team members, channel partners, and other industry participants, such as EPCs, consultants, and end users Lead technical training about product selection, performance, and troubleshooting Other duties as assigned.Qualifications / Requirements:University degree (or equivalent) in a technical field (mechanical or chemical engineering or related) You have at least 5 years of professional experience in the product management, sales or account management of technical products Previous experience in related industry (pumps, valves, system design, rotating equipment, gearboxes, etc.). Ability to analyze a mechanical system and provide technical guidance for operation and troubleshooting.Proficient with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint.Desired Characteristics:Highly organized and efficient in approaching tasks.Ability to professionally interact with customers on technical topics.Ability to select a pump and/or accessories based on application requirements.A self-starter with the ability to problem solve and anticipate and avoid issues.Clear, concise, and articulate communication skills - verbal, written and listening.Strong team player, work ethic and commitment to win.Work Arrangement : HybridSalary Range : -We consider several job-related, non-discriminatory factors when determining the pay rate for a position, including, but not limited to, the position’s responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, a candidate’s education/training, the position’s location, and the key skills needed for the position. Pay is one of the Total Rewards that we provide to compensate and recognize employees for their work.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, genetic information, or any other factors prohibited by law.This position may be located in: APAC : Australia : New South Wales : SydneySub Division : EbsrayJob Requisition ID : 48455
