title: Product Manager
location: Taren Point, New South Wales, Australia
description:
For over 100 years, Shimano has concentrated on precision engineering, innovative merchandise and been a proven market leader in the supply of cycling and fishing products worldwide. As a business we are always looking to improve, create, innovate and resonate not only with our customers but with our internal teams. We are currently recruiting for an experienced Product Manager to join our Shimano Australia Fishing division on a permanent full-time basis. The primary duties will include but are not limited to;·        Maintain relationships and processes with manufacturers and Shimano Incorporated (SIC) to ensure compliance with Shimano vendor systems. ·        Manage all aspects of Product life cycle from market research to product inception to fulfill market needs and overall business objectives.·        Maintain product spec sheets. ·        Manage the sample process and report to SIC Planning and factories. ·        Design and develop new ranges with market trends and needs in mind to meet the market. ·        Monitor and report on stock levels and inventory to ensure company targets and metrics are met. ·        Report and suggest exit strategy for end-of-life products. ·        Manage pricing of products to ensure they meet the market·        Research and Identify trends in the market and propose proactive product strategies. ·        Work to increase market share in all categories Ideally candidates will need to possess:·        5 years’ experience in a similar role ·        Be highly proficient in the use of Excel, PowerPoint and Word ·        High levels of commercial and numeracy skills ·        Analytically minded ·        Excellent communication and presentation skills. ·        Pronto ERP·        Strong fishing / industry knowledge (preferred) This position is an office-based role situated in our Head Office in Caringbah. The successful candidate will need the preparedness to travel domestically and internationally, on average 6 trips per year. This position would suit an individual who is familiar with the fishing and outdoor industry, but the role is not limited to industry experience. Applications are to include a covering letter outlining your suitability to this role, noting your salary expectations, and attaching your updated resume.   Only applicants with full Australian working rights will be considered. An offer of employment is conditional upon the applicant being fully vaccinated against COVID19. Proof of vaccination status is required at the time of accepting the employment offer.   In return Shimano Australia Fishing will provide ongoing training, onsite free parking, social activities, access to EAP programs, and regular community events. Interviews may commence prior to the closing date, Thursday 30th March 2023. The vacancy will remain open until the successful candidate is appointed. To apply, go to https://shimanoaustralia.bamboohr.com/careers

description:

free on-site gymHybrid work arrangementsSecond-to-none onboard trainingGround-breaking parental leave entitlementsFun team camaraderie and eventsCasual dressOpportunities for growth and developmentWho title: Technical BA / Product Manager
description:
Join Simple Machines and be part of our mission to help clients unlock the full potential of their data through the creation of cutting-edge business driven data platforms and software solutions. As we continue to expand our team across Australia and New Zealand, we are seeking Technical BA / Product Manager who are unafraid to challenge the status quo and push boundaries.About YouWe are looking for a consultant-minded individual who is passionate about working closely with clients to solve complex problems and lead them on a journey from discovery to technical implementation. You have a knack for understanding client needs and delivering market-leading solutions.Have a background in Business Analysis | Technology Consulting | Software DevelopmentYou will love and excel in this role if you:Have a refined understanding of how modern software is built and delivered (tools, methodologies, roles, common challenges etc.)A demonstrated knowledge of different methods and tools that help you to perform analysis, testing, product management and delivery in a range of environmentKnow how to effectively communicate information between people at all levels of the business, in written and verbal formHave a passion for accruing knowledge, and using that knowledge to continuously improve yourself and the team’s performancePersonal interest in best practice and trends of the technology industry, with the ability to apply these to your day-to-day workA relationship builder by nature, and someone who can thrive in new teams and new situationsA proactive person who knows what needs to be done, how to approach it, and how to influence others to move things forwardAn ambitious person who is excited about the prospect of joining a small, close-knit ANZ team of experts and helping it to growThe Exciting PartSimple Machines is not your average consultancy or software engineering firm. Our team is comprised of inspiring technical leaders in Data Engineering, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. Our projects are data-focused and drive impactful business outcomes.RequirementsAbout the RoleWe are looking for someone to join our close-knit team of experts in the UK to help deliver our client engagements as we scale our ANZ business.If you excel in client facing roles, have a deep understanding of how modern software is built and delivered, and have a passion for technology then we’d love to hear from you.Here’s a brief overview of the role’s responsibilities:Feed the engineering teamProvide high quality written requirements, acceptance criteria, feature overviews, test cases and other artefacts for the team to work fromRun effective meetings with team and stakeholdersDrive the team’s directionUnderstand and clearly articulate the business needsPersuade the client and the SM team on what should be done and whyIncrease the team’s speedUnderstand and anticipate dependencies in software deliveryEnable decision making through excellent communicationAssure the team’s focusProtect the engineering team from day to day ‘noise’Embed and optimise processes to handle our scope of work and new demandAssure SM’s position with the clientBuild and nurture relationships with clients at all levelsHelp to manage SM’s delivery riskBenefitsWorking at Simple MachinesWe’re looking for someone who’s as passionate as we are about building a world-class technology company specialising in engineering for data.Just some of the benefits of working with Simple Machines include:Flexible working: Want to work from home or leave early to pick up the kids? Need to start early some days, later on others? No problem!Generous parental leave: Three months’ fully paid primary carer leave and one month fully paid secondary carer leave, subject to a minimum 12 month tenureLearning and development: We all love continually learning and have a generous budget for you to upskill, join conferences, get certified and qualifiedLunch is on us. Always! We happily supply lunch at each of our office locations every Monday, Wednesday and Friday.

title: Product Manager
description:
It has never been a more exciting time to join the digitsation and decarbonization of the electricity industry. Clipsal Solar’s mission is to revolutionise the new energy landscape by digitising and creating brilliant experiences for customers globally. We have global intentions being backed by one of the world’s biggest energy management and technology automation companies, Schneider Electric Ventures. Over the past 12 months we have experienced tremendous growth and now we are looking for an experienced Product Manager to support our product team who has a passion for building highly engaging products at scale and launching them into new markets. We’re looking for a strategic thinker who is driven to achieve and can manage a portfolio of products powered by the Clipsal Cortex platform.•	The Clipsal Cortex app has won a Gold Good Design Award 2021 •	Strong Australian customer base with North American launch imminent •	Relentless customer experience and data visualisation focus•	Data science driven culture •	Start-up backed by global energy and tech company•	Awesome team, flexible work hoursAbout the RoleThis is a full-time, permanent position and will be either based in Sydney CBD or remote.Our product vision is to help empower customers to make better energy choices. We are looking for a Product manager who will report to the Head of Product. As a Product Manager, you will own a portfolio of products and define the roadmap and ship great features that drive engagement and retention. We’re looking for a creative thinker with a can do attitude. We offer a fast-paced and entrepreneurial work environment that rewards a relentless focus on quality and customer experience.Key Responsibilities•	Define and execute the product strategy and positioning for a portfolio of software products•	Be the voice of customer in the strategic and tactical decisions•	Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, software engineers and customers to build products which will lead to customer success and delight•	Responsible for the entire product lifecycle from concept through to validation, build, post-launch analytics and iterations•	Create product artefacts such as product strategy, roadmaps, customer experience maps and user journeys•	Proactively identify design problems and devise simple, intuitive solutions and iterate rapidly•	Track product metrics and reports to track success•	Conduct research, design, and user testing activities during the life cycle of a project•	Engage with internal and external stakeholders and users to synthesise feedback and translate them into insights for product iterations and new feature development.•	Take smart risks and evangelize new ideas.•	Stay abreast of the latest industry insights, tools and trends.Qualifications and Requirements•	Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in product management.•	Demonstrated experience with product management of business to consumer related software products and service (essential)•	Demonstrated experience with end-to-end software product lifecycle (concept to market roll out).•	Understands SaaS metrics and product-led growth principles and gets excited about diving into the data to unearth new growth opportunities.•	Excellent customer intuition; demonstrated success in creating beautifully simple, user-friendly products.•	Exceptional communication skills to liaise with internal and external stakeholders. •	Strong bias for action; ability to juggle multiple priorities and effectively deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.•	Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations and drive actions•	Experience planning and facilitating customer interviews, focus groups and other research to gather insights used to inform, frame and execute products.•	Strong understanding of product design thinking and UX research methodologies.•	Excellent skills with relevant software including but not limited to Google Analytics, Figma, Miro, Maze, Jira, Confluence, LogRocket etc.•	Ability to work in an agile environment, part of a multi-disciplinary team.•	Comfortable and confident in managing stakeholders’ expectations.•	Passion for learning and innovation, balanced with business needs and customer expectations.•	Experience in a startup environment.•	Experience in renewables industry (solar, energy storage, home energy management etc) is a plus.

A strong understanding of garment construction and capabilities is advantageous in this role.This role is based in sunny Sydney, Australia with a pet friendly office and offers a competitive salary and relocation package.Main responsibilities will include:Ensuring product aligns with business strategy and direction.Working closely with the General Manager on end-to-end design and production.Overseeing the production costing process, negotiating pricing with suppliers and manufacturers.Forecasting market trends by analysing consumer buying patterns, competitor pricing, researching and staying up-to-date with fast fashion trends.Effectively running fit sessions ensuring accurate and consistent fit of all garments.Liaising with the Creative Team to maintain consistent branding across product and marketing collateral.Managing the product team, providing leadership and guidance.Reviewing and updating processes with our manufacturers to achieve maximum efficiency.Building strong working relationships with all key stakeholders.Person Specifications:5+ years experience working across product, production, buying or technology.A team player with a positive and proactive attitude.Proven experience managing a team of Buyers, Designers and Garment TechsStrong understanding of the buying and design/production processes as well as procurement/supply chain function.Self-motivated and results-oriented.The ability to commercially interpret trends for the fast fashion customer.An innovator who knows which trends to start and which to follow.Self-motivated and results-oriented.

title: Product Manager
description:
Product Manager – Scientific DivisionLocated either: SYDNEY – MELBOURNE  ·        Life Science Industry·        International leading product portfolio·        Career OpportunityIn Vitro Technologies are the premier supplier for cell biology and translational research throughout Australia and New Zealand. We offer a range of consumables & reagents as well as core facility & specialised equipment (cell analysis & bioprocess) for our life science customers’ workflow in academic research, translational research, biotechnology and manufacturing. We specialise in application areas of Cancer, Neuroscience, Immunology, Cell & Gene therapy, and Bioprocess, amongst others.As a result of emerging opportunities in the scientific market segment, we are seeking to appoint additional full-time Product Managers to join our marketing team.Reporting to the Scientific Marketing Manager you will be responsible for defining and implementing key sales marketing initiatives to drive the profitability and sales of a portfolio of products as assigned. Responsibilities encompass the Australian and New Zealand markets. To be successful, you MUST have a minimum of 3-5 years of sales experience and previous product management experience is favoured. A scientific background preferably in the Life Science, Industrial Science and Biotechnology market segments is highly desirable. You will have excellent communication and presentation skills, be self-motivated and confident with the ability to close a sale. Preference will be given to candidates with local customer knowledge. Required skills & qualifications·        Post-graduate qualification in Life Science ·        Research experience in Life Sciences, preferably in Cell Biology, Immunology, and/or Translational Research·        Min 3+ years’ experience in Life Science sales·        Outstanding communication, scientific presentation and business development skills·        Strong work ethic, self-motivated, confident and engaging·        Knowledge of the life science and biotechnology landscape in Australia and New Zealand·        Commercial acumen: ability to identify and pursue commercial opportunities; providing solutions to meet customer needs·        High energy, self-motivation and ability to work autonomouslyBenefits·        Salary and incentives commensurate with your experience·        Car Allowance·        National Sales conference & team building activities·        ANZ travel ·        Training on new scientific technologies and products·        Professional development opportunities to enhance and broaden skill sets·        Laptop & Phone·        Free ParkingThe Scientific Unit at In Vitro Technologies includes a dynamic sales and marketing team who support a vision to serve the Australian and New Zealand life science market. We are committed to developing new staff in our team-based environment by providing support, guidance and on-going product and sales training to advance the skill set and capabilities of our team.Please forward your Application Cover Letter and CV by 20th March 2023 to:Dr Mala Reddy, Divisional Manager - ScientificEmail: mala.reddy@invitro.com.auView the Careers page on our website to learn more about our team: https://lifescience.invitro.com.au/l/careers

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Product ManagerAre you looking for your next role in product management? Do you want to work for a company helping the environment? Do you want to be under the leadership of somebody who has worked at the likes of Apple, Google & Canva? Do you want to be helping to build products that make a significant positive impact to the lives of millions of Australians? If the answer is yes, then read on! If the answer is no, then read on anyway because It took me a while to write this! About the CompanyThey are redefining the transaction process to improve both the customer experience and the Retailer's & Bank's ability to harness the data digitally, building customer profiles. If this wasn't enough, they are also eliminating redundant paper receipts, saving the environment in the process (1 billion metres per year....) They are partnered with the largest banks & largest retailers in Australia, who are already implementing their technology & are paving the way for mass adoption across the entire country. Despite making huge waves over the past 6 years, they are still relatively small given their impact, meaning they remain agile, tight-knit & all pulling in the same direction. This year will see significant growth across Engineering & Product. This is your chance to become a significant part of a platform that will change how consumers transact forever. A bit about the role...This is a mature fintech scaleup with plenty of runway & established bluechip clientele Act as the senior product owner to cross- functional squads and closely partner with the Tech & design management Develop an in-depth understanding of the product and domain to act as the subject matter expert for the squadManage backlog for your squad, define and document product requirements (Epics, User stories and Acceptance criteria) and review features before they go to productionMake real-time decisions / prioritizations for your squad based on effort and impact through the build phase, you will be regularly attending squad ceremoniesEngage and motivate your squad with using the product vision and benefits to end usersPerks...Equity Uncapped paid annual leaveGiveback days, culture of recognition Generous L&D budgetParental Leave & Flex workPet friendly officesWhat we are looking for in you...Strong experience as a Senior Product Owner / Manager in an agile environmentFintech experienceStartup/scaleup experience Ability to build and manage product requirements for a cross-functional squadAbility to showcase product features and articulate their value to internal & external audienceExperience of balancing priorities in a complex, rapidly evolving environmentAbility to maintain stability for stakeholders in a volatile environmentStrong understanding of good UX principles Skills & Personality Get shit done mentality Friendly, go-getting attitude Obsessed with the customer & their journey Ability to gain the trust of engineers & designers & get them to work in harmony Ability to juggle multiple tasks at onceAlthough experience in Fintech is highly desirable, if you have had a hand in building awesome products in other industries - we would still love to speak to you!

title: Product Manager
description:
Are you a Managed Fund Product Maestro who would love to work for a growing, purpose led ASX listed company? This could be the opportunity you’ve been looking for!About UsAustralian Ethical is Australia’s original and fastest-growing super fund and ethical investment manager. We are ASX-listed with over $8 billion in funds under management and offer a selection of award-winning managed funds and superannuation products.Our purpose is to invest for a better world, and we have been pioneers in this space for over 30 years. For us, investing has two aims – generating solid financial returns and a positive impact for people, planet, and animals. At Australian Ethical, we prove that money can be a force for good. We do this by staying true to our purpose, which is embedded throughout our organisation and drives our everyday activities as a business, investor, brand, employer, and corporate citizen. We’re a registered B Corp and fully committed to an inclusive, equitable and forward-thinking workplace culture.Your New RoleIn this role you will be an integral part of the Product team providing technical expertise and leadership for all aspects of work with respect to our managed fund product portfolio. You’ll ensure our existing products are competitive in market, deliver on CVP, meet legislative and regulatory obligations, deliver on commercial outcomes and uphold our core values and beliefs. In addition to oversight of existing offerings, you’ll offer technical inputs for the product pipeline and future opportunities.Key responsibilities include:Implementing the product strategy for the managed fund investment portfolioIdentifying, designing and implementing product development and changes to features and pricingOptimising customer experience and identifying opportunitiesEvaluating competitiveness, cost and pricing and providing recommendations of solutions and improvementsManaging ongoing obligations in view of legislative and regulatory changesReviewing, updating and signing off on disclosure documents and marketing collateralKey vendor management, oversight of deliverables and ensuring ongoing efficacyPreparation of service level, vendor, product and board reports About YouWhether you’re at a boutique fund manager, or with one of the big investment houses you’re a technically strong, yet hands on product manager who inherently understands end to end product management. You’re a team player with highly developed interpersonal and relationship management skills who has a track record of successfully working across a business as well as vendors to deliver impactful outcomes in managed funds. If you have all, or most of the following, we’d love to hear from you:5+ years’ financial services experience in product or operations3+ years managed fund product management experienceProven success working across an organisation, and with vendors – including vendor management experienceDeep technical understanding of managed fund products, including end to end product lifecycle and value chainDemonstrated understanding of legislative and regulatory requirements and landscapeRelevant tertiary qualificationsYou can demonstrate and align with our values of: authenticity, wisdom, action and empathyWhat’s in it for youA competitive salary, including short-term and long-term incentives including access to an Employee Share PlanFlexible work arrangementsWellbeing program that includes an extra 5 days of leave above statutory requirementPurpose aligned volunteer days20 days paid annual leave with an additional 3 paid days of annual leave over the Christmas periodTo find out more about what it’s like to work at Australian Ethical, check out this link: https://www.australianethical.com.au/work-with-us/At Australian Ethical we embrace diversity in our people and thinking. We are committed to being an equal opportunities employer and never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We believe supporting greater gender balance is key to our business growth and success, that’s why we’re proud to be one of eight organisations who have committed to the Financial Services Council (FSC) Women in Investment Charter. To find out more see here: https://www.fsc.org.au/policy/investment-management/gender-diversity/women-in-investment-management-charterJoin the TeamIf this role interests you and you'd love to join the Australian Ethical team, apply here via LinkedIn. We look forward to hearing from you!Please note: Only short-listed candidates will be contacted. Applications via and approaches from recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position

title: Product Manager - Canva Docs
description:
Canva’s Commitment and MissionAt Canva, we celebrate diversity. We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key to building the best product, team and company. We look for many different skills and abilities, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So, even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you!Our mission at Canva is to empower the world to design and since launching in 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 110+ million monthly active users across 190 different countries and a team of over 3,400 people… and the best bit is that we’ve only achieved 1% of what we know we’re capable of.Join us and design your future.Product Management @ CanvaThe mission of Product Managers at Canva is to create the most accessible design tool for every person in the world. We believe that we can improve the world by empowering everyone to design and communicate visually.Product Managers collaborate with Canva’s founders to set the strategic direction, scope, and success metrics for product initiatives. We work across teams of designers, software engineers, marketers, and analysts to ensure we're delivering an exceptional experience to all our users. As our product grows, we are responsible for implementing and collaborating on product strategy, road mapping, and prioritisation.It’s our responsibility to see products through their entire lifecycle—from concept through to validation, build, post-launch analytics, and iterations.About The Editing GroupThe Editing group at Canva is responsible for delivering value to users through our world-class design editor. On our mission to empower everyone to design anything, we are always thinking about a wide range of user problems and building features to address a diverse set of use cases for the Canva editor. The Canva Editor empowers our users to do everything from collaborative whiteboarding to creating digital documentation with Canva Docs.The Canva Docs Team is focused on building a visual, engaging document editor that leverages the power of the rest of the Canva platform to deliver a truly unmatched experience for all our users.What You'll DoDefine a clear strategy and roadmap with the team and leadership that will deliver maximum value to Canva Docs usersHelp execute an effective discovery process for Canva DocsWork with designers to solve real problems through flawless user experiencesWork with your team of engineers to set (and hit) crazy, big delivery goals Become a trusted expert in all things online document editing Build relationships with key strategic integration partners, and seek to form new ones that unlock growth for Canva and our usersRecognise the biggest picture, communicate, collaborate, and compromise effectively with collaborators and other PMs for the best outcome for CanvaAbout YouProduct Management experience of a software product, with online document editing product knowledge as a huge plusYou have led large or multiple product teams through discovery and deliveryYou're someone who enjoys leading a team of amazing people to ship innovative solutions - and can point to an impressive record of doing soExceptional UX skills - you understand more than just the fundamentals of good UXAn excellent communicator who can influence cross-functionally with each to achieve big winsGreat with data (both qualitative and quantitative) and loves turning insights into actionsYou thrive on being in the middle of a cross-functional team, wearing lots of hats and doing whatever it takes to help your team and the business succeedWorking at CanvaOur culture is unlike anywhere else and we design your #CanvaLife experience to empower you to do the best work of your life.Whether you’re in the office, working from home or choosing your own adventure, our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include: Equity packages for you to truly be a part of the Canva journey. We have a hybrid work model (in-office & from home), with our offices are always open to you balancing flexibility and connection Flexible leave so you can recharge, give back, support others or focus on your own professional development. Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey. An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance. This is for you to spend on whatever will support your wellbeing and development.. because you know what you need to Vibe and Thrive, better than anyone. Virtual and in-office wellness benefits including Canva University, Employee Assistant Programs and Fitness & Meditation Classes. Canva For Good program matching your not-for-profit donations, Force for Good leave (3 paid volunteering days) and a range of sustainability and ethical initiatives to get involved in.We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. title: Product Manager
description:
The CompanyA household name in Australia for over 60 years, this homewares business has a proud heritage of developing high quality, smart and innovative products. They are embarking on a new phase of growth and as they continue to evolve and transform their business, there is a strong focus on sustainability, the environment and community. Designed and predominantly manufactured in Australia, these award-winning products are sold globally. Become part of this supported, motivated and high performing team.The RoleReporting into the Head of Product, the Product Manager will lead the strategic direction across the product lifecycle for the Food Storage & Kitchenware categories. You will manage and execute new product development through the stage gate process from ideation and presenting a business case through to customer engagement, alignment with broader business strategic objectives and delivery. Strong project management and commercial skills are essential, as is the ability to maintain cross-functional stakeholder engagement. You will be offered flexibility, strong leadership, reward for success and the opportunity to grow.Your BackgroundYou will have:5+ years of product development experience with impressive knowledge of product design, compliance requirements and the more technical elements such as tooling and mouldingA Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant disciplineDeep understanding of the NPD cycle, product manufacturing processes and product designFamiliarity with product standards and regulations relating to plastics manufacturing and sourcingImpeccable project management skills – timelines, budgets, communication skills, critical thinking and negotiation capabilityPassion for product development and using insights to innovateThis is a terrific role. Apply today or call Stephanie Wood on 03 9823 7408 to discuss this further.

title: Product Manager
description:
This is an excellent opportunity for a Product Manager based in Macquarie Park to join our growing Structural Heart team.Reporting to the Marketing Manager you are responsible for developing the Aortic, Mitral and Tricusip transcatheter market. Partnering with the Transcatheter Sales leader, you will implement short and long-term strategic marketing plans for the Transcatheter Valve Intervention business.Main Responsibilities Are, And Not Limited ToDevelop and implement short and long-term strategic marketing plans / new product launch plans, objectives and tactics that lead to maintain market leadership for core productsCollaborate with the Sales team to conduct targeted market development in key marketsDevelop Key Opinion Leaders within Interventional Cardiology, Cardiac Surgery, Heart failure, Echo Cardiology as well as healthcare economists; identify joint working initiatives to increase therapy awareness across multiple channelsIdentify, plan and execute on patient referral strategiesMaintain a high knowledge of the scientific and technical differences between Abbott and competitor products and ensure the Sales Force has a strong working knowledge; build short and long-term sales models based on a solid understanding of the competitive marketplace to support Strategic Plan and Operating PlanKeep up to date with government and industry trends related to product portfolioEffectively manage the aspects of product forecasting, inventory and expiryPartner with the sales force in the preparation and submission of tendersFlexibility to travel is essentialWho We’re Looking ForTertiary qualifications in MarketingMinimum 4 years in a similar Marketing role in healthcare essential; minimum 3 years as a Product Manager requiredGeneral cardiology experience preferred; interventional cardiology is highly advantageousExcellent oral and written communication skills with strong presentation skillsDemonstrated ability to understand and communicate complex technical conceptsExperience in working and leading cross-functional environmentsStrong critical thinking and analytical skillsWillingness to accept challenging assignments and engage in relevant developmental activities in a change environmentHigh willingness to learn and seek continuous improvement opportunitiesMS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and familiarity with web-based applicationsDue to the inherent requirements of the role, the preferred candidate must provide evidence of full COVID-19 vaccination before the commencement date and maintain a fully vaccinated status for the period of employment.What we offer you? Free parking, onsite gym and barista at our Macquarie Park officeWellness ProgramsProfessional and Personal development opportunitiesBeing part of an organisation reputed to be a World’s Top Employer recognised for our workplace culture that values healthy living, diversity and equal opportunityAbbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 115,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.Abbott is committed to building a diverse workforce that values diversity across gender, age, culture, disability and lifestyle.In order to be eligible to work for Abbott in Australia or New Zealand, you must hold current working rights with no restrictions, for the respective country applicable.We ask that recruiters respect our internal recruitment process and PSA panel, and refrain from contacting us, or referring candidates to this role.

title: Product Manager - Manage Teams
description:
Canva’s Commitment and MissionAt Canva, we celebrate diversity. We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key to building the best product, team and company. We look for many different skills and abilities, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So, even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you!Our mission at Canva is to empower the world to design and since launching in 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 110+ million monthly active users across 190 different countries and a team of over 3,400 people… and the best bit is that we’ve only achieved 1% of what we know we’re capable of.Join us and design your future.Product Management @ CanvaThe mission of Product Managers at Canva is to create the most accessible design tool for every person in the world. We believe that we can improve the world by empowering everyone to design and communicate visually. As a Product Manager at Canva you help set this vision, define what that future looks like, and build the products and features that get us there.Product Managers collaborate with Canva’s founders to set the strategic direction, scope, and success metrics for product initiatives. We work across teams of designers, software engineers, marketers and analysts to ensure we're delivering an exceptional experience to all our users. We are responsible for implementing and collaborating on product strategy, road mapping, and prioritisation as our product grows.It’s our responsibility to see products through their entire lifecycle—from concept through to validation, build, post-launch analytics and iterations.About the Manage Teams Group @ Canva The Manage Teams Group is on a mission to empower large teams with flexible configuration and team management capabilities. The group is responsible for driving core product capabilities and seamless user experiences for teams to set up and manage Canva so their team members can thrive! This group is working on a number of exciting initiatives that have a huge impact on Canva’s overall strategy and growth.The People Management team is responsible for all features relating to helping customers to organise people in a team, from team invitations, creating groups, auto-provisioning of users to UX/UI of People Page in Canva. This team owns one of the key strategic pillars for the Manage Teams Group, and plays a critical role in winning large organisations to set up and use Canva. You will also have the opportunity to define the next stage of the People Management vision and the roadmap!What You'll Be DoingDevelop, own and execute the roadmap and strategy for our People Management teamServe as a domain expert on organising people in a Team, to help large organisations provision and manage their users in Canva.Be a leader for your team along with your Design Lead and Engineering Lead, by rallying the team to buy into your product vision and roadmap, and driving the team to work towards the goalsWork alongside a passionate, cross-functional team of engineers, marketers and designers to execute the roadmap and deliver an amazing experience to our users.Work on high priority growth goals for one of our newest Canva worksuite offerings.Set crazy big goals for your team, and hit them!Skills We're Looking ForStrong experience as a product manager of a SaaS software product, with experience working at scale a huge plus.Someone who enjoys leading a team of amazing people to ship innovative solutions - and can point to an impressive record of doing so.A strong communicator - can speak the language of engineering, data, design, operations and can coordinate cross-functionally with each to achieve big wins.Strong UX skill set. Understands more than just the fundamentals of good UX, loves Canva’s seamless and simple design and is going to be ruthless in protecting it.Someone who can generate insight based on vision, data and user feedback, clearly define a direction for a team and then execute in a fast-paced environment to deliver customer value and delightful experiences. An ownership mentality and high agency to get projects from concept to reality as quickly as possible! The ability to move ideas from the chaos of brainstorming and mock-ups to the clarity of execution and impact.What does the first 3-6 months look like?Settle in and learn about your team and how users and admins are using our people management features and their key pain pointsRun the daily PM rituals and work with the team to deliver and launch a number of the exciting features and capabilities for our usersDive deep into the people management vision and user / admin needs, and define a roadmap for the next season.What You'll Learn As a Product Manager At CanvaYou’ll learn how to think big, really big and take 10x bets You’ll learn to focus on the long term whilst making rapid progress in the short term.You’ll learn about working at a founder led company with mission, values and a genuine desire to be a force for good in the world at the heart of everything we do You’ll learn how to build products that serve tens of millions of people all around the worldYou’ll learn how to be a visual thinker. When you think you’ve made something as simple as possible, at Canva you’ll learn how to make it even simplerYou learn how to push the boundaries and use your passion and creativity to solve problem that have never been solvedWorking at CanvaOur culture is unlike anywhere else and we design your #CanvaLife experience to empower you to do the best work of your life.Whether you’re in the office, working from home or choosing your own adventure, our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include: Equity packages for you to truly be a part of the Canva journey. We have a hybrid work model (in-office & from home), with our offices are always open to you balancing flexibility and connection Flexible leave so you can recharge, give back, support others or focus on your own professional development. Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey. An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance. This is for you to spend on whatever will support your wellbeing and development.. because you know what you need to Vibe and Thrive, better than anyone. Virtual and in-office wellness benefits including Canva University, Employee Assistant Programs and Fitness & Meditation Classes. Canva For Good program matching your not-for-profit donations, Force for Good leave (3 paid volunteering days) and a range of sustainability and ethical initiatives to get involved in.We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Company DescriptionWho are Smiling Mind?Smiling Mind is Australia’s leading digital-led, prevention focused mental health, not-for-profit. We are the innovators behind Australia’s most trusted mental wellbeing app, and we have been helping minds thrive for over 10 years by equipping Australians with the essential psychological skills to build their mental fitness. We help people learn these skills in fun and interactive ways that are accessible anywhere and anytime.So far, we’ve reached more than 4 million people through our renowned mindfulness app, as well as more than 220,000 Australian teachers and more than 6 million Australian children and young people through our programs - but this is just the beginning.Imagine if every young person had the skills they needed to thrive, face challenges with resilience and ultimately, suffer less from mental illness. This is our vision for the future and by 2030, we aim to create this generational change in Australia’s mental health.Job DescriptionWHO ARE YOU?Ever looked at our app and thought “they could improve it if they just……” Yes? Great!We’re looking for a UX/UI Designer who is excited to work on our beautiful suite of digital products (app and web platform) which reach our global user base. Our app is loved by users from around the world, and our digital education platform is in classrooms all across Australia.You are a passionate and creative designer, who believes that accessible and impactful digital experiences will be key to realising a generational change in Australia’s mental health; especially for kids. You will have a genuine passion for public health, and an enthusiasm for implementing design solutions which support positive outcomes for all our users, especially kids.You will have experience in interface and experience design, especially for native app and web-based products. Working closely with the Product Managers, your goal is to ensure a great user experience and to deliver on our organisational OKRs.As Smiling Mind’s UX/UI Designer, you will primarily be working closely with the Product team to understand business requirements and to translate them into new solutions, features and sometimes even new products. From time to time, you may also collaborate with the marketing team to apply your expertise to improving the user journey flows in the Smiling Mind website.You will be focused on learning about our digital products, deeply understanding our users and their needs, conducting user research, creating user-friendly wireframes, journey maps and prototypes, and seeing them through to finished designs. You will also be responsible for the development of the digital product style guide and associated documentation.Please note, this role is initially a contract position until the end of 2023, which we hope we will be able to extend.QualificationsWE’RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHOIs a natural problem solver and strategic thinker, who can collaborate and create efficient and effective processes to deliver on the strategy. Has a strong analytical mind and ability to break down problems to design appropriate solutions. Can operate autonomously in solving problemsHas an inquisitive nature, with a high degree of curiosity. You love to collaborate and share your knowledge with the wider team. Has solid communication skills (written and verbal), with a positive attitude to problem solving and ability to work within teams to find solutions. Enjoys working in a multidisciplinary team who collaborate effectively to achieve exceptional results. YOU’VE GOT:3+ years of UX/UI Design experience with strong expertise in app and web design in a product-led organisationA portfolio of professional design work for both web and mobile platforms. Expertise in standard design tools such as FigmaKnowledge of UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. Experience collaborating with Product Managers, Data Scientists and Engineers in a software development environmentAbility to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teamsA clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinkingAbility to research design trends and movements and see how this can potentially be transferred into your workBe passionate about resolving user pain points through great design and to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritise tasks. Additional InformationWe Love People Who…Believe in the purpose and philosophy of Smiling MindHave a desire to have a positive impact on the world – particularly through behaviour change and learning designThe ability to blend agility and pace, with the rigour required to deliver impactful health servicesStrong business acumenA growth mindset and willingness to learnHave attention to detail, accountability, and ability to work to timelines and manage competing tasksA warm, friendly, collaborative, and engaging approach Alignment to our values We're a friendly and highly driven small team with a big dream so expect to be surrounded by people who are passionate about changing the future generations of Australians. 'Smart Hustle' is a state of mind in a not-for-profit, but we are certainly not your standard. Smiling Mind is a high growth, fast paced organisation more akin to a tech start-up than what you might perceive a not-for-profit to be like.We know that strong commercial outcomes equate to greater impact. Our people have tenacity, creativity, and resilience in spades, meaning we punch well above our weight, working together as a tight knit team to achieve great things.You will be expected to use initiative to get the job done, will be challenged to perform at your very best, and in return get the opportunity to learn from inspiring and skilled team members achieving life changing results for our community.Other perks include salary sacrificing and Collingwood based warehouse office which is most definitely dog friendly.It is our goal that Smiling Mind continues to evolve as a culturally safe and welcoming organisation to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children, young people, families, and communities. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply for this position. Smiling Mind is a child safe organisation and is committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of all children, at all times. All offers of employment are subject to satisfactory background checks including, but not limited to, Working with Children Check and Referee Checks.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Our mission at Ofload is to achieve zero waste in trucking by digitising the transport industry.In Australia, currently 30% of trucks drive empty and a further 50% are underutilised amounting to mass inefficiency and detrimental environmental impacts. Since 2020 we have scaled to a team of over 100, removed nearly 5 million empty kilometres from our roads. and have planted over 11 000 trees to offset our carbon footprint in partnership with One Tree Planted.In 2022, we supercharged our growth through the acquisition of logistics experts CIA Logistics, raised $60m in Series B funding and were recognised by the Australian Financial Review as one of Australia's Most Innovative Companies.We are looking to grow our team and welcome people excited by the opportunity to disrupt the logistics industry!What you'll do:Develop a strong understanding of our users through research and user interviewsIdentify key insights and effectively communicate them through personas, journeys, wireframes and prototypesDesign high fidelity, responsive UI designs for hand off to developmentIterate on designs based on feedback and testing with usersActively collaborate within cross functional teams that include other designers, engineers, and product managers, sometimes in different time zonesContribute, grow and maintain our design systemChampion consistency in interaction design across the entire ecosystemRequirementsAbout youYou are someone who:Is driven to solve interesting and complex problems that provide value to humansIs excited to join a bright team of industry disruptorsIs curious with a natural passion for developing their craftHas a strong understanding of user experience and design principlesAsks clarifying questions and challenges assumptionsCan actively seek and receive feedbackIs a penchant for details and organisationSolid practical experience in UX/UI and visual designAbility to own the end-to-end design process on selected topicsStrong understanding of interaction and visual design principles and processesHigh proficiency with relevant software, tooling and methodologies. (eg: Figma, Zeplin, Sketch Adobe programs and/or similar)Excellent communication and ability to collaborate with cross functional teams in tech, product, data or from the wider business to deeply understand the problemExperience working in an Agile environment, helping to navigate ambiguity to influence the design directionExperience contributing and using design systemsBenefitsLife at OfloadAt Ofload, our values are in our DNA and underpin the work we do every day. We are proud of the collaborative, diverse and innovative culture we continue to build. The Ofload team is motivated by a shared ambition to digitise the logistics industry and have a truckload of fun while doing it! As well as the opportunity to join a high-growth organisation with the ability to make a meaningful impact everyday, you will enjoy;Working in a hybrid environment with a split of in-office and working from home. Our philosophy on working is one built around connection, inclusion and flexibility.Holistic wellness support for you and your family through our wellbeing partnership with Acacia ConnectionGenerous parental leave entitlements including 16 weeks primary caregiver leave and continued superannuation contributionsAnnual learning and development budget to support your professional growthPaid volunteer leave to support the causes that matter to youPlus all the exciting perks of joining a startup - epic Ofload swag, weekly catered breakfasts, monthly team lunch, a reward and recognition program and plenty of social events.Ofload is committed to building diverse and inclusive teams, and a culture where people can bring their whole authentic selves to work each day. Applications are highly encouraged from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; and equity target groups including women, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people with disabilities, and people who identify as LGBTIQA+.We endeavour to create an equitable recruitment process with an even playing field for all candidates. If you require any adjustments to be made, please let a member of our recruitment team know.

title: UX / UI Designer
description:
Exciting opportunity for a UX / UI Designer to work on a greenfields mobile app.Join NOVON as out next contracted UX/UI Designer to work on an exciting project based on our customer site. This role will involve you working with a dynamic team on a mobile apps project. It is a fantastic opportunity to further develop your skills. Living our values to Be Innovative, Be Humble and Be Yourself – Become our next NOVONian!Working in a team lead by the Digital Delivery Manager, this UX UI Designer role will involve you working on a greenfields mobile app. You will be responsible for the successful UX UI of digital mobile app developed in React Native. As a UX/UI designer you will work on ensuring that the products are designed with elements of HCD and useability to increase take up of this new mobile application.Tasks You Will Be Involved WithWork closely and collaboratively with key stakeholders and product ownersLead and implement design and ensuring consistency throughout the design process working with UX metrics.Designing a product that meet the needs of the user by engaging with cliental (user interviews, user stories, hifi, lofi)Presenting research to stakeholders and keeping other teams up to date with trendsWorking in an agile environmentExperience creating high-fidelity mock-ups, wireframes and prototypes At NOVON we are an organisation that values the whole consultant and invites you to bring your whole self to work. We reward our teams with not only exciting projects and a positive work environment but also provide great benefits like:Paid parental leaveGifted leave up to an additional 20% on statutory requirementsFormal coaching and mentoringCareer growth and further education/training Get in touch with us to discuss these great opportunities or email your c.v to careers@novon.com.au

title: UX / UI Designer
description:
Mid Level UX / UI DesignerThe Company:We are currently looking for a skilled Mid UX/UI designer in Sydney to join a global leading technology company in a very niche and exciting business. With strong foundations in design and collaboration with companies around the world in the aerial technology space. As part of the team, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology with a focus on designing user-centric solutions, and be a part of a tech revolution! Reporting to the Vice President of Design you will have the opportunity to work closely with their Australian and U.S. teams, gaining global exposure and experience on complex projects.About the Role:Overall, as a UX/UI designer, you will be responsible for creating designs that are not only visually appealing but also highly usable and user-friendly.In this role, you will be responsible for conducting user research, creating user personas, developing wireframes, designing prototypes, creating high-fidelity designs, conducting usability testing and collaborating with developers to ensure that the designs are implemented correctly. Responsibilities, Duties and Expectations:Enhance and improve the existing designsDevelop user flows and functional prototypes using design tools such as Figma.Pay close attention to details to ensure a high-quality design.Conduct user testing to gather feedback and insights.Provide a seamless user experience throughout the design process.Adhere to typography and graphic design style standards to maintain consistency.Qualifications and Skills:At least 2 years of experience in UX/UI or Product Design.Bachelor's degree in UX/UI design, Product Design, or a related field.Strong conceptual thinking, interaction, and visual design skills to create effective designs.Excellent communication skills.Preferred experience in website design and/or web development, and the willingness to learn new tools and technologies.Understanding of the software development process and experience working with Agile/Scrum.Ability to handle multiple projects and complete (realistic) deadlines.If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, please don't hesitate to APPLY! For The Latest Jobs, Tech News or to 'Introduce A Friend' for a $1000 Referral Fee - Follow Us On Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroupTheDriveGroup is 100% committed to improving meaningful diversity in the technology industry. We partner with clients who embrace diversity and seek candidates across all backgrounds, abilities, genders, sexualities, cultures, and faiths.If you have the right skills and attitude we would love to hear from you!

title: UI Designer
description:
DescriptionWho are we?Lyka is an Australian founded pet wellness company that’s shaking up an outdated industry and paving the way for happier, healthier pets. Sadly, statistics have shown us that approximately eighty percent of pets are suffering from dental disease, with one in every three being diagnosed with cancer, and forty-one percent overweight. As humans we are acutely aware of the positive impact fresh wholefoods can have on our health and wellbeing, however the same hasn’t always been said for our furry friends. We're on a mission to change that, starting with nutritionally balanced, wholefood meals delivered direct to doors around Australia. As the world’s most sustainable pet wellness company, we’re putting pets and our planet first.Today, we are proud to share we’ve served and fed over 10 million meals to puppers and their parents across Australia, and this is just the beginning. Our vision is to create multiple nutritional products, adding disease prevention meals and supplements, and take Lyka into new markets.Currently, we have a team of 140 pet-obsessed people on our team who share our vision. These carefully selected people are dedicated to building the next generation of technology and products to help empower pet parents to take control over their pet’s wellbeing. To date, we have raised over $40M in funding from our venture fund investments and pet industry insiders, who believe in our mission and ability to drive change in an outdated industry, providing nutrition that nourishes puppers from the inside out.Are you ready to shake things up and give pets the life they deserve? Come join your people.The RoleWe value innovation and creativity in all aspects of product design from concept to execution. As a UI Designer, you will be responsible for creating engaging user interface designs across various web platforms and devices. You should have an eye for clean design with excellent attention to detail. We’re searching for a UI Designer who is early in their career and wants the opportunity to get a tonne of exposure to a broad range of Service and Product Design work. This role will initially (~6 months) focus on building ~150 landing pages however, then have a development opportunity to move into a Product Designer role.Your primary responsibilities include designing landing pages, website graphics, icons, typography elements etc using tools such as Figma or other software programs like Unbounce.RequirementsBachelor's degree in Graphic Design or related field is preferred Proven experience (1-3 years) as UI/UX Designer or similar role Excellent knowledge of Figma and other tools (we currently use Unbounce) Knowledgeable about modern graphic design trends Ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams Strong problem solving skills along with great attention to detail A portfolio demonstrating exceptional ability in graphic design Experience operating in an ever changing business, and comfortable delivering in this environment. Finally, you have got to be passionate about our products and love animals! BenefitsWork in a fast-growing start-up, experiencing what goes behind the scenes to sustain hyper-growth for a start-up with a physical product!Growth and Development – Lyka is growing extremely quickly, which means you will have the opportunity to experience different challenges every day and progressively acquire more responsibilities as our facility and team expands. We provide an annual L&D budget for you to continue your personal development. Work for a sustainability focused company – we care about the health of our dogs & our planet. Not only are we the only Australian carbon-negative pet food company, but we’re also working on offsetting all our staff's plastic use & carbon emissions, too!Be part of a diverse top talent team, coming from widely different backgrounds and geographies12 weeks of paid parental leave for primary carers and 6 weeks for secondary carers, alongside 2 weeks of miscarriage leave in the first twenty weeks. We also offer 18 paid weeks to both primary & secondary carers if you have been at Lyka for over two years. Wellbeing assistance & tools to take care of your mental & physical wellbeing so you can do your best work. Flexible working: work from where you get your best work done. We have pet-friendly offices in Sydney and Melbourne and offer a WFH allowance for your home setup. Pupper parent support to care for your furry friends – flexible arrangements for new pets, pet-friendly offices, discounts & a financial allowance for dog training & care to help them live their best life!The majority of our team are based in Sydney, however we are open to applicants across Australia. We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams.Lyka is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We celebrate diversity, are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

title: UI/UX Designer (Expressions of Interest)
description:
At Bilue, we're always on the look out for talented designers to join our team and even though we're not actively hiring for this role, we'd love to connect and stay in touch for future opportunities.Perhaps you're not currently looking for a new role either, but interested to know more about the kind of work we get up to, our current design team and everything else happening at Bilue!By completing your details below, we'll add you to our Design Talent Community so you're kept up to date with any events we think you might be interested in, and kept top of mind for opportunities which match your skillset and capability.About Bilue:For 12+ years we have worked with some of Australia’s biggest brands, delivering innovative experiences. Originally founded in mobile development, Bilue is now a design and technology leader across mobile, cloud, web, enterprise integrations, TV and emerging technologies.We offer the end-to-end capabilities of a large agency with the attitude and approach of a nimble independent. We create multi-disciplined teams that form close collaborative relationships with our clients and third party vendors.Bilue = Big + Blue OceanThe philosophy behind this came from the early days when we viewed companies that weren't investigating mobile technologies as landlocked. We saw them as being stuck where they are, not able to move forward, not off exploring.This was and still is an opportunity for us to seize, because at Bilue, we see ourselves as shepherds. Taking our clients confidently out into the Big Blue Ocean where we can explore new opportunities together.Our vision is to 'mobilise millions' with our mission to unlock exponential growth for our clients, by creating inspired experiences on intelligent platforms. We strive for excellence, but we thrive on human connection, putting people at the heart of business transformation.We visualise ideas. Fast. Prototyping enables rapid feedback and iterative development. We then design beautiful, elegant interfaces that scale perfectly across multiple devices.In order to be considered for a role in our design team, you must have:Minimum 3-4 years commercial experience working on the UX/UI design of native mobile and web productsA solid baseline understanding of principles in both UI and UX design in:Preparing, running and processing user research and interviewsMapping - information architecture, user journeys, value propositions and personasIdeation of solutions, in collaboration with senior staff, client and technical stakeholdersPrototyping - low, mid and high fidelity clickable prototypesUser testingUser Interface designCompleted both qualitative and quantitative research and understand how findings convert into a market solution within real world business constraintsExperience interacting with stakeholders, both internal and externalPractical experience with Agile methodologies including design sprints and rapid prototypingNB. Must have full working rights within AustraliaInstagram: @bilue.officialWebsite: https://bilue.com.au

title: User Experience Designer
description:
At Stomble we're an exciting startup looking for a talented UX & UI Designer to join our team. We are a company with a strong core value, belief in culture and driving the best possible experience to our users. We value people who bring fresh new ideas, strategies, enthusiasm and love what they do. Our mission is to increase the awareness of businesses globally. This is our core driver for why we as an organization do what we do and why we create the change we are striving for. We believe that building the infrastructure for today will provide opportunities for those of tomorrow.Responsibilities:Working with Figma. (Essential)Cross functional team discussions.Develop and present documentation, user flows, annotated wireframes, and interactive prototypes.Research.Ability to apply design thinking to any situation and flow.The team will require you to help find solutions to current and future designs.We will teach and work very closely with you so you can develop and improve your skills. You'll have the opportunity to learn from other team members within Stomble with many opportunities to get your hands dirty working on real projects, you will be given challenging problems to solve, whilst being encouraged to find solutions. Your role will include:· Working closely with our engineering team to design and solve challenging problems.· Working on Figma to design low, mid and high-fidelity wireframes.· Working in cross functional team environments.· Ability to break down challenging problems.- Researching and learning. As a designer at Stomble, you will be implementing features and functionalities which will be driving us and our user forward. Your skills and knowledge will empower, create and drive our UX/UI team to design, fix and curate better ways to drive engagement with our customers. Your involvement in our design team is critical to our success. This is perfect for you if you:Have strong background in creative thinking and problem solving.Can devise strategies.Have strong verbal and written communication skills.Have strong knowledge of psychology.Design and have worked on previous projects previously.Have a strong desire to learn, ask questions and grow as a designer.MUST have 1-2 years experience in Figma (advantageous).MUST have knowledge on design principles.Dedicated to learning, improving and working with an exceptional team.Do not apply if you:Are not an Australia Resident, citizen or located in the country.Cannot participate in an unpaid internship. The most exciting part of working at Stomble is that you will be a part of the founding team, helping to build an incredible culture and atmosphere that makes our business strive. This is a full-time position, and you must be available to work for a minimum of 4-6 months in duration. If this sounds like you, we are excited to hear from you!

title: Product UX/UI Designer
description:
Come join one of the world’s fastest growing tech startups in mining!CorePlan is the world's only digital operations platform for mining. We’re not only empowering and modernising the way that people in mining work together, but making it smarter than ever before imagined.Since 2020, we have seen phenomenal business growth for us with over 10x the number of customers which includes brands such as Chalice, BHP and Sandfire.Our team is small but we are gearing for growth to double our team size so we can scale across mining here, in Australia, and internationally.What your role is:You will be part of the product development process from the get-go. You will lead the product discovery and design process for our mobile app and web platform, translating user workflow pain points into product design solutions.You will join a tight-knit product team that values good design and prides themselves in shipping the modern, intuitive software that our users know and love.What you will be doing:Become a product expert: gain a thorough understanding of the industry we play in, our end users, and why they choose to use (and love) our softwareUser research and discovery: map out user journeys, workflows and pain-points based on a thoroughly researched understanding of the different job roles of our customers and frame them as design problems to be solvedProduct design: design world-class, user-centric solutions all the way from conceptualisation, to user acceptance, to high-fidelity prototypesMaintain design standards: define and maintain product design standards and principles, ensuring they are consistent and follow modern web and mobile application best-practicesGuarantee product quality and success: gather user feedback and iterate on designs through data-driven feedback processesCommunicate and collaborate with internal teams for continuous feedback and stakeholder alignmentWe're looking for each other if you:Are a master at Figma Have demonstrable at least 2 years end-to-end experience in the delivery of design projects, from conceptualisation to productionHave a deep understanding of modern product discovery practices and love conducting them: user interviews, user acceptance testing, etc.Believe in user-centric design and value simplicity in solving design problemsAre able to communicate concepts and solutions effectively in a way that clearly articulates the reasoning behind design decisionsRecognise the importance of a smooth user experience: you have a passion for streamlining both software and workflow processesAlways strive for both professional and personal self-improvement: you’re inherently curious and you’re always learningHave a strong understanding of the software development process: experience of Agile/Scrum is a plusWhy you should care about this role:You’ll be innovating for a modern software platform which is revolutionising the mining industry - by understanding the need to put users firstInteresting design problems in unique environments across a wide variety of user rolesAutonomy and ownership over the work you do, with flexible working hoursA laid-back but professional workplace with a team of extraordinary, motivated and fun co-workersA brand-spanking-new MacbookWhy CorePlan?We are a modern SaaS startup born out of Western Australia and having achieved product-market fit in 2020, we are ready to rapidly scale the business.Expect autonomy, responsibility and problem solving like you've never imagined, in a growth-focused environment. We work with impact, surrounded by like-minded people who are unusually committed and who love what they do.Our mission at CorePlan is to help people in the mining industry work better together in the modern age. And, that’s why we have built the world’s easiest to use (and only) digital operations platform for mining.How to ApplyApplying is simple, but like with all good things, it takes time. While we know your resume looks great, our company culture is a big part of who we are and so we’d like to know a bit about who you are. Please, do us (and yourself) a favour by telling us how great you are so that we can skip the formalities and get down to business!

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
We're looking for contractors with passion and purpose to advocate for the customer through human-centred design.About Thought CollaborativeWe are a boutique Human-Centred Design agency. We help teams grow, consult and we have a passion for making a difference in the work lives of our team so that they can drive long term impact on our clients. We give our clients the power to ideate, create, and deliver products and services that serve customers to achieve their goals. We solve challenges that range from visual designs all the way to an abstract thought or idea. We solve these through facilitated collaboration. That is why we call ourselves Thought Collaborative.WE USE OUR CRAFT FOR SOCIAL IMPACTWe empower parents in developing nations with business principles so that they can create their own economic opportunities and transform their communities. In other words, we user our customer-centred design skills to help communities design chicken coops, market stalls, schools and more.About The ClientOur client is one of Australia’s largest financial institutions that is a household name. This organisation has been at the forefront for development Human-Centred Design in their field and continues to value and invest in their capability.About The WorkAn Experience Designer helps define customer journeys to ensure a consistent and valuable experience for customers and staff. They help achieve through the application of style and aesthetics to ensure that digital interfaces are easy to understand, engaging, consistent and on brand, whilst aligning to backend operations, processes, data and infrastructure.As a senior Experience Designer, you will be working with a multidisciplinary team of squad members and business stakeholders focussed on designing simple and seamless experiences. You will work closely with the project team members and be expected to present to stakeholders/partners/clients and work collaboratively with your team to improve our customers financial wellbeing.About Your Skills 4+ years of design experience across digital experiences. A strong background in Visual and UX design. Solid knowledge of UI design principles and techniques. Ability to perform in a fast paced, high stress design process. Confidence with a range of design software tools (e.g. Figma, Adobe Suite) whilst being open and adaptive to new trends and technologies. Good stakeholder management, storytelling and influencing skills. Ability to present messages in a clear, concise, and articulate manner. Coach and guide teams to apply a design led approach when developing solutions. A growth mindset, resilient nature, and an ability to cope and support others during uncertainty Commercially savvy with strong results focus.Most of all we want someone that plays nicely with others and puts the people at the heart of their designs. By people, we mean both your team, stakeholders and the user.How To ApplyInterested? Great, apply with your CV, examples of your work and a brief cover letter as to why you are the right fit.Web: hit apply in this advertisementEmail: careers@thoughtcollaborative.com.au
